Just the things that caught my eye are worth hundreds of millions of Zeni.
I calculated the risk and return in case of theft, as a reflex.
"...Customer."
"Oh, yes."
I must have looked silly because I was thinking about something guilty.
"I have a membership card."
As I was about to pull the golden card out of my pocket, the female staff shook her head.
"Cid Kagenou has a face pass. Welcome to our shop. We also have a VIP
room in the back..."
She directed her beautiful odd eyes to the seats in the back.
"No, I'll take the counter."
I hesitated for a moment, but after all, when it comes to spies, the counter is a must.
"Understood. I will guide you."
"Excuse me... Have we met somewhere?"
When I called out to her with her back turned, she turned around with a surprised face.
She has odd eyes of gold and silver, and she's a half-elf with black hair.
"I met you at Mitsugoshi Company before."
"Oh, I think you were next to Gamma."
"It's an honor to be remembered. My name is Omega. This way, please."
I was led by Omega and sat at the counter.
I recognize the bartender too. A blonde short-haired elf in men's clothing.
"Did we meet at Mitsugoshi Company too?"
"It's an honor. My name is Chi."
"I'm Cid Kagenou."
"Of course, I know."
Chi gives a calm bow, but for some reason, her fingertips are trembling slightly.
Maybe she doesn't have much experience as a bartender. I wonder if it's okay for a high-class shop.
"The order is..."
What I want to order is decided. The mood is that of a certain spy movie agent.
"...Vodka Martini."
I said in a resonant bass voice.
"Shaken, not stirred."
It's important to have a dignified attitude like a seasoned veteran at times like this.
You can't let them know it's your first time in a place like this. On the contrary, you should put silent pressure on them as if you were testing them.
"Shaken Vodka Martini, got it."
Chi's expression tightens.
She takes a deep breath and makes a cocktail with her trembling hands.
Maybe trembling hands are necessary for making cocktails.
I was curious and watched, her hands kept trembling more and more.
"I see..."
I'm not familiar with cocktails, so it was a learning experience.
A skilled bartender needs a trembling fingertip.
Thinking that far, I suddenly realized.
Did vodka even exist in this world in the first place?
"...That's  strange."
Chi's shoulders twitched.
No, it's not about you.
It's strange that vodka exists in this world in the first place.
Why... and there's no need to think about it. The answer is decided.
"So you drink Vodka Martini, huh."
I was spoken to from behind.
A beautiful voice, as clear as a ringing bell. I recognize it without having to turn around.
"...Alpha?"
"It's been a while."
"Yeah."
When I met her after a long time, she seemed a bit more mature.
Beautiful golden hair with blue eyes. The simple dress suits the bar's atmosphere perfectly.
"You didn't like strong drinks, did you?"
"Did I say that?"
"No, but you never seemed to enjoy drinking."
Sharp.
I don't really understand the taste of alcohol in general. I only drink because it seems cool.
"It's not that I dislike it."
"Right. You don't like it."
Alpha smiled slightly.
"Sorry to keep you waiting, here's your Vodka Martini."
Chi placed a cocktail in front of me with a trembling hand.
The tremor is even sharper. What an incredible professional skill.
"I'll have a Manhattan."
"...Understood."
The Manhattan that Alpha ordered should be a whiskey-based cocktail.
But there's no way whiskey exists in this world.
"Has the whiskey been completed?"
I pretended to know and tried to test her.
"It's finally done. It's not on the market yet, but it should be sold at a high price. The aristocrat of the Vegalta Empire who tasted it valued the bottle at 2 million Zeni."
"Is that so..."
As expected, they were doing it.
I shouldn't have shown off my knowledge about distilled spirits.
"It's thanks to your knowledge."
"Indeed..."
That's absolutely true.
I drank the Vodka Martini in one gulp out of desperation.
"...How does it taste?"
"It's okay."
It just tasted like alcohol.
"Hehe..."
Alpha smiled faintly.
"What's wrong?"
"Nothing. I'm just happy."
"What are you happy about?"
"That suit. You finally wore it."
"Huh, right."
"I ordered it. The material is black silk."

The black silk comes from a silkworm that is far larger, more ferocious, and more poisonous than the silkworms of my previous life. Its silk is a high-grade material that can only be procured by skilled hunters.
"I'll let you off the hook for the promise you forgot."
Saying that, Alpha gazed at me in my suit with a happy look.
I had no idea what promise I had forgotten.
"...Sorry to keep you waiting, here's your Manhattan."
"Thanks."
Alpha seemed to be in a good mood today.
She took a sip of the Manhattan and nodded.
"It would be better if it was aged a bit more, but it's not bad."
Alpha put the glass down and looked at me.
"It's unusual for you, who dislikes alcohol, to come to a bar. Did something happen?"
"Hm? Not really... I found my membership card in my room."
"You're worried about eavesdroppers? Don't worry, you can talk about anything in this place. There are only related people here."
The atmosphere around her became serious. This must mean she's willing to play the spy game with me.
"I see...what happened to that mission?"
"...That mission, huh."
She said with a serious face.
"The situation in the Oriana Kingdom has been reported as it was."
"Ah, I read that in three seconds while completing the mission."
A large number of reports from Shadow Garden arrive regularly.
They are all written in ancient characters that I don't understand, so I dispose of them by burning them as soon as they arrive.
"Three seconds...are you speeding up your brain processing speed?"
I silently put my mouth to the glass.

"You still can't talk about that technology, can you? I understand that it requires advanced skills. The burden on the brain and the risks when it fails...indeed, we can't handle it yet. But we are faithfully following your guidance and continuing to train. Please teach us when the time comes."
"...I'm counting on you."
"I won't let you down. Absolutely...!"
"So, what about that mission?"
"The plan is going smoothly. Rose Oriana has decided to fight as a queen."
"Everything is going according to the original plan."
"From the moment you first made contact with her, you could see this outcome. I was jealous because you seemed to care about her a lot."
Alpha said in a joking tone.
"She's a necessary piece for the plan."
"...I understand. It's necessary to drag them onto the stage."
"The stage?"
"What's wrong?"
"No, nothing. I was just reconsidering things from various perspectives, and considering the worst possibilities that could occur in the near future."
"You really can see all the possibilities, can't you? But, could you also pay a little more attention to us...no, never mind."
Alpha started to say something but then stopped.

"You haven't changed since the old days. You've always been chasing a big dream. A dream that's too big for us to grasp even a fraction of it...but the preparations are finally coming together, right?"
"If you look far ahead, it's still just a small step."
"I know. The Oriana Kingdom is progressing with reform by incorporating Shadow Garden's capital and technology. Leave this matter to me.
It's going smoothly for now."
"I see. If it's going smoothly, that's good."
"Oh, and, I've changed the code of the ancient characters."
Alpha handed me several pieces of paper. The incomprehensible codes were densely written, and I couldn't help but frown.
"Was the code deciphering table too easy for you?"
I can't, my eyes are getting blurry.
"I'll order a glass of apple juice."
I put the paper in my pocket and say,
"Eh? Ah, yes, apple juice it is."
Chi looked surprised.
"Continuing with the story, about the incident at Midgar Academy. I received a report from Zeta. Finally."
Alpha said with a sigh.
"She's always late. You should say something to her too."
"She has her own way of doing things."
"You spoil her too much. But it's also true that we were able to annihilate the Fenrir faction thanks to her."
"The Fenrir faction?"
"It seems she had investigated everything from the hidden hideout to the escape route beforehand. After you defeated Fenrir, they were annihilated in less than half a day. She's too efficient."
"I see."
It's about that terrorist.

"This time we had the incident in the Oriana Kingdom, so we had fewer people we could move. Zeta, 559, and a few Numbers, just these people were able to annihilate the Fenrir faction in half a day. I can't believe it. Since it's her, there might be something she hasn't reported."
Alpha let out another big sigh.
"You should tell her too. To report properly. And not to overdo it."
"Hmm."
"Absolutely."
"Sorry to keep you waiting, here's your apple juice."
"Hmm!"
Delicious.
They're using good apples.
"Speaking of the terrorist incident, I remembered something..."
I remembered what Christina-san had talked about in class today.
"There's a student council vice president named Eliza at our school, and she assaulted students and did various things in the confusion of the incident."
"Eliza...Ah, that major aristocrat."
"Yes, it seems that the knight's order is investigating the incident caused by Vice President Eliza, but it seemed like she'd been acquitted."
"Do you want her to be found guilty? If you wish..."
"No, it's not like that. Whether she's guilty or not is irrelevant to me. But, even though there's testimony and evidence, to be acquitted is just..."
I'm envious.

"That's right... Just as you say, the corruption in the Kingdom of Midgar is severe. Given the size of the country, the roots may be deeper than in the Oriana Kingdom. Marquis Brad Dakuaikan, the father of Eliza Dakuaikan, is the leader of a faction that can be considered a symbol of corruption."
"Hmm."

"The faction is called the "Thirteen Night Swords". They are, as their name suggests, a secret society composed of thirteen influential people in the Midgar Kingdom. They are also known as the shadow rulers of the Midgar Kingdom, and have deep ties with the Diabolos Cult and other criminal organizations. Eliza Dakuaikan is acquitted because of Brad Dakuaikan's instructions."
"Shadow rulers, huh."

"The man who was probably directly involved in the handling of the incident is Count Goethe Moono. He is the last seat of the "Thirteen Night Swords", Brad Dakuaikan's confidant, and the ace of the prosecution. Crimes committed by nobles are handled under his jurisdiction. I suppose it will be dismissed this time without conclusive evidence."
Alpha showed me a sketch and a written profile.
So this is Goethe Moono. He has a rather evil face. I also look at the resumes of the other twelve.
"Witnesses, testimonies, and evidence are all in place?"
"It's always like that. No matter what the case, it gets covered up when it comes to him."
"Ho?"

"Not only Goethe Moono. The other "Thirteen Night Swords" also monopolize power and corrupt the Midgar Kingdom. No one can intervene because of their connection with the church, so they continue without opposition."
"The "Thirteen Night Swords"... I'm jealous... they're bad guys."
"I plan to deal with them eventually, but right now I'm busy with the reform of the Oriana Kingdom. I intend to let them swim for a while."
"I see..."
This is what great noblemen from another world are like.
Shadow rulers who are acquitted no matter how much evil they commit.
"...I've got a good idea. Thank you, Alpha."
I finish my apple juice and stand up.
"You look like you're having fun. What are you going to do?"
"...You'll find out eventually."
"I see. Contact me again if something comes up."
Alpha's figure disappears into the mist.
Impressive.
That's quite a cool exit.
"Put it on my tab."
Leaving those words behind, I disappear into the darkness of the night.
Count Goethe Moono looked up suddenly and looked out the window.
The night cityscape of the Midgar Kingdom was illuminated by street lights. He felt like he was being watched...
"Was it just my imagination?"
He muttered and returned to his paperwork.
The fireplace crackled as the pen moved over the documents, bringing some noise to the quiet night.
He put down his pen and took a sip of his cold coffee.
"Cold and yet, this fragrance. This is indeed the highest quality beans from Mitsugoshi."
He nodded in satisfaction several times, and then turned his eyes to the documents on the table.
They were a summary of the flow of the Eliza Dakuaikan incident, the cost of the cover-up operation, and the people to be bribed or eliminated.
It seems that we can get her acquitted this time too, but it wasn't an easy job.
There were too many witnesses.
In particular, it was quite the blow to be witnessed by Alexia Midgar, a member of the royal family, and Christina Hope, a great nobleman's daughter.
How much debt did we have to create to overturn the testimony of those two?
Goethe stood up and stared out the window. The face of a middle-aged man, resembling a tired frog, was reflected in the window glass.
"I will make you pay the appropriate price, Lord Dakuaikan."
Indeed, this time it was tough.
There are still people to be dealt with.
There's a lower-class noble witness named Kanade, but if left alone, she will eventually become a nuisance.
But Goethe's specialty is paperwork and adjusting interest relationships.
Leaving the rough work to the other "Thirteen Night Swords" would work out better.
"Well, it's fine. I'm getting tired of being at the bottom rank of the Night Swords. They should prepare a suitable position for me."
Goethe is still in his thirties, despite his appearance.
He joined the "Thirteen Night Swords" to succeed his late father, but being the youngest member, he was given tedious tasks.
There were many mysteries about his father's death. It was treated as an accident, but Goethe hasn't forgotten the stab wound on his back.
"...The truth is in the darkness. That's okay."
Eliza's case, and my father's case, the essence is the same. If you try to uncover the darkness, you will know firsthand what will happen.
Goethe moved away from the window and rang the bell on the table to call a servant. If he puts a seal on the documents and sends them to Marquis Dakuaikan...
He felt a gaze and looked up.
It was his usual familiar workroom. There should have been no one else there.
But, there was a clown.
Before he knew it, it was sitting on the sofa.
Illuminated by the light of the fireplace, the blood-soaked clown was quietly looking at Goethe.
"Wh... what the...! How long have you been there!?"
Goethe rang the bell in haste.
"Someone!! Get him out of here quickly!!"
The high-pitched bell echoed in the quiet night.
"Hey, isn't anyone there?!"
Only Goethe's angry voice and the sound of the bell echoed in vain.
The blood-soaked clown just stared at the panicked Goethe without moving.
"Hey... isn't anyone there!?"
It's strange.
More than enough time had passed since he first rang the bell. Usually, the guards would come right away.
It was a quiet night.
No... it was too quiet a night.
"...Could it be..."
The bell slipped out of Goethe's hand and fell to the floor.
The clown slowly stood up.
The blood dripping from its hand was still fresh.
The sound of its footsteps was strange. Blood footprints were left on the expensive rug.
"Could it be... you... the people in the mansion... Ah..."
The blood-soaked clown didn't answer. With a crescent-shaped smile stuck to its mask, it just stared at Goethe.
With a small scream, Goethe backed away.
The clown closed the distance with a splashing sound.
"Wh... who are you, why... Do you think you can get away with laying a hand on me?!"
The clown didn't answer.
As if mocking Goethe's bluff, the clown slowly closed the distance with another splashing sound.
Suddenly, the image of his father's dead face came back to Goethe's mind.
"Could it be... could it be... you're trying to get rid of me!? You... you're going to cut me off, the "Thirteen Night Swords"... after all I've contributed to the organization...!!!"
The clown stopped with a splat...
The footsteps stopped.
The blood-soaked clown was looking down at Goethe with a smile from behind its mask.
"Could it be... like my father... me..."
The clown's footsteps started again with a splat...
They were clearly getting faster. At a fast pace, within reach...
"Hee... don't come, don't come aaaaah!!"
Goethe threw his coffee cup.
The cup hit the clown's mask and broke, spilling black liquid.
Goethe turned around and ran.
His grades at the Magic Sword Academy had been excellent. His body was fat and sluggish, but he could move much faster than ordinary people.
In an instant, Goethe reached the door of the room and opened it with a force.
If he runs straight to the Knights...
He can escape... It was the moment he held out hope.
"Hic... aaaaaah!"
However, Goethe was pushed down by the existence on the other side of the door.
"What are you doing, get out of the way!"
He struggled desperately and crawled out.
Then he noticed the blood that was stuck to his body and knew what it was that had pushed him down.
"You guys are... security... ah..."
It was the dead body of a guard.
Although his behavior was bad, he had hired magic swordsmen with exceptional skills for a lot of money.
They had been brutally killed.
"Hee... aaaaaaaaaah!"
Goethe kicked the body and crawled out.
The clown's footsteps stopped, with a splat, right next to his ear.
When he looked up, the clown's mask was looking down at him.
"Ah, ah... ah..."
In his hand, the clown held a single playing card.
"Stop... ah..."
With a crush, the playing card pierced Goethe's forehead.
Goethe opened his eyes wide as if he had seen something unbelievable, and touched the card sticking out of his forehead.
He slowly fell backwards.
Looking down at the blood spreading on the floor, the clown muttered.
"One down..."
His voice echoed in the quiet night.

c2.text: Dawn came for Christina in the Hope Manor, located within the royal capital of Midgar.
For her, sleeping in the dorms or at home was essentially up to how she felt that day. Recently, however, she had been spending all her nights at home.
This was not a question of her mood, but a matter of self-defense.
"So it's morning already, huh..."
After noticing the rays of sunlight filtering in through the gaps in the curtains, Christina looked up.
There were faint black circles under her eyes. It would seem the details of the incident had been haunting her dreams.
Christina placed her pen on the table and vigorously stretched herself.
Then, she picked up her notes and sighed.
"It would seem that getting her found guilty will be very difficult, huh..."
While these notes summarized the critical facts and testimony of the incident, under the present circumstances, Eliza's actions would be judged as an accident and not as a criminal case.
A group of teenage students had been embroiled in a life-threatening terror attack, and under the immense pressure they had lost their cool and an unfortunate accident had occurred.
Apparently that was the angle they were going with.
"Goethe Moono is the one hiding the evidence and fabricating the facts. I can't believe the "Thirteen Night Blades" have so much influence."
Since concealing and falsifying evidence was their stock in trade, she had no doubts that they would commit murder without hesitation if the need arose.
In truth, Christina could sense an unsettling presence around her, which was why she was sleeping in her family manor.
"The rot is growing. I can't do anything about it with my power alone.
Even if I mobilized the power of the Hope family..."
Her father had shown no interest in the matter. "What good would helping a minor noble's daughter?" he had said, Everyone had chosen to avert their eyes from the matter of the corruption.
It was precisely because The Thirteen Night Blades had their power that their brutal ways had been overlooked.
"I need... more power..."
Whether it was authority, force of arms, wealth, or the backing of a powerful organization... as long as you had power, you could do anything you wanted. That was the state of this country now.
"What good would helping a minor noble's daughter... huh?"
It would not affect the situation at all.
The world would not change because of it.
As a noblewoman, she understood that what her father said was correct.
However, that did not imply that she had accepted such a fact.
She could not accept this sense of powerlessness, of being unable to punish someone that had blatantly committed wrongdoings.
Neither could she accept the disappointment of not being able to help the girl who had come to her for aid.
Not even Christina knew how to deal with those feelings.
Could she slay those evildoers if she had enough power?
For instance... yes, if she had Shadow's power.
Christina envisioned how she would use that overwhelming might to defeat the Thirteen Night Swords, to cut down the wicked, to protect the weak and to defend the nation.
At that point, Christina couldn't help but laugh at herself.
"...I should just forget about it."
This would only make her more miserable.
She exhaled heavily and closed her sleepy eyes.
After that, in order to take her mind off the subject, she put the documents on Eliza and the Thirteen Night Swords back into her drawer and took out another set of documents.
"Shadow... and Shadow Garden..."
The new set of documents Christina had retrieved contained what she had managed to learn regarding Shadow Garden.

"Shadow Garden's activities were only discovered a year ago, but their detailed situation is unclear. Back then, Shadow was regarded as the organization's leader... but the details on that are also unclear. They really are a collection of mysteries."
She flipped noisily through the documents.
They contained many abandoned arrest warrants and newspaper cuttings.

"The information collection in the northern part of the kingdom isn't very good. Even though Shadow has been confirmed to be active in the region, the number of portraits of him is few and the quality of those are poor."
As she grumbled to herself, Christina's mood improved as she read through the documents.
"With a weighty mission on his shoulders, he walks along a blood-drenched road, unable to return to the sunlit world... Yet they are able to strike down evil, unlike us..."
And then she laughed at herself again.
Suddenly, there was a knock on the door.
"I'm coming in."
A middle-aged man entered the room.
Christina used her skills as a magic swordsman to their greatest extent and slipped those documents back into her desk with all the speed she could muster.
"Good morning... Father..."
"Not getting enough sleep, are you, Christina?"
"No, I was just thinking about some things. Is something the matter?"
"I believe you know well enough not to anger the Thirteen Night Swords.
Becoming enemies with them will be very troublesome."
Christina nodded silently. This was the only form of resistance she could muster.
"Things are going to become unstable soon. If we do anything foolish, not even I can tell what will happen to the Hope family."
"Father, what exactly has become unstable?"
"Ah, I didn't tell you, did I?"
Her father sighed before continuing.
"Goethe Moono is dead."
"All the nobles are in an uproar. The Night Swords are out for blood. The entire royal capital has become unstable."
Christina watched as her father left, and quickly proceeded to the scene of the crime after changing her clothes.
Alexia was pacing back and forth in the Moono Manor.
"There are bloody footprints here too...
A set of reddish-black footprints continued down the carpet.
"Alexia-hime, please do not touch the crime scene. The evidence hasn't..."
"I know that."
Alexia glared at the knight watching her.
"Alexia-hime!!"
Alexia turned back to look at the person who had called out to her.
"Christina."
There stood Christina, the person she had come to know during the previous incident.
"I heard Goethe Moono was dead... What happened here?"
She tried to calm her breathing as she asked her question.
"It looks like someone killed him. The knight orders are investigating the scene."
"I see..."
"Since I can't enter the crime scene yet, I'm investigating the corridor."
"The corridor?"
"Yup. Don't you think these footprints are really weird?"
Alexia pointed to the bloody footprints on the corridor as she spoke.
"You mean how they're very clear?"
"That's strange too, but what's even more strange is how the culprit didn't seem worried at all. They had already killed several people, but they were still walking like everything was normal."
Alexia began walking at the same pace as the footprints.
"Or rather, they seemed to be moving very slowly."
"That's really strange, right? Normally, people would take the opportunity to flee. Maybe they're wrong in the head or something."
"Perhaps they were absolutely confident of not being caught or something."
"...You might not be wrong."
"What do you mean?"
"Goethe Moono was silenced by the Thirteen Night Swords."
"You mean..."
"He stood out too much in this whole affair, so it wouldn't be strange if he was eliminated."
"But why did they pick this time to do it..."
"That's the part that I don't get..."
Just as the conversation stalled out, the knight on sentry duty called out to Alexia.
"Alexia-hime, we have permission to enter the crime scene."
"Let's go, then."
"Alright."
The knight supervisor guided Alexia and Christina to the scene of the crime.
"I am the site supervisor, Gray of the Knight Order Investigation Branch.
Please refrain from touching the corpses or moving anything."
"Understood."
"I will be carrying on with my work, then. Please inform me if anything happens."
"Yeah."
The first thing that hit them upon entering the room was the incredible stench of blood.
That was only to be expected.
There were several corpses beyond the doorway, and further within was Count Goethe Moono, face up with blood flowing down his head.
"He died from a single strike between his eyes. However, the murder weapon was quite unusual..."
Alexia said this as she squatted by the corpse.
There were other members of the knight order working hurriedly around her.
Christina stood dumbly at the entrance to the room.
"What's wrong, Christina? You can come in."
"Huh? Ah, okay."
Christina snapped out of her daze and then hurriedly entered the room.
"If you're not feeling well, you should go back."
"No, I'm okay. So that thing on the corpse's skull is... a poker card? Its design seems pretty unusual too."
Christina tilted her head as she spoke.
"That's a high-end poker card made by Mitsugoshi. It might even be a limited-run item."
"In other words, we can find out who the buyer is."
"Who knows? For a company of Mitsugoshi's size, even a limited production run might still contain thousands of items."
"Looks like we'll have to spend a lot of time on this, then... Is that an ace of spades?"
Christina murmured to herself as she looked down on Count Goethe.
The count had died with his eyes wide open and a stunned look on his face.
Between his eyes was a poker card, the ace of spades.
The skeleton knight picture on it seemed to symbolize his death.

"Why did they go out of their way to use a poker card... Count Goethe had scored quite well in the academy's tests. Yet someone used this paper card and stabbed it right into the head of a capable magic swordsman, You'd need a lot of mana for that."

"Normal paper sheets have less than a 10% mana conduction rate. You can't compare it to mithril at all. Also, extreme mana control techniques are needed to suppress this resistance. Why would they go out of their way to do something so troublesome?"
"Who knows? However, this cuts down on the range of suspects. The enemy is a magic knight with great mana and great mana control."
"In that case, this might not be a simple murder. Because normally speaking, a killer wouldn't go out of their way to use a poker card."
"They'd have gone for a more efficient method, yes."

"I guess they must have had something in mind. A lot of things don't make sense, from the poker card to the footprints. Perhaps there's some kind of message hidden here that only people in the know would understand."
"Maybe it's a warning, or a grudge, or something else... It could be a lot of things."
The two of them fall silent for a while as they stand in front of the corpse.
A knight's voice breaks the silence.
"Did you say there was a witness? Really?"
The speaker was Gray, the Knights' supervisor.
"Yes. It seems the servants were only knocked out. By the time they came to, they said they had seen the culprit.
"So what did they look like?"
Alexia and Christina turned to listen.
"Well... It seemed to be a blood-stained clown."
"What? A blood-stained clown?"

"They all said something along the lines of "a blood-stained clown suddenly showed up in front of me and then everything went dark. By the time I woke up, it was morning." Since all the testimonies were the same, I doubt they're wrong."
"...In other words they didn't see this clown's face, then?"
"Yes. They said the clown's face was hidden by a mask. Although the clown seemed very tall, it might have been due to his clothing."
"Is there anything else?"
"No... We asked around the neighborhood, but we haven't found any other eyewitnesses yet."
"Keep asking, then. Since our culprit is dressed as a clown, he should be very distinctive. Seriously, what kind of joker is this, anyway..."
Gray sighed as he watched his men leave.
"So our killer dresses up as a clown and uses poker cards as a weapon. I can't make any sense of it."
"Oh my, if it isn't Alexia-hime. Eavesdropping is rude, you know."
Gray frowned.
"I believe the perpetrator was sending a message. What do you think, Chief Gray?"
"Alexia-hime, there's no need to overcomplicate things. This was a simple killing."
"Simple?"
"The killer was a wealthy man who hated Count Goethe. He spent a lot of money to hire a skilled killer, but the killer turned out to be a crazy murderer.

That's all. Outsiders often overcomplicate things, but human motivations are actually very simple. Leaving messages behind and whatnot is the stuff of Natsume-sensei's novels, like the Charlock Homes series. Do you like reading those, Alexia-hime?"
"No, I don't..."
"They're pretty interesting. I actually bought the full set myself. Thing is, they're interesting because they're stories. Real life, however..."
"I told you, I don't read Charlock Homes novels or whatever! Why should I be interested in that woman's stuff?!"
"Oh my, then are you a fan of Detective Conyan? You know, the one where the famous detective is turned into a cat by a dangerous experimental potion..."
"Like I said, I am not! I was just worried if there was someone else behind this matter!"
"I see. In that case, you don't need to worry. Like we said earlier, we've finished painting a picture of the culprit. A wealthy person who hates Count Goethe... Like Christina-san, for instance."
Chief Gray had a smug smile as he said so.
"How could it be? It wasn't me!!"
"Ah, but you panicked. By the way, I'm not the only one who suspects you."
"What is that supposed to mean?"
"I'm talking about those people. You should understand, right?"
"Is it the Night Swords..."
"Alright, I ought to get back to work. I need to properly collect evidence to catch the perpetrator."
Chief Gray turns away as he utters that iconic line.
"There can only be one truth... Natsume-sensei's books are quite interesting, so please give them a read."
With a gahaha laugh, Chief Gray vanished into the distance.
"I have to say, the person who should be happiest that Count Goethe Moono was killed ought to be you."
"Like I said, it wasn't me!"
"Of course I know that. But that's how it looks to the people of the world.
Be careful."
"Looks like the Night Swords have their eyes on me."
"I wish I could help you out more... But it's not good for the royal household to interfere in legal matters."
"It's alright, I understand your situation, Alexia-hime. All you need to do is speak up for me when giving testimony."
"Sorry about that."
"There's no denying that Count Goethe's death was useful for me. I'll think about how best to make use of this."
"Perhaps it might help at trial."
Christina nods.
"Alexia-hime, there's something I need to show you."
"What is it?"
Guided by Christina, Alexia walks over to Count Goethe's desk.
"There are coffee stains on the table."
"Yes, as well as fragments of a cup everywhere. However, I think it's natural that the contents would be splashed on the desk, right?"
"But what about this shape? There's a neat, rectangular mark here."
"I see! So you're saying that there used to be something here, right? Like a document or something..."
"The document was splashed with coffee, and then someone else took it away. That left a rectangular coffee stain that looked like it had been cut off.
That makes more sense."
"But the crime scene ought to have been undisturbed."
"In that case, did the culprit do it, or the knights?"
Christina lowered her voice as she said so. Alexia's face turned serious.
"Looks like it might be dangerous to trust the knights. Let's both keep our eyes open."
"Yes. You take care too, Alexia-hime."
The two of them looked around the scene quickly, and then left.
After school that day.
Christina was waiting in a Midgar Academy classroom to discuss the incident with Kanade.
Kanade was the girl who had revealed Eliza's villainy during the white fog incident. Naturally, the Night Swords were hostile to her.
"S-Sorry to keep you waiting, Christina-san."
Kanade looked extremely timid as she eyed her surroundings.
Although the classroom still contained some students who were preparing to go home, she had to consider that the Darkaigan Faction might have decided to take extreme measures.
"Have you heard about what happened this morning, Kanade?"
"Yes, I did. I didn't expect that to happen to Count Goethe Moono..."
"The situation has changed now, both for the better and for the worse."
"It's changed for the worse?"
"Yes. They have their eye on you now. There's no doubt about it."
Kanade's face turned pale.

"You were not in danger until now because the Darkaigans were still taking things easy. There was no need for them to take a risk and do anything to you. However, Count Goethe's death has changed that."
"So it's become bad for them now... Is that what you're saying?"
"Yes. As a result, they can't just sit around and react anymore. Of course, they might have their eye on me too. Therefore, I have a suggestion for you, Kanade."
Christina was just about to continue, when...
"Uwaaaahh?! W-What's that!!"
The pathetic cry of a male student filled the classroom.
"...Did something happen?"
Christina directed her words at the student who had screamed just now.
Right now, Christina, Kanade and the male student who had screamed in that pathetic way were the only three left in the classroom.
"C-Christina-san..."
The black-haired boy frantically turned around.
He was holding something that looked like a document.
"You must be Claire Kagenou-san's little brother... You're Cid Kagenou, aren't you?"
Christina spoke his name like she was squeezing something out of her memories.
He was an ordinary male student, but there had been much talk about him, so she had remembered his name.
"Ah, yes. Please take a look at this. Something fell here."
"What is that..."
It was a stained document.
There were two kinds of stains on it, black ones, and reddish-black ones.
The black stains smelled faintly of coffee, while the reddish-black stains also smelled faintly of something... namely, blood.
"This is..."
Christina's face tensed up the moment she received the document.
It contained a summary of the dealings involved with the Eliza case, as well as the fees for covering the matter up, as well as a list of people who were involved and their interests in the matter.
There was no doubt that this was the document that had gone missing from the crime scene of Count Goethe's death.
Christina hurriedly looked around to make sure nobody else was around.
"Cid-kun, where did you find this?"
Christina lowered her tone as she asked him.
"Ah, I saw it peeking out from that shelf over there... I was wondering if someone had forgotten something."
That was a classroom shelf. Every student had their own slot on it. Cid was pointing to Christina's slot on the shelf.
"It was from my slot...!?"
"Ah, so it was your slot, Christina-san. Sorry I just went over and..."
"No, I'm glad you noticed this."
"Yeah, fortunately you didn't forget to take it."
"Cid-kun, did you see what was inside it?"
"Huh? Ah, I kind of glanced inside it."
"I see... So you read it, then."
Christina lowered her voice again.
"Ah, would it be a very bad idea to read that document?"
"Yes. It would be a very bad idea to know what is inside it."
"Well, I just glanced inside, so I basically didn't read it. That's it then, see you tomor..."
"Wait!"
As Cid prepared to make his exit with surprising speed, Christina grabbed him by the collar.
"I'm sorry, but I can't let you go."
"Eh... But that's not fair."
Cid sounded very put-upon as he said this.
"It's for your own good. You don't want to get your head chopped off in your sleep, do you?"
"But why? Are you going to chop my head off?"
"No, I won't. But there's no telling if anyone else saw you. If they knew you read this, they'd probably want to cut your throat."
"They? I don't quite know what you mean, but I think it should be the fault of the person who put this document on the shelf."
"I didn't put it there."
"Huh?"
"I don't remember putting a document like this on the shelf."
"In that case, who could it be..."
"Someone who wanted me to see this document."
An indescribable sense of silence and unease chilled the air in the classroom.
There was a person here who had stolen an important document from the scene of the crime, and then they had deliberately placed it in Christina's shelf in the academy.
Perhaps that person was watching them at this very moment.
While she hadn't done anything wrong, she couldn't help but feel a little spooked because she didn't know who this person was or their true identity.
"Hey, isn't there something written here?"
Cid suddenly said.
"What, what did you say just now..."
Cid should only have been able to see the back of the document from where he was standing.
"There are red and black smudges on the back... But if you look closely, aren't they words?"
"This is...?!"
After flipping the document over, she found that someone had written something on the back in blood.
However, the smudging had made it hard to read...
"Jack the Ripper. Is that a name..."
"Maybe that's the guy who put the document on your shelf, Christina-san."
"Who is this... And why did he send it to me..."
Christina held her breath and began to think.
"Anyway, I need to go back."
"Please wait."
Christina grabbed Cid before he could flee.
"Ah, I'm kind of worried about how my big sis is still in a coma. I want to get back and look after her as soon as possible..."
"I know about your sister's condition. But for your safety, I can't let you go back."
"I can take care of myself."
"If I'm not wrong, your grades are only the lower end of the spectrum, right? I'm saying this out of concern for you."
"Even if you say that..."
Christina ignored Cid and turned around.
"Kanade, you can't go home either."
"Eh? Me too?"
Kanade exclaimed in surprise.
"Yup. I was planning to mention this from the start, but the two of you will be living in the Hope manor from now on."
"Eh–"
"That's great, now I won't have to be worried anymore."
The two of them reacted in dramatically different ways.
"It's for your safety, so it can't be helped. As long as you live in the Hope Manor, I can protect you."
"Eh–"
"Thank you very much, Christina-san."
"Now then, let's sort out our things and then head to the manor."
And so, the three of them started living together.
When I started killing people, I set a few rules for myself and I've been obeying them ever since.
One of them was to avoid killing anyone if I felt sorry for them.
Another was that killing bad guys was fundamentally OK.
"Yup, no problems."
Once again, I had stuck to my rules. That was for sure.
"A lot of surprising things have happened."
As a result, I was currently sitting in Christina-san's living room.
"Aren't you going to drink some, Cid? This is Mitsugoshi's best coffee.
You might not be able to have any for the rest of your life after this, so you should drink up your life's worth now."
Now where did that scaredy-cat act of yours go? The poor noble Kanade was happily downing a cup of coffee. She was an ordinary, cute girl with black hair and black eyes.
"You can have mine."
After all, Gamma was giving me more than I could possibly finish.
"Eh? Seriously?! I love you, Cid-kun!"
After receiving her discount-priced love, I slumped back onto the sofa and sighed.
I didn't expect to end up living in Christina-san's home.
As a mob, would this be a good or bad thing... I'd thought of that before, but right now, Kanade-san was the very picture of a mob as she enjoyed a life's worth of coffee, so it ought to be fine.
"Yup, it should be fine."
Looks like I'm living an ordinary, easy life again today.
"Cid-kun, can I have the chocolates?"
"Nope."
"Ehhhh, you're so petty. I hate you, Cid-kun."
I quickly retrieved my portion of the chocolates from Kanade-san.
They were apparently the newly-released high-end matcha truffle flavor.
Gamma gave me a trial batch last month. I heard the preorders were backed up for a whole year, but as it happened, there were some in front of me now.
Is this the power of the great nobles? ...I'm pretty jealous of it after all.
"The sofa is also a high-end Mitsugoshi brand... Same with the chandeliers, the carpet, and the dining utensils. They're all high-grade Mitsugoshi products..."
What kind of Mitsugoshi fans were they, anyway? Speaking of which, how much of the industry have you conquered already, Mitsugoshi?
Just as I popped a matcha truffle into my mouth, there was a knock on the living room door.
"I'm coming in."
It was Christina-san.
"I'm very glad that you invited me here!"
Kanade changed attitudes with lightning speed and then bowed deeply to her.
"No need to be so formal around me. The room is ready, so I'll take you there."
We followed Christina down a hallway.

The carpet was beautiful, while the walls, ceilings and the corridors were decorated with countless objects d'art. It was a luxurious home that a poor noble like Baron Kagenou could not hope to replicate.
"17 million, 54 million, 9 million, 200 million..."
Kanade was muttering to herself.
"What are you doing?"
"Eh?! Did you hear me?"
"Yup."
"I was guessing how much these art pieces were worth."
"Huh."
I engraved the sight of that vase which was worth 200 million into my retinas.
"This is the dining room. We will be eating here tonight, as planned.
Beside it is the..."

Christina-san showed us around this luxurious estate as though she had done this countless times. After that, she led us up a spiral staircase and stopped in front of a pair of double doors. There were two magic swordsmen standing in front of them who seemed to be guards.
"This is the room."
Saying so, she opened the doors, revealing a spacious bedroom within.
"Wow~ it's just like a princess' room."
Kanade excitedly ran over to the bed,
"Cid-kun, your bed is all the way on the left."
Christina-san had already decided.
"Christina-san, can I have this one?"
"Huh, sure. In that case, I'll take the one in the middle."
"Ah, why are there three beds?"
I blurted out the question that had been churning in my mind ever since I entered the room.
"Because there are three of us."
Christina pointed to me, herself and Kanade, like she was counting us.
"I see, it's true that there are three of us."
"It's more efficient to keep the protection targets together, right?"
"Mhm."
A perfectly acceptable answer.
"While we're all sharing the same room, your bed's been fenced off by the bookshelf. That should be enough, right?
"Cid-kun, your practical grades were nothing much. I'm like, hundreds of times stronger than you. If you try to do anything funny, I'll beat the crap out of you. Whooshwhooshwhoosh!"
Kanade put on an arrogant attitude and jumped around while throwing punches at the air.
"Yes, yes, I know."
I raised my hands to indicate my surrender, and then sat down on my bed.
My luggage from the dorms was set down beside it.
In order from the window, it was my bed, then Christina's then Kanade's.
"And the window is in front of the door. If anything happens, the person there will be the first to die. Perfect for the son of a poor noble baron like me."
I muttered to myself.
"That's because the chances of you being targeted are lowest. Cid-kun."
"Ah, sorry, I didn't mean anything bad by that."
Rather, I was actually very happy instead.
"There are two guards at the door and three more outside the window. All of them are strong fighters who made it into the main competition of the War God Festival."
"Huh."
"Relax, it'll be much safer than staying in the dorms."
"Alright, then. I think I've pretty much learned the general situation before coming here, but can you tell me again about what happened this morning?"
I asked.
"Ah, sorry about that, I need to go to the bathroom..."
Kanade said. Clearly she had drunk too much coffee.
"There's a washroom and toilet next door."
"Thank you."
After watching Kanade hurry off, Christina began speaking.
"Someone killed Count Goethe Moono. They'll probably be talking about it in school tomorrow."
"Ehhhhh!! You mean a murder happened?! Sounds dangerous. Now that you mention it, there was that name written in blood on the document..."
"That's probably the one which went missing from the crime scene."
"Seriously? Oh man that's so scary! Writing in fresh blood is too cruel."
Count Goethe was killed in a very unusual way too. This isn't just a simple murder. The killer probably has some kind of plan in mind."
"I can't believe an ordinary student like me, which you could find anywhere, got wrapped up in such a vicious incident..."
"I know it must be hard on you, but please bear with it for a while. After all, they might target you too."
"I'm sure I won't be able to sleep tonight. After all, they might be after my life...
"Cid-kun..."
Christina gently patted my trembling back.
A cool gust of night wind blew in through a gap in the window.
After coming back from the bathroom, Kanade shared a late dinner with us.

It was a luxurious meal featuring modified items from a high-end Mitsugoshi cookbook. I was genuinely shocked when what looked like salmon sushi was served. I hadn't had anything like sushi before in my past life.
"They're all new dishes. How delicious!"
Kanade looked very happy as she returned to the room.
"Mitsugoshi's food does not disappoint. You should try some when you get home, Kanade."
"Eh?! But, but I can't afford all those fancy ingredients..."
"They also have recipes that use lower-priced ingredients. Things like tuna burgers and so on that use fish which would have been thrown away in the past..."
And so, this world's food culture was further degraded.
Soon, we end up talking on our beds like we were out on a field trip.
Shortly after that, as the fireplace crackles merrily, Christina-san turns off the lights in the room.
"It's time to turn in. For some reason it feels like we got too excited and talked for too long."
"Ehhh, but I want to talk some more."
It was almost midnight. Despite muttering under her breath, Kanade obediently crawled back under the covers.
"Goodnight."
I turned in after Kanade did.
"Goodnight, you two."
Just as Christina said so, there was a loud knocking on the door and a maid strode in.
"Christina-sama, the master is asking for you."
"You two should go get some sleep first. I need to speak with Father."
"Got it."
"Zzzzz–"
Kanade was already asleep.
"Say, Cid-kun..."
At the threshold of the doorway, Christina turned back to look at me.
"Hm? What's wrong?"
"Have we met before?"
"In the classroom, I guess."
"That's not what I mean. I just get the feeling that we've spoken before."
"Hm, I doubt it."
"You just give me that impression. For some reason, you remind me of someone... Sorry to ask you this all of a sudden."
Christina smiled, as though she was trying to paper over what she had said just now, and left the bedroom.
–Late at night.
Christina was in her father's study.
"The situation has gotten very bad."
Her father's hands trembled as she turned the document over.
"With this as proof, the trial can move in a fruitful direction. That way, we can find Eliza Darkaigan guilty."
"Of course I know that!"
Her father slammed the table and his tone grew harsh.
"Doing this will make enemies of the Night Swords. Ultimately, it was your obsession with protecting a lesser noble that led to this...!"
"Father, the Night Blades have always had their sights set on us. After all, the Hope family stands to gain the most after the death of Count Goethe Moono.
"And like I said, we're being targeted because you did unnecessary things! No, could it be that you were the one who–"
In the midst of his fury, her father's expression suddenly changed and he looked at her with fear in his eyes.
"No! I didn't do anything! It was Jack the Ripper."
"B-But..."
'Father, let's lend Kanade a hand. With this evidence, we can find Elisa Darkaigan guilty. That will weaken the Night Swords and the more nobles will support the Hope family.
"No, on the other hand, if we give this evidence to the Night Swords, they might be favorably disposed to us..."
"Would the Night Swords truly let someone who knows their secret go free?'
"(Coughs) ...No, wait a minute. You invited that lesser noble to our home, right?"
"Yes. Kanade is in our home, under guard."
"Excellent. Then if we hand her to the Night Swords, we will show our sincerity..."
"I will not let you do that. And if you do, I will not forgive you, even if you are my father."
"Are you mad, Christina?! I am the head of the Hope household!"
Christina glared at her father after the latter shouted at her.
He was the first to look away.
"Let me take care of this for now. Since we don't know who this Jack The Ripper is, there's a chance it might be a trap. We need to verify this evidence."
"But Father...!"
"Since Goethe Moono has been killed, the Thirteen Night Swords will make their move. It'll probably be Barons Kuzaya and Grehan next."
"They're from the militant faction."
"They are younger members of the Thirteen Night Swords. That's why we have no idea what they'll do next. Sorry, but I don't want to die yet."
Saying so, her father left with the document in hand.
Christina looked at the fireplace and sighed.
"So this is a great noble of the Kingdom... He's been completely corrupted."
Christina laughed, as though she had completely given up.
"We're fools... Both Father, who only cares about sucking up to the Night Swords, or me, who's powerless to do anything..."
Christina had an idea why Jack the Ripper had put the evidence in her locker.
"Did he want me to go public with it? Was that why he delivered the proof of the Night Swords' misdeeds to..."
But Christina could not do anything by herself.
One would need power to have others acknowledge this proof, but she lacked that power. Someone who showed off that evidence without the power to back it up would only end up destroyed.
"If I had that power..."
It would feel great to wipe out all the parasites infesting this kingdom.
Just then, she remembered the way Goethe Moono died. He had a poker card stuck in his head, his eyes wide open and staring blankly in a ridiculous way.
"Hehe..."
Christina chuckled to herself.
Back then, she had been staring at his face until Alexia got her attention.
Quiet laughter filled the study in the middle of the night.
Baron Kuzaya and Baron Grehan were talking in a darkened secret room.
"So nobody has any idea who killed Goethe Moono, then?"
Kuzaya said as he chomped a cigar.
"All the witnesses said it was a clown. That bastard's a regular joker."
Grehan replied disdainfully.
"He's pretty cunning. All eyewitness testimony was suddenly cut off halfway. We couldn't find any trace of him even with our veteran mana trackers."
"Looks like it was professionally done."
"Yeah. Goethe Moono has a lot of guards, but he still died in one blow.
That implies he's on the level of a knight order captain."
"He might be from the Lawless City. Don't they have that assassin group
"Zetsurou" over there?"
"Zetsurou is strong enough to do it, but I've never heard of powerful assassins who dress up as clowns before."
"Could it be someone new?"
"Who knows? Still whoever this clown is, we can guess who hired him."
Baron Kuzaya laid several documents out on the table.
"We've got a few candidates. The Hopes are quite suspicious, but we don't have any evidence."
"Oh, what a shame, we don't have evidence."
Baron Grehan grinned evilly as he said that.
"We'll just kill them as usual. They'll keep quiet if we torture them a little."
"Don't be hasty. What are you going to do if we mess up?"
"Heh, we just need to make up some proof. Dead men tell no tales, after all."
"We're dealing with the Hopes here. Clean-up will be very troublesome."
"Hah? We've killed great nobles before, haven't we?"
"That was before. You know the Fenrir Faction got wiped out, right?"
"The Fenrir Faction? Ah, that religious group that helped out the Thirteen Night Swords, right?"

"Yes. Since they were wiped out by Shadow Garden, I'm pretty sure getting backup from them is going to be very difficult. We're negotiating with another faction now. We need to be cautious until this matter is over."
"What a pain. It's just a little cult getting wiped out, right?"
"You have no idea how strong that cult is and how frightening they are..."
Grehan couldn't help but hold his breath as he heard the seriousness in Kuzaya's voice.
Then, he replied in annoyance, as though disgusted by his momentary wavering.
"Keh, it's all because Goethe died and caused us so much trouble."
"Relax. So far, our instructions have been to carefully observe the movements of the Hope family."
"Aniki, I heard their Christina-ojousama is kind of hot. When we get the kill order, can I have her?"
"Do whatever you want. However, make sure you clean things up."
"You're the best after all, aniki."
Baron Grehan laughed in a vulgar way.
"Guhyahyahyahyahya..."
"Oi, shut the fuck up, Grehan."
"Sorry, aniki."
"Guhyahyahyahyahya."
A bout of bone-chilling laughter echoed through the dark basement.
The smile on Baron Grehan's face was gone. Baron Kuzaya put down his cigarette with a serious look on his face.
"Oi, someone's messing around."
Baron Kuzaya spoke in a low, forceful voice.
The only people in this dark, hidden room were Kuzaya and Grehan. Few others knew that it existed.
"Guhyahyahyahyahya."
But the laughter was coming from this room.
Both of them drew their swords and cautiously scanned their surroundings.
"Stop fucking around and get the hell out here, asshole!"
Kuzaya growled.
"Guhyahyahyahyahya."
Yet the laughter kept coming.
They pricked up their ears, trying to find the source of the sound. It wasn't coming from the right, or the left, or the front, or the rear.
And then, they both looked directly upward.
Just then, they heard a "picha".
Something fell from the ceiling.
Reddish-black liquid spattered the table and stained it. The intense stench of blood assailed their noses.
They looked up at the ceiling. A blood-stained clown was standing there.
"Guhyahyahyahyahya."
The clown was looking down at them and laughing.
"The hell?!"
"It was the clown?!"
Kuzaya and Grehan immediately thrust their swords upwards.
Being part of the militant faction, their movements were quite practiced.
Their swords stabbed through the clown and blood splattered everywhere, There was a splat.
The blood-stained clown fell on the table.
"We got him!"
Kuzaya and Grehan grinned as they swung down.
Every time their blades cut into the clown, it would spray large quantities of blood.
And then, after twitching violently, the clown stopped laughing.
"...Did we kill him?"
Kuzaya looked down on the brutally murdered clown and asked.
"Did this guy take out Goethe? Isn't he just trash? Or rather, aren't we too strong?
Grehan arrogantly flicked the blood off his blade.
"I did pretty well at the War God Festival too, you know? We aren't like Goethe's guards. Looks like our opponent just wasn't good enough."
Kuzaya smiled too. He felt like his old sharpness had finally returned.
"Now then, little clown. Let's see what you look like..."
Grehan laughed and made to peel off the clown's mask.
"Oi! Grehan!!"
"What's the matter, aniki?"
He looked back in annoyance.
"Y-Your head..."
"What's on my head?"
"Th-there's a poker card stuck in the back of your head..."
"Hah?"
Grehan frantically felt toward the back of his head.
A playing card was lodged deeply into the back of his skull. He wiped dumbly at the blood streaming down his neck.
"A-aniki... Why, why is there a card on my..."
Saying so, he slowly collapsed forward.
The card embedded in the back of his head was a 2 of spades.
As Kuzaya watched Grehan twitch uncontrollably on the ground, he sensed something getting up.
It was the blood-stained clown.
"You, you... why are you still alive..."
Kuzaya shivered in fear as he saw the clown who had risen emotionlessly from what should have been fatal wounds.
Kuzaya backed off.
Picha. The clown advanced.
"Wait, what the hell are you up to?"
Picha picha. The clown moved forward.
"Do you want money? Who hired you? How much did he pay?"
Picha picha picha.
"W-Wait! I'll pay double! I'll give you money, women, anything you want!"
Thunk. He felt a slight impact behind him.
Kuzaya had backed up into a wall.
He had backed up to the end of the room without realizing it.
"Stay back! I'm an authorized successor of the Bushin-ryu!"
Picha picha picha picha.
"If you step into my range, you're going to suffer–!"
Kuzaya attacked, his swing sharp and forceful.
This was his ideal attack range.
Kuzaya imagined the clown's head flying off his body.
However, his blow missed.
"What– How did you, how did you dodge at that range?"
The clown had simply taken half a step back.
However, that movement defied all understanding. It had surpassed the limit of reflexes.
"You, who the..."
A whoosh filled the air.
"Ah, hyu..."
A poker card stabbed into Kuzaya's throat.
It was a 3 of spades.
He swung as he coughed up a bloody froth.
The blade missed the clown's nose and fell to the ground.
"Mon...ster..."
And then he fell forward. Blood spewed from his mouth, and he soon stopped moving.
The blood-stained clown picked up their corpses and vanished into the darkness of the night.

c3.text: There was an uproar on the streets of the royal capital.
"D-Dead bodies!"
"What happened?"
"Looks like two nobles got killed!"
"Stay back! This place is under investigation!"
There was a fountain in the middle of the street. There were two corpses strung up there.
The people surrounded them while making a hubbub.
"Are those poker cards stuck in their heads?"
"Wasn't there news of a noble being killed several days ago?"
"Oh, I know that one. Count Goethe Moono got killed. My friend Horako was working as a maid over there..."
"Wait, seriously?"
"It's true! Horako said she saw the criminal! He was dressed like a clown!"
"Why does it feel like she's lying..."
"Didn't I tell you to back off!! Get lost!"
The knights chased away the people who were gathering around.
A beautiful red-haired girl moved through this crowd, which was quite large for the time of day.
She was Christina.
"Excuse me, let me through, please!"
"Excuse me, you're..."
"I am Christina Hope of the Hope ducal family. Please let me see the scene of the crime."
"Ah, you're from the Hope family. This way, please..."
The knight responsible for traffic control frowned in annoyance, but in the end he let Christina through.
"This is..."
Christina unconsciously held her breath as she saw the fountain.
Two men were dangling from the fountain's central spout. Both their pale facers were very familiar.
"It's Count Kuzaya and Baron Grehan..."
Their faces were filled with shock and terror.
There was a twisted smile on Christina's face.
Two more parasites had been eliminated.
"Three members of the Thirteen Night Swords have been killed. It's really hard to think of this as a coincidence."
A voice spoke from behind her.
Christina covered her smile before looking back.
It was Chief Gray of the knights.
"Chief Gray... What do you mean by that?"
"I was simply sharing my frank opinion on the matter, Christina-ojousama."
Gray chuckled, but his eyes were carefully studying Christina.
"Three nobles were killed, one after another, and all belonging to the same organization too. Surely it would be too unnatural to treat this as a mere coincidence, right?"
"Indeed."
"And now, a noble who appears to have a dispute with that organization has turned up."
"You seem pretty sure about that."
"It's my job, after all."
"How fortunate the knights must be to have such a hardworking chief of investigations. I trust this means the culprit will be caught soon enough, right?"
"Of course I intend to do so. That being said, I'll be heading back to work now."
Gray turned away, but he did not leave.
"Is there anything else?"
Upon being questioned, Gray turned a keen gaze Christina's way.
"Speaking of which, Christina-ojousama, did something joyful happen recently?"
"Hm?"
"You see, I thought I saw you smiling just now."
"...You must be imagining things."
Christina lowered the hand she was using to cover her mouth.
"I see, so I was mistaken, then."
After saying so, Gray left.
Christina exhaled a breath that condensed into a white cloud, and then she turned her eyes back to those two corpses.
"Christina-san."
"Alexia-hime..."
She turned back in response to being addressed and found Alexia standing there.
"I went to Count Kuzaya's residence."
"You did?"
"It seems the murders were not committed here. The criminal killed them both in a hidden room in Count Kuzaya's estate and then brought them here.
Look, the knights are tracing the footprints now."
""That does seem to be the case..."
The knights were following the red footprints that led away from the fountain.
"The manor house was just like the previous incident; all the guards were either killed or incapacitated, but the maids were fine, merely knocked out."
"Marvellously done, I must say."

"Yes, the culprit does seem quite experienced at this, given that he's repeatedly executed multiple highly difficult assassinations. Count Kuzaya and Baron Grehan were no fools either. Even though they were on alert, inside a hidden room..."
Christina once again looked up to the corpses hanging from the fountain.
They had poker cards sticking out of their throats and the backs of their heads respectively. That was the extent of their wounds that was visible from down there.
"They were killed with a single blow from a poker card. It's exactly the same as the previous incident."
"Count Kuzaya's maids also testified to seeing a blood-stained clown.
Looks like the perpetrator is the same."
"Just what on earth is he trying to do? His murder weapon, clown outfit and the fact that he dragged the bodies to the fountain, all of them are highly unnatural."
"Who knows? Still, there aren't many people who are as strong as him.
All the powerful experts in the capital are probably under investigation."
"If only that would help us find the criminal..."
"I think it's time we left. It won't be good to be seen here."
"Good point. Oh yes, Alexia-hime, I need to tell you about something later..."
Just as Christina was about to leave, however...
"Huh, that's weird."
A deadpan voice echoed through the air.
The speaker was a black-haired and black-eyed boy; Cid Kagenou.
"Cid-kun, what are you doing here? Didn't I tell you to stay in the mansion?"
"What did you mean by staying in the mansion?"
Upon hearing Christina's words, Alexia responded with startling speed.
"Uh, that's because..."
Christina was briefly at a loss for how to explain herself and stumbled over her words.
She was planning to tell Alexia about everything afterwards, Jack the Ripper included.
"Lots of stuff happened."
"What do you mean, "Lots of stuff"?"
"Ah, I was actually planning to tell you about it later."
"Well, it's already later, so how about now?"
Christina felt strangely nervous and nodded.
"Huh, that's weird."
Cid repeated his previous words, as though he was tired of waiting.
"What are you doing here, Cid-kun? Didn't I tell you to wait at home because it was very dangerous..."
"Ah, I came because I was worried about you, Christina-san."
Cid delivered the line in a monotone.
"The two of you seem to be getting along really well. Since when did the two of you become that close?"
Alexia smiled brightly at them.
"Cid-kun, what's so weird?"
"They're poker cards."
"Well, yes, they are pretty strange..."
"Anyone could tell it's weird those poker cards are there. Good grief, I shouldn't have expected anything out of you, Poochie."
Alexia grumbled to herself from the side.
"If I'm not wrong, the first victim was the ace of spades, right?"
"Huh, so it was."
"And now, these guys are the 2 and 3 of spades."
"So you're saying the numbers are going up."
"Anyone could tell that, right?"
Tsk, Alexia clicked her tongue in annoyance.
"I'm not just talking about the numbers. All of them are spades. The killer must have chosen that suit for a reason, right?"
"That's true, but what special meaning could there be..."
"The suits in a deck of cards all have a meaning of their own. Like, hearts represent love, diamonds represent traders, clubs represent knowledge, that sort of thing."
"That's the first time I've heard something like that. So, what do spades represent?"
"The first meaning is winter."
"Ah, yes, yes. It's winter now, so he picked spades. Brilliant deduction, Poochie."
Alexia rolled her eyes as she said this.
"That's not the only meaning for spades, though. Others include the night, swords, and death."
"Night and swords?"
"And death, you say..."
Christina and Alexia exchanged looks.
"There are thirteen spade-suit cards in a deck. Just enough for 13
people..."
"Does he plan to kill all of the Thirteen Night Swords?!"
"Isn't that just too..."
This was both a challenge to the Thirteen Night Swords and a declaration of war.
"What on earth is he thinking? And he's even announcing himself ahead of time. I wonder if he's right in the head."
Alexia declared.
"Still, the criminal has killed three targets, just like he promised. A simple madman couldn't do that."
Christina pondered the matter again.
"Well, I have no idea what the criminal is thinking. However, he left another important clue here."
There was a meaningful smile on Cid's face.
"What kind of important clue?"
"Where is it..."
Alexia and Christina looked around.
"Over there."
As they looked where Cid was pointing, a hubbub rose from the gawking crowd.
Before them were the two corpses, but at that moment, they were being moved away by the knights.
That left a blood-stained fountain behind.
"Don't you think the blood there looks like words of some sort?"
"Ehhhhh?!"
"What's—?"
Alexia and Christina both noticed it at once.
"What the heck, it looks like someone was writing in blood."
The onlookers only seem to have just noticed.
"What is it, what is it, I can't see from here. Jack... what?"
"It says Jack the Ripper."
Cid's words echo strangely through the air, and then the crowd picks it up and instantly amplifies it.
"I think it says "Jack the Ripper" or something!"
"Is that the name of the culprit?"
"That's right. It's the serial killer Jack the Ripper!"
"There's a noble killer in the capital! He's taunting the nobles!"
The onlookers ran through the capital while shouting those things.
"Looks like everyone in the capital is going to hear about this before noon."
Alexia said through gritted teeth.
"Well, someone would have found out sooner or later."
Cid sighed, going "good grief" as he did.
"Jack the Ripper..."
Christina muttered the name quietly to herself.
"Is something the matter, Christina-ojousama? Do you have any leads on this?"
"No... I just have some things I want to say."
She replied with a frown on her face.
Alexia was also frowning as she looked through the evidence which had been given to her.
"I see. So this Jack the Ripper already made contact with you."
This was an unused classroom in the academy."
The only people here were Alexia, Christina and Cid.

"If we could make good use of this evidence, we could corner the Darkaigan faction. However, we can't take action so easily since we don't yet know the true intentions of this Jack the Ripper character."
Christina had a grave look on her face as well.
"We don't know if he's friend or foe, after all. While I think he might have wanted to show us this evidence, I have no idea how this Jack the Ripper would gain from it..."
"Also, the origins of this document are unknown, which means there are very few places where it can be used."
"Actually, I have an idea about this. Can I hold on to this document for a while?"
"Of course, but this is just a copy. What do you plan to do with it?"
"I'm going to discuss the matter with my father."
"That's reassuring to hear."
"Who knows..."
After placing the blood-stained document into her bag, Alexia smiled forlornly.
"Alexia-hime?"
"It's nothing. Speaking of which... How did you end up living with this guy?"
Alexia grabbed Cid by the scruff of his neck and pushed him in front of Christina.
"Ah, that was for his safety. He saw part of the information, and it would be very troublesome if the Darkaigans found out."
"And you seem to be sharing a room too."
"Well, gathering everyone in the same place is more efficient for security."
"While that's true..."
"Ah, come to think of it, you were pretending to go out with Cid-kun before, weren't you?"
"S-So what if I was?"
"Did you actually end up dating? If that was the case, then it was my fault for not taking that into consideration."
"O-Of course not, there's no way that could ever happen."
"Exactly. I'd rather die before dating Alexia."
"You shut up, Poochie!"
Alexia savagely shook Cid by the neck.
"So you haven't been dating after all then, is that right?"
"Of course. Going out with Poochie or whatnot would disgrace the royal family of Midgar."
"Which means there's no problem, then."
"Eh?"
"Since you're not dating, it should be fine for him to stay with me, right?"
"Ah... I'm more worried about you, Christina. What if this man does something weird to you?"
"As if."
"Are you worried about me? You don't have to be, though. My magic swordsman skills are far better than Cid's."
"While that's true, Poochie occasionally manages to display some highly-polished swordsmanship. There just might be a one-in-a-million chance where..."
"My, you're so kind, Alexia-hime. I didn't think you'd be so concerned about me. In that case, why not join us, Alexia-hime?"
"Eh?"
Alexia blinked.
"Surely with you around, that one-in-a-million chance will never happen."
"Hell no. Just thinking about sharing a room with Alexia sends a chill down my spine..."
"You shut up."
Alexia covered up Cid's mouth.
"That IS a good idea."
"Oh yes. Father will be delighted."
"Mfff–!"
"I'll need to adjust my schedule a little."
"Yes, we'll have to prepare on our end too."
"Mff–! Mffffffff!!"
"Alright, see you later, then."
After saying so, Alexia quickly strode off.
"Now even Alexia's coming over, how did this happen..."
Cid said with a sorrowful expression.
"How exciting."
"I'm heading back to the dorm."
"No can do."
"Sorry, but I can't keep you company. I have stuff to do."
Just as Cid was about to say that...
"What's the meaning of this?!"
A female student's voice came from down the corridor.
"That voice just now...!"
"Hm?"
"It was Eliza. Apparently something happened."
Christina and Cid hurried out into the hallway.
Outside, Eliza and her lackeys were making a racket.
"How dare you do this to me, are you looking down on me..."
With one glare from Eliza, the crowd of onlookers immediately scattered to the four winds.
After that, Eliza caught sight of Christina.
"My my, if it isn't Christina-san. To think the culprit herself would be standing in front of me. You must be feeling pretty confident."
"The culprit? What on earth are you talking about, Miss Eliza?"
"Who else would send me something like this? You're the only one, right?!"
Saying so, Eliza brandished a letter written in blood.

"Thirteen fat little piggies. The first little piggie tried to run away and died. The second little piggie sneered at others and died miserably. The third little piggie died of foolish arrogance. How will the next piggie die? - Jack the Ripper."
"This is... an advance warning. Where did you get this?"
"It was shoved into my bag. You really are making light of me, aren't you?"
Eliza glared at her.
"Thirteen fat little piggies. That's referring to us, right?"
"Well, I couldn't say."
"Stop playing dumb. Jack the Ripper is an assassin on your payroll, isn't he?"
"No."
"Don't think things are going to end so simply now that you've gone out of your way to do this."
"I told you, I didn't do it."
A clear, crisp "smack" echoed through the hallway.
It was the sound of Eliza slapping Christina across the face.
"I wonder how much longer you can look so relaxed? Father is furious now, and I have no idea how things will turn out."
Christina responded with an icy glare.
Suddenly, Cid was sent flying from behind her.
"PEGYAAAAAHHHHH!"
He sailed magnificently through the air, trailing blood from his nose.
"Cid-kun?!"
"Ahaha, what a loser!"
One of Eliza's lackeys had hit Cid.
"What did you just do?! This has nothing to do with him!"
"I don't care. Anyone who goes against me will end up like that. Well done, Dekuno Bou,"
The minion called Dekuno Bou smugly wiped the blood off his knuckles.
"Hehe, I just gave him a little love tap."
"Still, that's amazing, Dekuno. That little love tap of yours sent him all the way to the end of the corridor."
In other words, Dekuno managed to knock Cid fifty-odd meters through the air.
"Meh, I've become stronger, right?"
"How reliable, I like manly guys like you."
Eliza hugged Dekuno's arm and ground her chest on it.
"Uhehe, just leave it to me."
"But you'd better be careful, though. You might end up being the next victim."
"Hah, even if Jack the Ripper comes after me, I'll show him what for!"
"Ufufu, I'll reward you well if you do that."
After flashing them a bewitching smile, Eliza left with her minions.
I was being treated for my injuries by a sexy female doctor.
"Alright, that's it. Make sure you know your limits when you get into a fight, okay?"
After saying that, she went off to do other work.
"Cid-kun, are you alright?"
Christina-san looked at me with a worried expression on her face.
"It was a good punch, but I managed to slip out from its way and cut the damage down by 3 percent, which is how I barely managed to survive."
I grinned while rubbing my swollen cheek.
"You'd best stay in the sickbay for today. I'll come get you after classes."
After saying that, Christina left the sickbay.
I lay down on the bed and stretched.
"Yo~"
Suddenly, a petite girl popped out from under the bed. It was Nina-sempai.
"Yo."
Thus, I returned her greeting.
I knew she'd been listening in from the start.
"What's up?"
"I've got a report to give about Claire."
"Oh, it's about Nee-san, then."
"Yup. In any case, let's head over to Claire's room first."
Led by Nina-sempai, who was as tiny as ever, I headed over to Claire's room.
Nee-san's room seemed different from last time.
There was medical equipment there, along with magic items of unknown use. Meanwhile, Nee-san lay still on the bed.
"...Nee-san."
Beep, beep, beep, beeeeeeeep–"
One of the magical items beeped.
I'd seen something like this before in the hospitals of my previous world.
"Her pulse has stopped. Is this the end for her..."
I put my hands together and closed my eyes.
Although I didn't believe in anything like life after death, considering I had managed to transmigrate, Nee-san might have been reborn somewhere else too, if she were lucky.
And so, I began to pray for Nee-san, in the hopes that she would not end up as a cockroach or flea or something.
"I hope she becomes a rat, at least."
"She's not dead yet."
Nina rolled her eyes at me.
"But the magic item stopped making noise."
"That's just the sound indicating that the mana detection period has ended."
The person who said this was not Nina-sempai, but the sexy female doctor.
She had entered the room without betraying a single hint of her permission.
"You... I saw you in the nurse's room just now."
"Yes. Nina-san recommended me for this position, and now I am in charge of caring for Claire-san as well as serving as the school nurse. I am Mu."
After saying so, she bowed deeply.
Her skin was dark and her lips were full and sexy. I could see hints of pointy ears protruding through the strands of her silver hair.
She was a dark elf.
"You're too kind. I'm Cid Kagenou. I'm the little brother of the girl lying there, at least for now."
"Naturally, I am aware of this. I will be in your care from now on."
"Nah, that should be me."
"No, no, I should be the one saying that."
I answered politeness with politeness.
The two of us bowed nonstop to each other in deference.
Speaking of which, why was Mu-san being so humble, even though she was a doctor?
Granted, she was kind of rare, but were dark elf doctors that uncommon?
After the bowing, she began operating the instruments to inspect Nee-san's mana. I was deeply impressed by Mu-san's skilful control of mana.
Were there actually people of her level who were willing to be school nurses?
She was pretty good.
Both her presence-concealment methods seemed very natural. School doctors these days were awesome...
In that case, it would be better for someone like her to do this, compared to someone like me who had no medical knowledge.
"I can't believe Nina-sempai actually knew such an amazing doctor. Your friend is amazing."
"Nyahaha."
Nina-sempai seemed to be mildly embarrassed as she laughed.
"So, how is Nee-san doing?"
"Her life is not in danger and she will eventually awaken. As for the reason behind her condition, that would be related to the fluctuations in her mana and the new magic crest on her right hand..."
I reached out and interrupted Mu-san before she could launch into a spirited explanation.
"Alright, alright, I got it. It's okay as long as her life isn't in danger."
"I, I sincerely apologize for overstepping my bounds."
"I told you its fine. More importantly, when will she wake up?"
If possible, I'd like her to get some rest.
"It might take several weeks or months before she wakes up by herself.
That will depend on Claire-san's magical aptitude."
"I see."
"Of course, we could wake her up by force, but that would leave aftereffects on her mana pathways..."
"That's true. We'd best not underestimate the power of these fluctuations.
Perhaps we should prioritize caring for her health...
I let Mu-san's explanation go in one ear and out the other. I looked down at Nee-san, who was quietly snoring, and muttered to myself.
"Nee-san should just sleep here forever."
She was a pain, after all.
Just as I said those words, the air around me seemed to freeze.
Nina-senpai's eyes went wide and Mu-san held her breath.
"Is that truly your will...?"
Nina-sempai spoke in a deep voice, as though she was announcing the end of the world.
"His mighty will gazes upon the distant future. Let us abide by it, no matter what the future holds, until our lives run out..."
Mu-san fell to her knees, like she was resolving herself for something.
What the heck was this mood in the air?
I was overcome by this strange tension and reflexively backed a step up.
