"I, I was just kidding..."
Like seriously, it's also upsetting for me when you take it so seriously.
"What the heck, so it was just a joke..."
"You're so mean. I thought my heart was going to stop."
In the blink of an eye, the mood lightened up and the two of them smiled.
But then why had Nina-senpai gone all serious just now...
"Ah, I, ah, I'll leave Nee-san to you guys."
I practically fled the room.
What the hell was with that mood in the air just now?
Maybe that had really been a bad time to joke around. I decided to reflect on what I'd done.
Still, if I had to explain, I'd have to say that it was because Nee-san had been really stubborn since she was a kid.
She was born with a really strong regenerative power.
It was to the point where you could joke around even if she passed out and didn't wake up. It was that strong.
After having dinner, I played Old Maid with Christina-san and Kanade.
"Uuu~ Is Eliza-sama still mad? I'm dead, I'm totally dead."
Kanade sobbed as she took a card from me.
Ah, she drew the old maid.
"It'll be fine. This house is highly secure. Plus, I'll be around if anything happens."
"But, but, isn't there that big guy among Eliza-sama's minions?"
"Oh yeah, him."
He was probably the student playing bodyguard by Eliza's side. And he also sent me flying earlier.
"Dekuno Bou, right?"
"Yeah yeah. Supposedly, Dekuno Bou's dad is involved with organized crime and he used illegal police forces to bury lots of people in the darkness.
After killing people, they sell off their organs, mince their flesh to bits, and melt their bones in slime. That way they can get rid of people without a trace remaining... Ah, it's over."
"You're talking about Count Oyano Bou, right? While he  is surrounded by bad rumors, I wonder if he actually has the courage to step onto this estate."
"I win."
I used the card I took from Christina-san to clear my hand.
"Cid-kun, you traitor– If we get attacked, I'm using you as a human shield."
"Okay, okay."
"Ah, I'm done too."
"Ehhh– Why can't I win?"
That's because your face shows 100% of what you think.
Well, I thought that, but I'd never say it.
"Is it really fun to play Old Maid with just three people?"
"Yup! It's super fun"
Kanade's eyes sparkled as she responded immediately.
"Ah, I see."
Everyone had their own interests, after all.
"In that case, I'll go bathe first."
"Ehhh—"
"Didn't we agree that the winner would go first?"
"But I was totally going to turn the situation around."
I ignored Kanade's look of mild annoyance as I headed to the bathroom.
"Kanade, want to play Old Maid, just the two of us?"
"Yup yup!"
An unsettling noise came from behind me.
If it was Christina's turn to bathe next, then I would be alone with Kanade.
No, even she would realize that the two of us playing Old Maid would be pointless.
After that, I still ended up playing Old Maid with her.
Late at night.
Several figures were moving through the silent Hope Estate.
Their faces were covered and their weapons were drawn, waiting for the right moment to strike.
"Still not yet, Dad?"
"Calm down, Dekuno."
Dekuno Bou and Oyano Bou whispered to each other.
"But the lights are off."
"Viscount Shinobi is scouting things. Wait for his signal."
"Alright, Dad."
Dekuno Bou sounded somewhat unhappy in his reply.
"Don't worry, Dekuno. I'll give you the credit for this attack."
"Really?!"
"I'm getting old. Once you graduate from the Academy, I'll pass my place on the Night Swords to you."
"Hehe, I'm going to chop that Christina to bits. How dare she look down on us."
"We have two targets, Christina and Kanade. As for Duke Hope... He's got the evidence ready and waiting for us."
"What a pitiful woman. To think her own father sold her out."
Dekuno's laugh came out like a sneer.

"It was a wise choice. He'd be doomed if he allowed his family to be destroyed because of his stupid daughter. Remember, our arrangement for getting the evidence is letting Duke Hope go. Don't kill the wrong person."
"Hehe, got it..."
"Just be careful. Oh yes, there's a male student in the same room as the targets. If I'm not wrong, his name is... Cid Kagenou or something."
"Ah, that mook hanging around Christina. What should we do about him?"
"It doesn't matter. Still, being spotted would be troublesome, so just take him out as well."
"Got it."
"Alright, don't get careless. Viscount Shinobi will be doing reconnaissance while the Bou family will handle the attack. Meanwhile, Marquis Jet is maintaining a perimeter around this mansion."
"In other words, there's no escape for them."

"Yup. Once anything happens, the scout and encirclement teams will move out too. We have killers from the Lawless City in the attack team. The encirclement team has magic swordsmen who made their debut in the Bushin
Festival, as well as that expert "Kenki" who was expelled from the Byakko-ryuu for being too savage. It's fullproof."
"Hehe, that really is your style, dad. Victory is decided before the battle even begins. An absolute victory is the most enjoyable; that's what you've always said."
"Kuku, indeed."
Oyano Bou's mouth twisted into a grin.
"Dad, that's the signal from the scout team."
"Is it? Let's go."
After that, the shadowy figures entered the mansion.
Christina lay on her bed, looking at the ceiling.
She could hear Kanade snoring and Cid breathing.
She couldn't sleep...
It wasn't because of Kanade's snoring, but the incident this morning.

Upon seeing those two blood-stained corpses hanging above the fountain, she couldn't help but feel heartache. These two people, who had spent their lives living by violence, had been mercilessly slaughtered by someone more powerful than them.
Power.
Pure power that could overcome everything.
Be it laws, or ethics or authority, they were all equally worthless in the face of pure power.
"Hehe..."
She raised a hand to the ceiling and laughed.
And then, she heard the quiet sound of rustling cloth.
"Is someone up?"
Nobody responded.
"Kanade? Cid-kun?"
Kanade's snoring and Cid's breathing were still there.
"Am I imagining things..."
Just then, there was a click.
It was the sound of the door opening.
"...Who's that?"
Just as she said that, the door froze halfway.
There was a quiet sigh from beyond the ajar door.
"Is something the matter?"
Saying so, Christina picked up her sword from beside her bed.
If the opposition was someone from the manor, they ought to have answered right away.
Speaking of which, it was strange that the door guards weren't answering.
Soon, the only sound left in the room was Kanade's snoring.
And then–
"Kill them."
The moment the command was given, a horde of black-clad men stormed into the room like an avalanche.
"Everyone, wake up!!"
Christina yelled at the top of her and threw Kanade's blanket at the intruders.
"Gugooohh... What?! Eh? W-What's going on?"
Christina tossed a sword to Kanade, who was still dazed and confused.
"We're under attack!"
Just as she gave her answer, Christina blocked a swing from a large-sized intruder.
She gently exerted force to test his strength.
He was very strong.
He was a skilled opponent.
And so, she shifted the angle of her sword to neutralize his attack.
However, she could still beat him.
Right after that, Christina stabbed her off-balance opponent through the shoulder.
"Guh! You bitch, you actually stabbed me!"
That thuggish voice sounded familiar.
Just as Christina was about to follow up, five attackers held her off.
"Didn't I tell you not to be careless?! Fall back!"
"But, but daaaaad–"
"Shut up!!"
The man called "dad" pushed the big guy away and moved in front of Christina. He was probably the leader of this group.
"Ueeehhh?! What's going on? Am I dead?! Am I going to die here?!"
Kanade was screaming her head off as she tried to keep herself safe from her two attackers.
As for Cid Kagenou...
He was preparing to sneak out through the window.
After meeting Christina's gaze, he smiled awkwardly at her.
"That's just how it is!"
And then he vanished out the window.
"You, you traitor!! I'm going to curse you!! I'll make sure I curse you even if I dieeeeeee!!"
Kanade yelled.
"Dammit, don't let him get away! After him!"
At a command from the leader, three of the men went after Cid.
"...Thanks for the assist."
Christina muttered to herself.
Now, Cid would be handling three of the attackers.
There were still six left.
One of them had a deep wound on his shoulder.
Although the situation was still bad, it wasn't completely hopeless. As long as they could hold out, the guards would notice the disturbance here and rush over.
"Looks like you're placing your hopes on being rescued."
The leader said.
"Am I? Who knows?"
"There's no point trying to hide it. I know you spent a lord to hire more guards, but unfortunately, they won't be coming to rescue you. Right now, we have another force taking care of them."
"How thoughtful of you. It seems the Night Swords are going all out on this."
"This was probably not a lie."
That would mean their chances of surviving this were greatly reduced.
She hadn't expected the Night Swords to launch such a serious offensive.
"Don't look down on us. The Night Swords are as unshakeable as ever.
This was simply a father's concern for his son."
"You're Count Oyano Bou, aren't you? I recognized your son's voice."
"Who are you talking about?"
Oyano Bou pretended he didn't know what Christina was talking about, and then signaled to his men.
"Kill them."
And then, the black-clad men rushed them all at once.
The man in the lead swung down on Christina.
"Guh."
But Christina had not given up.
She parried the man's strike and tried to move over to Kanade before she was surrounded.
However, that plan fell apart before her dumbfounded eyes.
There was a wet sound as the black-clad man's body slid to one side.
"Ah? What's going on- aaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!"
The man had been cut in two mid-screams.
"Ahhhh, h-help me..."
The man gasped weakly as he reached out to his comrades, but there was no helping him.
"You bitch, what the hell did you do?! He was one of the best magic swordsmen in the kingdom."
Oyano Bou glared at Christina.
The other men in black warily kept their distance.
"No, it wasn't me."
The truth is, Christina had not done anything. She had simply intended to parry his strike.
However, he had already been cut in half by then.
There was no way Christina could duplicate that feat of cutting apart a top-notch magic swordsman without anyone noticing.
"Who else could there be?! Or are you saying you had someone else hiding–"
Oyano Bou's eyes went wide while he was speaking.
Both the magic swordsmen facing Kanade had also been bisected.
"Eh? Ehhhh? Have I awakened? Did my secret power finally blossom?!"
Kanade sounded a little excited as she said this.
"But how did you... No, wait. That sword..."
Oyano Bou noticed something. He stared at Kanade's sword.
"Why, why is there no blood on the sword?"
"Huh, it's true."
Kanade's sword was spotless.
It was obvious to anyone that she couldn't have done it.
Just then, the sound of rustling cloth came from behind them.
Everyone's attention was drawn towards it.
It came from Cid Kagenou's bed. However, he had long since fled.
The person standing there was someone they had never seen before.
He was fast asleep, his back illuminated by the moonlight.
"It's, it's the blood-soaked clown..."
Nobody knew who had muttered it first.
And then, the clown turned audibly to face them.
There was a smile on the clown's red-dyed mask.
"Aiiieeeee..."
Dekuno Bou took a step back.
"You must be Jack the Ripper."
In contrast, Oyano Bou was very calm.
He gestured to his men, and then turned to face the blood-soaked clown.
"It's as though you were expecting this. As I thought, he's a hired killer working for you."
"No, he isn't! The Hope family doesn't hire assassins!"
Oyano Bou immediately denied Oyano Bou's words. However, he was no longer listening to her.
"How much did she pay you? Looks like she got her money's worth.
Thanks to you, we've taken a lot of losses."
Oyano Bou glances at the corpses of the brutally slaughtered magic swordsmen.
"They're all famous magic swordsmen from the underworld. It might be had to believe, but this is reality..."
Oyano Bou sighed. He sounded tired.
The blood-soaked clown remained lying on the bed. His mask was still smiling.

"I need to acknowledge reality. We realize that making an enemy of you is not wise. At this rate, if we keep fighting, we'll take huge losses even if we win. The same applies to you. If you've decided to take on the Night Swords, don't expect things to end so simply."
The blood-soaked clown's shoulders twitched with laughter."
"Taking a step back is the wisest choice for both of us, is it not? I'll pay you triple. You won't need to surrender; you just need to not make a move.
We'll also make sure your reputation isn't harmed. How about that?"
The blood-soaked clown's shoulders shuddered.
He was holding back his laughter.
"...What's so funny?"
Suddenly, he froze.
And then, the clown slowly stood up and extended a finger.
Slowly, slowly, the clown's pointed to the attackers. He seemed to be choosing something.
And then, the finger stopped in front of one of them.
"What are you–"
The attacker tilted his head in confusion.
Meanwhile, the clown gently snapped his finger.
In the next moment, the attacker's head flew off.
"How could that–"
Blood gushed like a fountain and the attacker's headless body collapsed to the ground.
"Aiyeeeeaagh! D-Dad! I don't want to die!"
Dekuno Bou's legs turned to jelly and he crumpled to the ground.
However, the blood-soaked clown's finger was already searching for another target. It moved past Dekuno Bou and stopped in front of the attacker beside him.
"W-Wait!"
He was already moving to evade despite his panicked scream; a move truly befitting of a veteran magic swordsman.
But with a snap of the clown's fingers, the top of his face was abruptly sent flying.
His mouth, which still remained attached to his body, was moving as though it wanted to say something, but the only thing that came out was blood-flecked foam.
And then, the blood-soaked clown pointed at Kanade again.
"Ehhh? Me? Why me?! Ueeeeehhhhhhh!"
His finger stopped for a moment, then quickly moved over her, before snapping in the direction of an attacker deeper within the room.
And with that, his head detached from his body.
This left the father and son Oyano Bou and Dekuno Bou.
"Aiiieeee, Dad, dad, let's run!"
Dekuno Bou clung to his father's leg.
Oyano Bou could not hide his shock as he looked down at the bodies of the four magic swordsmen who had been instantly murdered.
"Negotiations have broken down, is it... No. You spared me to display your strength, to lead the discussion in a favorable direction. It seems we still have room for discussion."
The blood-soaked clown did not react to Oyano Bou's words in any way.
"First of all, allow me to apologize. I confess we did underestimate your strength. While I don't know how you did it, I didn't expect it to be so..."
Cold sweat dripped down Dekuno Bou's face.

"However, we have this mansion surrounded. I've also sent a signal to my people and the forces encircling this area will be here soon. That includes the elites from Marquis Jet and Viscount Shinobi's forces, and the master swordsman Kenki of the Byakko-ryuu. However skilled you are, escaping under the circumstances is–"
The blood-soaked clown moved, as though to interrupt Oyano Bou's words.
He was reaching around under the blanket.
At a closer look, the blanket was already stained an unnatural reddish-black.
The clown took out two freshly-severed heads.
"What–"
The heads belonged to a pair of people whom Oyano Bou knew very well.
"Viscount Shinobi... and even Marquis Jet..."
The heads had the 4 and 5 of spades embedded in them respectively.
"Do you mean you wiped out the entire encirclement team...? But how, you're just one man!"
Oyano Bou lost his cool.
"What the hell are you?! What are you going to do?! What do you want?!
His spittle was flying as he broke down into screaming.
The blood-soaked clown slowly produced a card from his pocket.
It was the 6 of spades.
"Aiiieee, aieeeeyeeeaagh!"
Oyano Bou instantly realized who the card was meant for.
He immediately hid himself behind his immobile son, using him as a shield.
"Dad, Dad are you serious?! Let go, let go of meeeee!"
"Aiiieee..."
Dekuno Bou tried to shove his father away. The clown raised his hand, preparing to cut him to bits with the 6 of spades.
Just then, the sound of breaking glass filled the air and a tall magic swordsman showed up.
"Kukuku... So there you are, Jack the Ripper."
His voice was calm, unnaturally so, given the surroundings.
The Uchigatana he drew from its sheath gleamed in the moonlight.
"You, you're... aren't you Kenki?! Are you still alive?"
Life returned to Oyano Bou's voice.
He grinned from behind Dekuno Bou.

And here I thought I could enjoy a good old-fashioned slaughter to get my heart pounding again. Who would have thought that you'd run off after only killing the surrounding mooks? What a disappointment."
Despite that, Kenki's eyes were fixed on the blood-soaked clown.
He already understood.
This clown was an entity on par with himself...
"What is this Kenki person..."
Even Christina was terrified by his churning mana.
There was no doubt that he was a top-class magic swordsman.
"It's no wonder you don't know. This man is a bugeisha from the distant land of Wagoku."
"A bugeisha...?!"
Christina had heard of them before.

It was a land on the other side of the ocean, a country of battle maniacs known as Wagoku, filled with people who sought the zenith of the fighting arts In that country, it was not magic swordsmen but the entities called bugeisha who ruled it as avatars of martial combat.
Practically nothing was known about Wagoku due to their sealed borders, but the occasional bugeisha came here on a warrior's pilgrimage.
Each and every one of them was in a league of their own.

"Also, he belongs to one of Wagoku's four great schools. He made his debut in the Byakko-ryuu and there were hopes that he would become the youngest master of the school. But unfortunately, he was expelled for slaughtering nine of his fellow disciples in the pursuit of strength."
"Whew... Now that's a story from a long time ago. While I'd felt a little bored after coming to this country, I didn't expect to actually be able to cross blades with an unusual bugeisha like you..."
Saying so, Kenki raised his sword.
"Fuhahaahha, Jack the Ripper! You fled because you were afraid of Kenki, weren't you?! Where's your confidence now?!"
Oyano Bou laughed loudly.
"Here I come."
Kenki lowered his stance.
"Gulp."
Kanade swallowed.
And then, the clown snapped his fingers.
Just then, Kenki's body seemed to flicker, and then a hole appeared in the wall behind him.
"So it's that finger snap, hm... It has so much power, yet nothing gives it away... I'm pretty sure that would have been it for anyone else but me."
Kenki muttered happily to himself.
Jack the Ripper seemed a little surprised too. He studied Kenki, as though gauging his strength.
"However, it's no use against me. Even if I can't see it, your ki will tell me everything..."
With that, Kenki closed his eyes and took a stance.
"Come then, Jack the Ripper. You have no way of..."
Just then, there was a pomf sound that left everyone staring speechlessly.
Kenki's head flew off.
Without his head, the rest of his body slowly collapsed, spraying blood from his neck.
Kenki's freshly-severed head fell to the ground, looking dumbly at Jack the Ripper for a moment.
With a quiet sigh, the clown once again raised the 6 of spades.
"But, but how..."
Oyano Bou scrambled back.
"Aiiiieeeee, wait wait wait please wait! We have a powerful force backing us! The Diabl–"
Oyano Bou's words were interrupted by the 6 of spades piercing into his skull.
And then, Dekuno Bou died too.
After the blood-soaked clown verified this fact, he shifted his gaze to Christina and Kanade.
A strange tension filled the air amidst the silence.
"Is he going to kill us... we're witnesses so he's going to kill us, right..."
Kanade trembled like a newborn deer.
But contrary to her expectations, the blood-stained clown left with a picha picha sound.
"Wait!!"
Christina called out to him.
She was in awe of that nigh-divine might which surpassed everything she knew.
"What, what on earth are you trying to do?! You gave me the document from Goethe Moono, right?!"
Upon hearing that, the blood-soaked clown stopped.
"Why me? What do you want me to do?"
The blood-soaked clown did not reply.
His smiling mask stared straight at Christina.
"Kuku..."
The clown chuckled quietly.
And then, he flung a card over.
Christina reflexively made to block it with her sword.
However, the card whizzed past Christina's face before sticking in Kanade's temple.
"Ueeehhhhhh?!"
"Kanade?!"
Kanade collapsed, bleeding from her head.
"Kukuku..."
The clown leaped out the window.
However, Christina could not chase him
"Are you alright?! Kanade, talk to me!"
That was because Kanade was in mortal danger.
She was a friend that she could talk to freely, without worrying about her family background.
This was the first time she had had such a relationship.
"Kanade, Kanade!"
She was still breathing, she still had a heartbeat. If she could just stop the bleeding...!
"Ugh... Christina-san..."
"Kanade, hang in there!"
Kanade placed a trembling hand on top of Christina's.
"It's okay, I'm... I'm too far gone..."
"That's impossible!"
"I know my own body the best..."
"No, no, Kanade, you don't understand. You'll be fine. I'll save you, I promise!!"
"So I hope... you'll hear my last words..."
"You don't have to say that...!"
"Please, Christina."
Kanade looked Christina in the eyes with a serious expression on her face.
"Alright. You don't need to say any last words, but if it'll calm you down, I'll listen to them. If there's anything you need to say, tell me and I'll pass them on to your parents in your hometown."
"Thank you, Christina... But I have nothing to say to my folks."
"My last words are...!"
Kanade's eyes went wide.
"Cid Kagenou, you dirty traitor! I will NEVER forgive you! I'm going to curse you to death so you'd better be ready for it!"
And then, Kanade slowly closed her eyes.
"Kanade, Kanade, please open your eyes!!"
But she was no longer moving.
"Look, we need to clean the place up after this; things are going to be really troublesome if you fall asleep here!"
Christina vigorously wrenched the card from Kanade's head.
"Ow."
"This is just fake blood."
"Eh...? I'm still alive?"
At a loss for words, Kanade patted her head.
"Relax, you're unhurt, Kanade."
"Eh? But the card stuck in my head..."
"It was just stuck on with fake blood."
"D-dammit...That damn Jack the Ripper..."
She jumped up, her face bright red.
"Wait a minute, there's something written on it."
"Huh? What is it, what is it?
Christina studied the verses written in blood on the back of the card.
"O shameless Night Swords
All bad guys will be slain
While I'm just counting up
I play around like this sometimes"
"What does this mean?"
"There must be some special meaning to this, right..."
Just then, the room door slowly opened.
"Yo, guys, you're all okay!"
The ordinary black-haired boy who ran over with a fake smile on his face was Cid Kagenou.
"I'm glad you're fine too."
Christina breathed a sigh of relief.
"Yoyo, Cid-kun yo!  You've got a lot of guts to be showing your face here after running off, you dirty traitor!"
Kanade, on the other hand, addressed him like a street punk.
"Nonono, I barely managed to survive myself."
"You barely survived? I almost DIED because you ran off, you know?
And I WOULD have died if not for Jack the Ripper-sempai."
"Eh, did Jack the Ripper show up?"
"Yeah, he did! He made a stylish entrance and went pew pew pew! It was so scary!"
At some point, Kanade had reverted to her original state.
"Huh, that's good then."
"Yup yup. And then, that bugeisha from Wagoku got one-shotted... Wait a minute! This is about YOU, Cid Kagenou!"
"Ah, okay."
"I'll never forgive you, you traitor! How dare you abandon me and run off by myself!"
"I'm very sorry."
"Sorry is not enough. I'm going to punish you in the way you deserve...
with a good bonking!"
Kanade tangled up Cid's legs before getting into a full mount on top of him and pounding his face.
"How about that?! Do you give?!"
"Uwaah– Dooon't–"
His bonking proceeded for a good long time.

c4.text: The knights were already starting to gather evidence as the first rays of sunlight filled the Hope household.
"I see, I see. So Count Oyano Bou, Viscount Shinobi and Marquis Jet plotted to attack the Hope family together..."
Christina and the others were telling Chief Gray of the knights'
investigative department about the details of the incident.
And then, the blood-soaked clown showed up then, Jack the Ripper, was it? He killed all the attackers and then left without doing anything to you... That all sounds very convenient for you."
Gray looked at Christina with eyes full of suspicion.
"Still, that is the truth."
"In that case, considering Jack the Ripper to be an assassin-cum-bodyguard hired by the Hope family would be a natural conclusion to reach."
"That's wrong! We'd never do something so blatant."
"But from another point of view, you might have done something that blatant to avoid the suspicion of others."

"Please rein yourself in. The attack launched by Count Oyano Bou, Viscount Shinobi and Marquis Jet is the issue at hand here. The knights' job should be to investigate the relationship behind them..."
"Ah– well, about that, this so-called "attack" is merely from the Hope's point of view."
Gray narrowed his eyes and smiled.
"...What are you trying to say?"
"Count Oyano Bou and the others were lured here and framed. We could interpret things that way as well, couldn't we?"
"What?! That's impossible; they were masked  and carrying weapons!"

"Well, it IS a well-made replica. I suppose you could sell it for several thousand Zenis."
"If they wanted money, it would have made more sense to steal something else."
"Yeah, there were so many vases out there which were worth millions of Zenis as art pieces. Why would the thief go for a replica that was worth the least of them all?"
"Given the circumstances, it's more likely that it was Jack the Ripper or one of the Night Swords' people who did it."
"Could it be that they couldn't tell it was a replica?"

"I don't think so, right? However well-made it was, you ought to be able to tell at a glance that it's a replica. Anyone who couldn't even do that is probably some kind of born pauper with no education or upbringing."
"True, that."
As Alexia and Christina spoke to each other, Kanade and Cid's eyes met by coincidence.
"No education..."
"Born pauper..."
The two of them rounded their shoulders in dejection.
"That really is hard to understand. Perhaps Jack the Ripper hid a message in there somewhere."
"Well, we can't deny that. It's worth giving it a look.
"I doubt we'll find anything."
"Shut up, Poochie. Take me there, Christina! We're going to use the smallest clues to solve this mystery!
"Like I said, it's a waste of time."
"We're off, Poochie."
That day, Alexia and the others searched the crime scene until very late at night, but they didn't manage to find anything.
"The 'White House' is just up ahead."
"Yay~"
Christina-san led us to the capital's high-end residential district.

Around us were high-class homes that were easily worth 1 billion Zenis each. While Christina-san's home was larger than them, this street as a whole radiated a sense of classiness that left Kanade and myself tongue-tied.
"That's strange. Jack the Ripper should have left us a clue. Maybe there was a code that could only be read in the reflection of the sunlight in the mirror in the hallways..."
Behind us was Alexia with big black eye rings, muttering about pointless deductions.
"Is it me or are we not supposed to be here?"
Kanade was acting really suspiciously as she looked at me.
"You could have stayed at home."
"It's safer with everyone else!"
"That's true."
"...I'll definitely survive if I use Alexia-hime as a shield."
Kanade uttered this somewhat disrespectful line in a very small voice, but my ears picked everything up.
That said, I led a fairly disrespectful life myself, so I gave her my silent blessing.
"You might end up making history, Kanade."
In a bad sense, of course.
"Ueh? Really? Aw, now I'm embarrassed."
Kanade smiled in a somewhat disgusting way.
"Hm?"
I sense presences by force of habit, and just then, I picked up an overwhelmingly powerful mana signature approaching at startling speed.
What the hell is she doing, it's dangerous.
Just as I thought that, Delta showed up.
"...This might be bad."
"Huh? Did something happen?"
"No, but, well..."
If she turned up now, my mob act was going to draw a lot of unnecessary action.
"I need to go take a dump..."
After dropping off that totally natural and smooth excuse, I was about to leave when...
"BOSS–!"
The beast-girl rushed toward me at top speed.
"Delta, wait!"
"Hm? Delta sucks at waiting!"
Delta instantly slowed down, but only for an instant.
However, an instant was enough for me.
After backing off at the maximum speed achievable for a mob. I cast another spell on Delta.
"Wait!"
"Uu?"
Delta instantly slammed on the brakes.
But then she immediately sped up again.
"Wait! Wait!"
"Uuu?! Uuu?!"
"Waitwaitwaitwaitwait!!"
And so, she slowly reached me while moving in decelerating freeze-frame.
"Uuuuuuuu..."
Delta was starting to get annoyed by the continuous waiting, while Alexia and company were startled by the mysterious beast-girl that had appeared out of nowhere.
How am I going to explain this, I thought as I reflexively grabbed my head.
"Ah, Poochie, is she a friend of yours? Her mana feels really powerful."
Alexia backed off from Delta due to the strength of her mana. The repeated waits just now had caused Delta's mana to swell almost to the point of bursting.
"Er, I guess you can call her my pet... There there, good girl."
I patted Delta's head to keep her mana from surging. Letting her erupt in a place like this would be a tragedy in the making.
"That's one dangerous pet you're raising. Also, beast-man slaves are illegal, aren't they?"
Alexia looked at me tensely while saying this.
"Ah, this is bad."
By the time I noticed, it was too late.
"Oi, don't talk to the Boss, you small fry."
Delta picked up on Alexia's hostile look and accepted it.
"Be good, be good, come on, be good!"
I patted Delta's head with all of my might.
Meanwhile, Delta's expression gradually softened.
"You're calling me small fry? I can't pretend I didn't hear that now."
Alexia proceeded to put out her flames with gasoline.
"Oi, you brainlet, stop that–"
Alexia was talking mad shit for someone whose head would disintegrate in a single hit from Delta.
"Fuaahhh~ Grrrrrrrr..."
Delta growled at Alexia even as her mind was slowly melted by the head-pats.
I put Delta in a headlock and then dragged her off.
"Oh dear, my pet's being a little rowdy, sorry about that."
"Wait, I'm not finished."
"Yes yes yes, you can finish up later."
After putting Delta into a more secure headlock, I left Alexia and the others.
"Gaoo, that hurt."
"Ah, I'm sorry."
I let Delta go after we reached the shadows of a fancy home.
"You're so strong, Boss. And you weren't even using mana!"
"Well, I DID train myself properly. More importantly, didn't I tell you NOT to approach me when I'm with people from the surface?"
"Hm?"
"Ugh– Look. These are the rules– when I'm with people from the surface world, don't..."
"Hmmm?"
After seeing Delta tilt her head and look at me with an expression of absolute cluelessness, I decided to give up.
"No, it's nothing. I'm not going to waste my effort."
"Delta's not going to waste her effort either!"
"Yup, thought so. Speaking of which, what are you doing here, Delta?"
"I wanted to see you, Boss!"
"So you're here just to see me?"
"Nope! Boss, can I beat the crap out of that bitch from just now? Delta will show her her place!"
"No, you may not beat her up. She might not look it, but she's a princess of this country and beating her up will be troublesome. So, what are you here for, Delta?"
"It's okay! Delta will beat the crap out of her and make her shake her ass in front of you, Boss!"
"NO. What are you doing here, Delta? Also, I forbid you to beat Alexia up. No means no."
"No means no?"
"No means no."
"But she acts so cocky despite being so weak."
"She IS weak, but no."
"Uuu~ Okay, fine."
"So, what are you doing here, Delta?"
"Ah, Delta is..."
Delta tilted her head and blinked, like she was trying to recall something.
"Right! Delta is looking for the molly!"
"What happened to the mol... I mean, Zeta?"
"Alpha-sama said to find her! Ah, her report? Too many blanks? Um–
I'm not too sure, but everything will be OK as long as I beat up the molly and drag her back!"
"Ah, I see."
Well, when it came to finding people, Delta's nose was the best choice.
Although, I doubted that Zeta would obediently follow Delta's commands, even if she did find her.
"Sniff sniff, you smell a little like that molly, Boss. Just a little, though."
Delta sniffed me up and down as her nose twitched.
"We haven't met in a while. The last time was probably during the previous incident."
"This country smells of the molly, but only a bit. She must have gone somewhere else."
Delta's expression slowly grew serious as she sought the scent. This was how she looked when hunting.
Just then, I sensed a faint presence and turned around."
"Wait for me~ Delta-samaaaa~"
A panting beast-girl appeared. She was pretty and had blue eyes and her ears and tail were a black and white color, kind of like a Siberian husky.
"Huh? Delta-sama, could this be..."
"Ehe, Boss is Delta's boss!"
Delta puffed up her chest as she introduced me in a way that didn't even count as an introduction.
"Ah, hi. I'm Cid Kagenou. Are you a friend of Delta's?"
"Eh? Ehhhhhhhh?! Is it actually~?!"
Miss Siberian Husky's eyes went wide.
"Er, Delta, who is she?"
"She's Delta's lackey!"
Delta had a smug look on her face.
Even Delta had subordinates now? Heaven help us all.
"So she's your lackey. What's she called?"
"She's called Pi!
"Pi-chan, I see."
Since it was a Greek letter, she must be linked to Mitsugoshi.
"I'm Pi-chan~ Nice to meet you~!"
After Pi said that, she immediately rolled onto her back.
"That's the pose of submission!"
Delta nodded in satisfaction.
"Ah, I see."
For some reason, I felt that commenting further would be troublesome, so I casually nodded.
"Uuu~ He's looking down on me~ He's looking at me like a cockroach~"
"No, I'm not."
Speaking of which, I suddenly remembered that most beast-people were like this. Yukime and Zeta were exceptions.
"But whyyyy~ Did Pi do something wrong~ If Master hates Pi then Pi can't live on in this pack."
"Boss! Does Pi fit into the pack? She's a dummy, but she's a good girl, you know!"
"She kind of fits in, right?"
Hell if I knew.
"Woohoo! Boss accepted Pi!"
"It's true~ Pi will work hard for Master."
Pi sprang up and wagged her tail happily.
"Sniff sniff."
And then, she began sniffing me while her nose twitched.
"Pi has remembered the Master's scent!"
"Boss, Pi's amazing! She might be dumb but her nose might be better than Delta's!"
"Huh~ That's amazing."
I had to say, being dumber than Delta is an amazing feat.
"Also,  also, Pi is super strong!"
"I know that."
The presence concealment technique she had used when appearing was something else.
"Ehehe~"
She giggled with a dorky look on her face, but she seemed pretty okay besides her intelligence.
"Master, when are you going to take over the world~"
"No, I'm not going to do that."
"It isn't time yet~ In order to create the strongest pack; Pi is working with Delta-sama every night on a plan to take over the world."
What the hell is with that ominous-sounding plan?
"Not yet, Pi! Right now, we're only at the step where we give birth to 10000 of Boss' kids!"
There's a rare look of panic on Delta's face as she tries to stop Pi from speaking.
The two of them whisper to each other while looking at me.
"Eh~ So we can't take over the world with just 10000 people~"
"Alpha-sama said it wouldn't work! So if we have more, like, a million or more, Alpha-sama will say yes!"
"Eh~ So many~"
Delta waggled her hands by way of emphasis, which startled Pi.
"Which is why I said it's too early to tell Boss about "Pi and Delta's Totally Awesome World Domination Plan" right now!"
Yeah, that's one scary-sounding plan. We can only pray it will never come to fruition.
"Then let's make a new plan~"
"No! We're supposed to be chasing that molly!"
"Ah~ I see. But Pi is allergic to cats."
Just then, I sensed Alexia's presence approaching me.
"I say, just how long do you expect us to wait?!"
"Ah, sorry, I'm coming over right now."
I gave Pi and Delta a look, and they instantly vanished into the distance.
While their IQ scores might be depressing, their instincts and coordination was top-notch. Maybe it was because they were canine-types?
After that, I met up with Alexia and the others and apologized to them with a suitable excuse.
"Count White. Princess Alexia has been sighted at the outer gate."
Count White looked up after the White House's butler delivered his report.
"What is Alexia-hime doing here?"
"She said she wanted to be present when Jack the Ripper attacked."
"What a pain..."
Count White sighed.
"I won't let them into the premises. If they're willing to stay outside with the knights, then I'll allow it."
"Is that alright? This is Alexia-hime here."
"She's a powerless princess. Once we deal with Jack the Ripper, we'll invite her to a dinner party to soothe her feelings."
"We shall proceed as you wish, then."
The butler bowed and then left the room.
"Honestly, why did she have to come at a busy time like this..."
As Count White muttered anxiously to himself, he took a seat at a round table.
Six of the Night Swords were here, including himself.
"Sorry to keep you waiting. Thank you all for providing your support."
Count White dipped his head to them.
"Don't worry about it. After all, this is a problem which affects the
"Thirteen Night Swords" as a whole."
"Count Oyano Bou, Viscount Shinobi and even Marquis Jet were killed by that guy. The only remaining members of the Night Swords are the six of us here and Marquis Darkaigan."
"The Night Swords becoming weak was inevitable. We'll need five...
No, probably 10 years to raise suitable successors."
"That's a matter for later. Right now, our top priority should be killing Jack the Ripper."
"Surely that won't be a problem, right? The senior members of the Night Swords present have gathered all their fighting strength, with nothing held back.
A single clown fooling around is no threat to us."
The Night Swords unanimously agreed.
"So where is Darkaigan-sama?"
Count White looked around for the last, absent Night Sword.
"I think he's negotiating with that organization. We can't rely on the Fenrir Faction any more. Right now, talks are in progress with the people in power from the Loki Faction."
"If the talks succeed, they'll be able to send strong helpers."
"Our opponent is just one man. Don't you think this is a little excessive?
"This is the greatest crisis the Night Swords have faced since their founding. It's better to err on the side of caution. After all, we know nothing about Jack the Ripper.
"Ah, that ridiculous clown assassin. Do we really have no leads on him?"
The members shifted the topic to Jack the Ripper.
"We believed he was a hired killer from the Hope family, but the odds of that seem very low now. There's no way the Hopes could hire an assassin like that."
Count White folded his arms. There was a complex look on his face.
"Hm, then it must be another organization. Could it be that Shadow Garden from before?"
"If it were Shadow Garden, they wouldn't have to work in such a roundabout way. They wouldn't do things like dress up as clowns, use playing cards and leave messages behind."
"It's clear that this Jack the Ripper enjoys killing. He's probably not affiliated with any organization, just a lone killer. But does he kill for pleasure or for hatred..."
"So he's just acting alone then... it seems he's really looking down on the Thirteen Night Swords."
"Shall we inform him, then? Inform him... of the consequences of looking down on us."
After that, the Night Swords left their places.
"The magic swordsmen are ready. Now, I shall show you the way to the place which will become Jack the Ripper's grave tonight, inside the Underground Colosseum."
The butler lit the fireplace in the room after Count White said that.
The flames sparkled with blue light, tracing magical characters in the air.
And then, it transformed into a staircase leading downward.
"It always looks so beautiful no matter how many times I look at it. Is this an artifact from the ancient elven empire?"
"Indeed. Be it elven artifacts, elven tomes, elven weapons or elven slaves anything to do with the elves is worth a large sum."
Count White led the way forward and the group descended the stairs.
The stairway was very wide and all manner of disturbing items were displayed on both sides of it.
"Oh, that sword came from that rabbit beast-man who lost several days ago..."
"Well, that was an exciting match. Beast-men who have their family members held hostage can be very scary."
"Supposedly, rabbit beast-men's love for their kin runs exceptionally deep. Oh my, their wish to save their family members brings a tear to my eye."
The Night Sword said this as he pointed at the broken, blood-stained sword and the battered suit of armor.
"They're still taxidermying his body. Once it's done, I intend to exhibit him here with this sword.
"Please tell me when you do. Speaking of which, what happened to his family?"
"I'm planning to taxidermy them and display them here too. That beast-man would like that, right?"
"So you'll recall the thrill of that battle every time you pass through here, then... Marvellous."
They progressed down the stairs as they spoke, flanked by blood-stained arms and preserved specimens.
And then, the door to the colosseum opened.
Before it was a dark, dome-shaped area.
The light of the torches ringed the circular arena, and the walls were covered in blackened stains and signs of battle.
This place was not a grand venue like the Bushin Festival. The only things here were blood-stained memories of death in the dark.
"This is it."
The butler nodded and Count White led them to the special audience seats.
"This place is protected by a powerful artifact force-field. Even if Jack the Ripper shows up, he will not be able to lay a single finger on you gentlemen."
The Night Swords took their seats and looked down on the arena.
"Meanwhile, the colosseum's depths are filled with skilled magic swordsmen from around the world. Here's a list of them."
Saying so, the butler handed out a list of magic swordsmen and their details to the Night Swords.
"Thank you for your hard work. This truly is... Well, I have to hand it to you for being able to gather so many magic swordsmen."
Count White held his breath as he read through the list.
"Hahaha, well, it's simply the result of us Night Swords opening our purses and not holding anything back. Such an outcome is only to be expected, no?"
"The blade master of Vegalta, the demon of the City-States, and the legend of the Lawless City... One can hardly help calling this level of fighting strength excessive."
"Jack the Ripper is just one man. I'm pretty sure he'd be reduced to dust if they all made their move at once."
"That's when Count White comes in. You'll entertain us, won't you?"
The Night Swords seemed at ease after looking at the list of first-class swordsmen.
"But of course. The arrangements I've made are ready."
Count White pointed to the colosseum entrance.

"That's the only entrance to the underground colosseum. All other places have been sealed off, so if Jack the Ripper wants to come after us, he'll have to come in through there. Once he does, the force-field will activate.
Count White waved his hand and the entire arena shone. The dome-shaped force-field sprang into being.
"Just so. If Jack the Ripper wants to leave the force-field, he'll have to wipe out all the magic swordsmen we've gathered."
"Surely he can't wipe them all out, right?"

"Of course, so we'll pick his opponents based on his stamina. We'll start by sending them in one at a time, and then slowly increase the numbers based on the situation. This ought to be a spectacular show."
Count White said smugly.
"Can we pick them? This sounds interesting."
"Oh, an audience participation show, then. I heard Mitsugoshi liked doing this recently."
"Damn Mitsugoshi. How dare they infringe on our interests..."

"We could stand to learn a lot from how they do business. Right now, we should be choosing coexistence rather than hostility. Now then, who will be the first up? How about the legend from the Lawless City?"
"That's a bit too strong, right? It would be a shame if everything ended with the first battle."
The Night Swords picked magic swordsmen with delight on their faces.
And then, after the Night Swords had finished their selection, Count White muttered to himself.
"It seems the sun has set up above. Now then, will Jack the Ripper come?"
"If he actually does come to a place with all these magic swordsmen in wait, then he is clearly just a fool... But if he doesn't, it'll be boring for us."
"That's alright. If he doesn't come, it means he fled in fear of us. All we'll have to do is spread the news, and our reputation will be preserved."
"Rather, he's the one who'll be disgraced. He'll be the laughingstock of the capital for announcing his intentions and then running off instead."
"Either way, we won't lose out."
"Not so– our coffers have certainly lost much from hiring all those magic swordsmen."
Gahaha, their crass laughter filled the colosseum.
"Is this really alright, Alexia-hime?"
Alexia, Christina and Kanade were making their way down a dimly-lit passage.
"It'll be fine. I know the Royal Capital's underground pretty well."
Alexia was in the lead, full of confidence.
Still, the White House having a secret basement is just a rumor, right?"
"It might not be just a rumor."
"Then do you have anything to back it up?"
"Bad guys always have secret underground lairs below their houses and so on."
Christina replied vaguely, and then she looked back at Kanade, who was in the rear.
"I'll be fine as long as Alexia-sama is nearby...I'll just use her as a shield if anything happens...."
She seemed to be muttering something to herself in abject terror.
"Will Cid-kun be alright? I know we left him with the knights, but..."

"Honestly, Poochie's such a coward at critical moments like this. Meh, his swordsmanship is average at best, so it can't be helped. Though he doesn't seem to be a target of the Night Swords right now, so he should be fine."
"After all, the Night Swords only care about Jack the Ripper right now.
They even seem to have stopped monitoring Kanade."
"Eh? Really?"
Kanade's eyes lit up.
"Yup. The Night Swords consider Jack the Ripper to be that much of a threat. They'll probably focus all their fighting strength on him until the incident is over."
"Then I hope the incident never gets resolved."
An evil grin crosses Kanade's face.

"Relax, I've got a plan for this... While the Night Swords are in chaos because of Jack the Ripper's attack, we'll sneak into the White House from below and gather evidence of their crimes. As long as it works, everything will be easily settled."
Alexia proudly stated.
"Ah, you must have come up with it on the spot after Cid-kun found that sewer entrance by chance, right?"
"Being flexible and taking advantage of opportunities is very important in battle."
"Cid-kun... What kind of a person IS he, anyway..."
Christina paused briefly before saying so.
"What kind of person is he? Poochie is Poochie."
"He was the one who found the tunnel, and he was the one who deciphered Jack the Ripper's message. Normally, people who encounter these things would be too frightened to care about those details."
"Well, well that... That actually makes sense. And here I thought Poochie just had a keen nose."
Alexia also seemed to be waxing thoughtful.
"Cid-kun's ability to pick up useful information from small details is quite remarkable."
"I, I could have deciphered it too..."
Kanade mumbled.
"Also, he seems kind of familiar. He's got an air of mystery around him... Could it be that Cid-kun is..."
"A-Are you saying Poochie is a..."
Alexia said uneasily.
"He might be a great detective."
"Hah? A great detective?"
"Yup. He's actually a veteran great detective. He was probably drugged by an evil organization, like Great Detective Conyan from Natsume Kafka-
sensei's stories, and he became a kid. Then he snuck into the magic swordsman academy while pretending to be a student..."
"Yeah, right, there's no way Poochie could be a detective or anything.
He's a totally ordinary guy. Ah, see, it's the White family crest. Just as I planned."
The wall where Alexia was pointing did have the White family crest on it.
"No way, don't tell me Cid-kun even deduced all this..."
"See, see~ It's just as I said it would be, right?"
Alexia smugly began inspecting the wall.
"So what do you plan to do next?"
"Usually there are hidden doors in places like these."
"While I don't really think we'll find something like that so easily..."
"Got it!"
"Ehhhhhh?!"
Alexia did something to the crest, and then there was a click, followed by the door sliding open.
"It's just like the secret doors in the royal palace. The ruling class fundamentally all think the same way."
Alexia entered the dark and narrow passage, feeling proud of herself."
"Ahhh, spider webs are such a pain. Looks like nobody's used this passage in a long time."
"Alexia-same, it's too dangerous here. Maybe we should be more cautious..."
"I  am being cautious. Compared to Claire, that is."
"Does that even mean anything?"
Christina and Kanade followed behind Alexia.
Shortly after walking through the dark passage, Alexia suddenly came to a halt.
"...We've reached the end."
Alexia touched the wall as she said this.
"This wall looks solid, but I can sense the movement of air on the other side."
"Huh, there's light leaking out at the base of the wall."
Just as Kanade indicated, there were faint rays of light visible through faint gaps in the wall.
"This is the only place in the wall made of different material... If we do this..."
After pushing and prodding the wall here and there, it lifted up slightly, forming a small gap big enough for people to pass through.
"Alright, here we go."
Alexia crouched down and crawled forward.
"Please be more careful, Alexia-hime."
"At times like these, the second person is the safest... The third person usually gets squashed by a falling wall or their legs get eaten by monsters..."
"It's dangerous, so please stay behind me, Kanade."
"Ehhh?!"
Kanade stared dumbly at Christina as she crawled in, and then she looked back in a panic.
"I, I'm not sensing any monsters, or pursuers either..."
After verifying that the wall was safe, she finally crawled in behind Christina.
"Kyaa? Hang on, Kanade! My skirt!"
"I can't do this I can't do this I can't do this."
"Christina?! However charming my butt might be, please don't rub it."
"N-no, it's not like that, it's  because Kanade is pushing me..."
"Hurry hurry hurry hurry..."
With Kanade pushing them from behind, the three of them crawled to the other side of the wall.
"We're here~ Really, what kind of place is this?"
It was a dark, dome-shaped area.
"Alexia-sama, look over there...!"
The Night Swords were gathered at the place where Christina was pointing. Since the area was dark and they were some distance away, it would seem they had not noticed the girls' arrival.
"It's the Night Swords, six of them... What on earth is going on here?"
"Gulp..."
The three of them tried to hide their presences as best as they could and looked around, which was when they discovered that they were in the audience seats."
"Is this a colosseum? ...I guess this really is under the White House."
"I've heard some bad rumors about the Count. They say he has slaves fight each other and bets on them... Could it be true?"
"Gulp..."
As they peeked around, the colosseum suddenly glowed with a faint light.
"Is it me, or is something about to begin..."
With that, the three of them turned their gaze to the center of the light.

c5.text: "Jack the Ripper didn't show up, huh?"
One of the Night Swords said in annoyance as he enjoyed his dinner.
It was almost midnight and time for the day to roll over.
"So he ran off in the end because he was afraid of us, then?"
"I heard he defeated a bugeisha of Wagoku. How disappointing."
"Still, this is fine. It shows that nobody can resist the Night Swords when we band together, no?"
"Looks like we gathered too many fighters. It might have been a bit too much for Jack the Ripper."
The Night Swords laughed derisively.
"We'll spread the word once the date changes. Jack the Ripper fled like a coward and the Night Swords still stand. That way, nobody will dare take us lightly again..."
Just as White spoke, a faint glow filled the colosseum.
The glow gradually grew in intensity, as though it was reacting to something.
"This is..."
"See, he came. This is a reaction to an intruder's mana."
After that, once the entire colosseum was filled with a brilliant light, the dome-shaped artifact force-field was established.
In its middle was a blood-soaked clown who had appeared there without their notice.
"Is that Jack the Ripper?"
"He's a blood-stained little clown, just like the reports said."
"Hmm... He doesn't seem very strong."
"You can't really tell that by appearances. That said, he doesn't seem very smart. After all, he deliberately stepped into the trap we set for him."
"No doubt about that. Still, at least it will help relieve our boredom."
The Night Swords leaned out to look at Jack the Ripper.
"Well done on not running away, Jack the Ripper. You did keep us waiting for a long time, though. Did it really take so long to prepare yourself for death?"
Count White adopted a more theatrical tone of speaking as he said that.
However, Jack the Ripper remained unmoved.
"Go on, say something. You're looking for the Night Swords, aren't you?
Don't you have any complaints or grievances? Come on and let us hear all about them. Did we kill your mommy or daddy? Or did we sell off your kids?
Confiscate your property? Well I'm sorry, but there's just too many of these for us all to commit to memory."
The colosseum echoed with the Night Swords' laughter.

"Or are you so scared you can't even speak? Meh, it doesn't matter. I've prepared a secret game for you. The rules are simple; you just have to beat all the assassins we've prepared for you. That way, the force-field surrounding the colosseum will be dispelled. And who knows, you might actually be able to kill us like you announced, no?"
Count White looked down on Jack the Ripper with a smug grin on his face.

"Just in case, I should tell you that this force-field is being created by a powerful artifact. The amount of money it took us to acquire it isn't a sum you'd be able to match even in a hundred lifetimes of work. You won't be able to break it by brute force. Therefore, you have only one path to survival; which is to defeat all the assassins here!"
Count White spread his arms and raised his volume.
"Now let the games begin! Enter, the first assassin!"
The gates of the arena swung open, and a magic swordsman walked through them.
He was a hulking man in heavy armor, wielding a gigantic sword which he swung through the air with ease. He turned to the audience seats to bow to the Night Swords.

"This man is a magic gladiator from the city-state of Spartan! His record is two hundred wins and no losses in the Spartan gladiatorial arenas, famed as the cruelest in the world! That mighty blade of his has cloven foe after foe in half and earned him the title of "Mincemeat" Butcher!"
Butcher walked forward and looked down at Jack the Ripper.
"Oi oi, there were all those nasty bastards in the ready room so I thought I'd be fighting a real badass, but turns out it's just a fucking clown!"
Butcher sneered and took a stance with his greatsword.
"Now then, let the first match begin!"
Butcher swung down with his sword as the starting signal was given.
A terrible noise and collision made the entire colosseum shudder.
"W-What kind of sword was that?"
"Is that a magic gladiator from Spartan? The rumors don't do them justice."
"He missed, though."
Indeed, Butcher's strike had missed.
However, Jack the Ripper had not dodged his blow. In other words, the first strike had never been meant to hit.

"I missed that one. After all, the audience would get bored if the fight ended in one stroke. A magic gladiator who only knows how to win is ultimately second-rate. Only those who can play to the audience are first-rate."
After that arrogant declaration, Butcher rested his greatsword back on his shoulder.

"Come on then, you fucking clown. I've got your number. You couldn't even react to that hit just now; you won't be able to beat me no matter how hard you try. Don't worry though, a magic gladiator's job is to take even a third-rate fight and liven it gwaaaargh?!"
Butcher was sent flying through the air.
His face was covered in blood as he crashed violently into the force-field above them. There was a loud picha sound as he lodged into it.
Drip. Drip. Butcher's blood rained down on the clown.
He slowly retracted his upraised leg.
"...And, and the winner is Jack the Ripper."
It sounded like Count White was forcing himself to say that.
There was a commotion among the Night Swords.
"W-What just happened?"
"He kicked him. He kicked him at incredible speed!"
"Count Battler, did you see that?"
"Just barely. It may not seem that way, but I got to my position with sheer skill. That guy..."
"Come to think of it, Count Battler's supposed to be an excellent magic swordsman."
"No way, are you saying that he finished off his opponent with one kick?"
"Still, we did go out of our way to pick an opponent he could beat for the first fight. That much was within expectations."
"Why don't we switch up his opponents for the second bout then? You don't mind, do you, Count Battler?"
There were no objections.
White took a sip of wine and summoned the contenders for the next round.
"Now then, your opponents for the second fight!"
This time, there were three magic swordsmen.

"These are the captains of the legendary mercenary band "White Wolf", which won fame in song and story during the Vegaltan Uprising!! However, their employer Doem Ketsuhat was slain during the battle for the Oriana Kingdom and their finances are in trouble! These veteran warriors would normally never have appeared in a place like this; each and every one of them is a true master, far beyond Butcher's level! Behold their coordinated offense, and the steely spirit born of operating in the red!"
The three men were calm magic swordsmen in their thirties and forties.
They used a sword, axe and spear respectively.
They were all studying Jack the Ripper with keen gazes.
"...What do you think?"
The swordsman asked.
"I don't know. I can't read him at all. Still, not being able to read him is quite unusual in itself.'
The axeman replied.
"And here I thought this would be an easy job. It might be a three-on-one, but don't go resenting us, you hear."
After the spearman spoke, the three of them raised their weapons.
"And now, let the second match begin!"
As the battle began, the three of them moved to encircle Jack the Ripper.
They carefully kept their distance from him while studying the situation.
Meanwhile, Jack the Ripper remained immobile.
The leaders of "White Wolf" slowly began to move around him.
Once, twice, three times...
A long, boring period where nothing happened elapsed.
"...Aren't they just going around him in circles?"
One of the Night Swords said.
Other dissatisfied voices spoke out in support of him.
The members of "White Wolf" must have heard them too, but none of them responded or changed their actions. They simply continued circling Jack the Ripper.
Nothing happened.
Although this only seemed like an ordinary battle on the surface, a faint ripple was going through the White Wolves.
Drip, drip, drip. An abnormal amount of sweat flowed from the faces of the trio.
Their breathing also grew rapid, and they were so focused that their eyes were turning bloodshot.
A strange tension filled the colosseum and those unsatisfied voices vanished.
Everything was silent.
Right at that moment, Jack the Ripper made his move.
All he did was raise his foot and step forward.
It was a casual step, which carried no danger or change with it.
However, the "White Wolves" reacted in quite an abnormal way.
In an instant, they had retreated to the edges of the colosseum.
Their breathing was heavy and ragged and their faces were tense. The shaking of their weapons alluded to how they felt.
They were gripped by a fear they had never experienced before.
Before them was nothing but a strange little clown.
But in the eyes of these hoary veterans, it was as though they were staring down the end of the world itself.
One of the mercenaries put down his sword.
This was immediately followed by the spear and axe user putting down their weapons too.
"Let's call it off, it's not worth it..."
The sword-user said in a trembling voice.
"Calling it off...?! Are you forgetting something?! You're breaking the contract!"
"Yes, we're mercenaries. Yes, we're all prepared to die on the battlefield.
But not underground where it stinks of mildew."
The spear user replied.
"Are you kidding me?! Do you have any idea how much the penalty clause is?! The rep of the "White Wolves" is going to plummet if word of their captains running away starts going around!"
"We'll pay, whether it's one or two hundred million Zenis. And you can say whatever you want about us."
With that, the axeman chuckled.
"W-why you?! What's so damn funny?!"
"The fact that you actually think you're going to survive until tomorrow is the real joke here."
With that, the three mercenaries turned and left the colosseum.
Jack the Ripper did not pursue them, only chuckled quietly under his mask.
"Kuh... What uncouth mercenaries."
A red-faced Count White muttered.
"How disappointing."
"We need to punish those mercenaries appropriately. Send pursuers after them."
"White Wolf" is finished if trash like that actually became their captains.
Is something the matter, Count Battler?"
Count Battler looked very pale.
"Is something wrong, Count Battler?"
"Maybe we should send out everyone to crush him."
"What are you saying, Count Battler?"
"...I had no idea what was going on with that battle just now."
"Well, they were simply walking circles around him. We didn't learn anything either."
"However, the strength of the "White Wolves" captains is a known quantity. There's no doubt that they're the pinnacle of this continent's mercenaries."
"Then it seems the pinnacle of this continent's mercenaries is nothing much."
The Night Swords laughed in mockery.
"But they ran off without even fighting. They were willing to flee battle even if it meant discarding the reputation of the "White Wolves". There's got to be a reason for it."
"What reason?"
"Could it be that to them, Jack the Ripper was some unimaginable monster?"
"...Utter nonsense. Count Battler, you seem to like scaring us."
"Well, I think we should heed the Count's advice and pick a proper opponent for his next fight. How about the Vegaltan blade master?"
"Yeah, that'll do. Hey, change up the opponent for the next fight."
The butler's face looked like he'd eaten something bitter after receiving the request to change the line-up.
"About that... The Vegaltan blademaster's gone back."
"What? Did you say he went back?!"
"Yes. She said "I have a bad feeling about this" and left."
"So she went back just like that?!"
"Y-yes. She paid back the full fee and, ah, vanished like the wind.
Nobody could catch up with her..."
"What on earth... They're making fools of us! I've had it! Send in the demon from the city-states and the legend of the Lawless City!"
Count White was trembling with rage as he said this.
"A-alright. I'll go right now!"
The butler quickly made his exit.
"Honestly, it makes me so mad."
"There, there, calm down. Count. That beast-woman probably wasn't strong to begin with."

"Well, she was kind of a rarity, a rabbit beast-woman fighter who was easy on the eyes. Her reputation was probably exaggerated. You can find people whose skills don't match up to their fame everywhere."
"We'll only embarrass ourselves if we send out trash. All we need is the demon from the city-states and the legend of the Lawless City."
"I can't believe we've got to play our strongest cards right away when we've got so many fighters. And it's even two on one."
"Meh, that's good, right? The longer it drags on, the more fun it is. Do you think it's workable, Count Battler?"
The Count looked very pale as he nodded.
And so, the demon from the city-states and the legend of the Lawless City showed up.
Faced with the two fighters from the city-states and the Lawless City, Jack the Ripper dispatched them without so much as breaking a sweat.
"So that's Jack the Ripper..."
As Alexia watched the blood-soaked clown fight, she sucked in a breath of cool air.
It was a one-sided slaughter.
Jack the Ripper was completely toying with the two experts.
Once the demon from the city-states and the legend of the Lawless City turned to flee, they were ripped to pieces, leaving nothing but bloodstains in the colosseum.
"It's as though he's not even taking them seriously..."
That was what shocked Alexia most.
Both fighters from the city-states and the Lawless City were quite strong by Alexia's estimation. Their skills were legit and their legend was by no means exaggerated.
Therefore, the skills of anyone who could essentially torment them to death could not be ordinary. Within the scope of Alexia's knowledge, there was only one person who could do this.
"Shadow..."
Perhaps Jack the Ripper's strength could rival Shadow's.
It was hard to swallow, but she had no choice but to believe it.
What really bothered Alexia was the fact that Jack the Ripper had a mood around him that made her think of Shadow.
"Those movements... No, it can't be."
Both his fighting style and mana quality were different from Shadow.
Alexia recalled what the war goddess had said about how strong fighters fundamentally moved the same way.
"What should we do, Alexia-hime?"
Christina asked quietly.
"...Let's wait a little longer."
"Still, now that everyone's attention is on Jack the Ripper, isn't this the best opportunity for us?
"No, it'll be easier for us afterwards."
"Afterwards?"
"That's right, once everything is over."
As she said this, Alexia looked at Jack the Ripper, standing in the middle of the colosseum. She wasn't even blinking in order to avoid missing a single detail.
The next set of opponents had already entered the colosseum.
There were over a hundred of them.
"What a joke. They sent out their fighters piecemeal and they were destroyed over and over again... Reminds me of a country on the verge of destruction."
"But can Jack the Ripper really beat all these magic swordsmen?"
The people surrounding Jack the Ripper were all first-rate magic swordsmen.
The Night Swords had spared no expense in hiring them, and in Alexia's estimation, they were probably on par or perhaps even better than the capital's knights.
"Recently, I've started to realize what strength really is, and how much difference there is between my own strength and that of the powerful."
"So what does Jack the Ripper look like in your eyes, Alexia-hime?"
Alexia fell silent to organize her reply.
"...He's on a completely different level from me."
She muttered.
"He's on a different level, huh... I can't believe he's that strong."
"Gulp..."
Kanade held her breath as she heard them speak, and then...
"O my vassal Jack the Ripper... Slaughter them, butcher all these foolish Night Swords."
She quietly murmured.
In the next moment, over a hundred magic swordsmen attacked Jack the Ripper.
"How could this..."
Count White muttered, stunned.
The audience box fell silent, as though the Night Swords had lost the power of speech.
The mood around them had started to change ever since the demon from the city-states and the legend of the Lawless City had been defeated.
The demon from the city-states left a mark on Jack's mask.
The legend of the Lawless City had slashed up Jack the Ripper's outfit.
But that had been all they could do.
Their movements were swiftly seen through and they were tormented to death.
And then, someone spoke up.
"Is there anyone here stronger than them?"
Nobody answered. Both the fighters from the city-states and the Lawless City were the best fighters they could get.
A sense of dread instantly spread through the air.
The Night Sword's composure was gone.
After that, they sent in all the remaining magic swordsmen, regardless of who they were.
The fighting continued, but the outcome was plain to see.
All the magic swordsmen were dead.
From where he stood in the blood-soaked colosseum, Jack the Ripper looked up at the audience seats.
"Sorry, I need to go! I'll leave the rest to you, Count White!"
After the first Night Sword stood up, the others all began to rise, as though in agreement.
"Wait, wait a minute! I haven't...!"
Count White held on to the Night Swords as they tried to leave.
Just then, a low and majestic voice filled the air.
"Gentlemen, where do you think you are going in such a hurry?"
A dignified man in the prime of his life appeared in the audience seats.
"M-Marquis Darkaigan! You're here!"
"I had no choice but to come here because were all useless."
After hearing Darkaigans scathing criticism, several Night Swords frowned but they ultimately remained silent.
"But what can we do at this point..."
"Humph. I obtained a special helper from the Cult for your sake."
Saying so, Darkaigan pointed to the colosseum.
There was a robed man standing there. No, could you even call it a man?"
"A helper from the Cult, you say... But what IS that?"
Said helper's form was twisted and distorted under its robe. It didn't look human at all.
"Kukuku, this is the humanoid weapon the Cult developed after much experimentation. Alright, now show everyone your true form!"
With a command from Darkaigan, the humanoid weapon shed its robe.
Its alien form was completely revealed.
"What, what IS that!?"
It was a patchwork hunk of meat.
Even telling its gender was difficult. It was probably male... No, it ought to be female.
While there was a leftover sense of femininity about it, what use was gender to a lump of meat like this?
It was nothing more than a barely-humanoid piece of meat.
"This is Subject 227, Millia. That is her name."
"Is... Is she a woman?"
"She's an experimental subject from the Fenrir Faction, although she was discarded because she was defeated by Shadow Garden. However, the Loki Faction recovered her and regenerated her."
"So she was defeated by Shadow Garden..."
There were disappointed sighs from the Night Swords.

"There's no need to worry. This is a Fenrir Faction test subject that has been further improved by the Loki Faction. This almighty humanoid weapon was created from the fusion of two different branches of technology that should never have intersected. She is ten times stronger than before... supposedly."
Darkaigan walked to the front of the group, and then raised his voice, as though to encourage the group.
"Subject 227, Millia! Obey my command and slay Jack the Ripper!!"
And so, the battle began.
The deformed test subject Millia charged like a beast.
She circled around behind Jack the Ripper, so fast that she was a blur.
And then, she suddenly raised her mighty right hand.
"Ohhhhh?!"
A terrifying surge of mana dominated the entire colosseum.
Even the force-field which ought to have been unbreakable began to crackle.
"W-What kind of mana IS this...!?"
The mana aftershocks gouged deep marks into the colosseum and even warped the terrain.
"Where... Where did he go?!"
The only person left in the colosseum was Millia, still swinging her arm.
Upon seeing Jack the Ripper had vanished, everyone assumed he had been blasted to smithereens.
"Well, I'm at a loss for words upon seeing this..."
Count White muttered from the silent audience box.
A look of relief appeared on the faces of the other Night Swords.
"As expected of the Cult's most powerful humanoid weapon. I almost thought the force-field was about to break."
"Hahaha, this force-field is unbreakable. I had my doubts for a moment, though. That's the Cult's power for you."
"It looks like we should strengthen our bonds with the Cult."
The Night Swords let their tongues wag.
"Indeed. Although the Night Swords lost a lot of members, the fact that we could establish a link with the Loki Faction is an accomplishment on our part."
After Darkaigan spoke, someone began to applaud.
"Mhm. Everything is for the sake of the Night Swords."
Darkaigan looked around.
However, he did not see anyone.
The group looked at each other, but only the sound of a single person clapping echoed through the audience box.
Among them, a single man turned pale and trembled.
This man was Count Battler.
He pointed to an empty seat with a trembling finger.
"What's wrong, Count Battler?"
Darkaigan asked in curiosity.
"That, that's..."
He pointed to an empty seat.
—Or rather, a seat which ought to have been empty.
However, a blood-soaked clown had been sitting there for some time now.
"Jack the Ripper?! W-What are you doing here?!"
The Night Swords immediately recoiled from Jack the Ripper's presence.
"W-What about the force-field?! What happened to the force-field?!"
Jack the Ripper should not have been able to appear in the audience box as long as the force-field was active.
"But how, how did he..."
Jack the Ripper stopped applauding and slowly stood up.
He held a 7 of Spades in his hand.
And then, he slowly threw it.
The world seemed to come to a halt as he did this. Only Jack the Ripper was able to move; everyone else was unable to stop his slowed movements.
Thunk.
And with that quiet sound, the poker card embedded itself deeply into a Night Sword's head.
"Ah, ah..."
He fell forward and twitched on the ground a few times.
Nobody could move.
All they could do was watch in silence as the blood slowly pooled on the ground.
Everyone had the same feeling; "Our lives are in his hands."
If they moved, they would die. If they screamed, they would die. Even if they did nothing, they would die anyway.
And it was during this tense moment that Jack the Ripper began to move, slowly taking out card after card.
The 8 of Spades.
The 9 of Spades.
The 10 of Spades.
The Jack of Spades.
The Queen of Spades.
The King of Spades.
Precisely six cards.
After spreading the same number of cards in his hands as there were surviving Night Swords, he withdrew the 8 of Spades.
And then, he slowly took a stance.
The Night Sword he was eying vigorously shook his head.
"Aiieee, aiiiiiyeagh... save me..."
As if in response, the mana in the colosseum swelled.
It was Subject 227, Millia.
She had instantly closed the distance to them and swung that fat, meaty right arm of hers down on Jack the Ripper.
There was a tremendous impact.
Bam, bam, bam. The sound echoed continuously.
However, Jack the Ripper was unmoved.
Subject 227 continued banging on the wall of light which kept her from Jack the Ripper.
"It, it's the force-field..."
Someone said, their voice trembling.
The force-field was still intact.
It kept Subject 227 inside.
But if that were the case, why was Jack the Ripper here?
Nobody could understand this.
Bam, bam, bam. As the very air trembled from the impacts, Jack the Ripper threw the 8 of Spades.
Following which, a person died.
He threw the 9 of Spades.
Another person died.
He threw the 10 of Spades.
Another person died.
Yet another person died.
Bam, bam, bam. Subject 227 continued pounding on the force-field.
"That, that's why I said we should have thrown everything at him...
After saying that, a Jack of Spades sank deep into his heart.
Count Battler clutched his chest, a despairing look on his face as he fell.
"Right, right, the force-field... as long as the force-field is gone...
Someone, someone bring it down!"
Count White raised his voice.
However, nobody heeded him.
"Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?!
Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?!"
Count White seemed to have gone mad as he screamed.
No, all sanity had long since left his eyes.
"Is anyone there?! Is anyone there?! Is anyone..."
A Queen of Spades pierced his throat.
And so, Count White died while going coughyu, coughyu, as though he was still trying to shout something.
And then, only Darkaigan was left.
His legs went limp and he fell down on his butt.
Jack the Ripper held up the King of Spades, spinning it around in his fingers.
He was practically toying with the other man's life.
"Who, who the hell are you... Why is a monster like you here..."
It was a weak voice that did not fit the leader of the Thirteen Night Swords in the least.
"Let me go, I'll do anything you want, I'll pay you."
Jack the Ripper fooled around with the King of Spades card in increasingly intricate ways.
"I can bow my head and give you as much money as you want, so please, spare me..."
As he said this, Darkaigan began kowtowing before Jack the Ripper.
"Please spare me, please spare me..."
And then, the King of Spades sunk into the back of Darkaigan's head mid-genuflection.
In that moment, the Thirteen Night Swords had been wiped out.
The way Darkaigan died was as though he was apologizing to the entire world.
Bam, bam, bam. The hollow echoes of Millia's banging on the force-field was the only sound left in this place.
Jack the Ripper looked around at the corpses in the audience box, and then turned to Millia.
She kept pounding on the force-field.
Jack the Ripper slowly walked forward.
Up to the force-field—
And then, Jack the Ripper's arm touched the force-field.
Bluish-purple mana spread and his body entered the force-field.
Millia immediately attacked him.
"Guoooohhhhhhh!"
With a joyous roar, she swung her right arm at him, sending the defenseless Jack the Ripper flying.
He crashed into a wall with shocking force.
However, he stood back up again, as though nothing had happened, and continued looking at Millia.
"Guaaahhhhhhhh!"
Millia lunged at him like a beast.
Her massive body, her physical attributes and mana were a perfect match for each other. One could call it the Cult's finest work.
In this form, she wrecked the entire colosseum with overwhelming force and even the sturdy force-field trembled.
Jack the Ripper bounced around like a pinball.
He rolled around the colosseum again and again.
But he was not defeated.
Although he was hit, he skillfully diverted the incoming force from his vitals  and avoided taking fatal injuries.
His eyes were glued to Millia.
"Graaaahhhhh!!"
Millia roared.
Reddish-black liquid splattered from her body and her flesh began to warp.
There were countless fine tentacles on her back, chest and even her face.
These ominously-colored and shaped tentacles spread out to cover the entire colosseum.
There were over a thousand of them and they surrounded Jack the Ripper.
And then, they all stabbed at him.
The tentacles pierced his body and covered him up.
After that, the only thing visible was those tentacles.
They're just like earthworms, Christina thought.
Jack the Ripper was no longer visible post-impalement. However, the spine-chilling sight of the long tentacular chunks of flesh made her think of earthworms.
"Is he dead...?"
Alexia murmured from the side. She looked like she couldn't believe her eyes.
