"Who knows? I have no idea why he stood still and let the enemy defeat him."
"He didn't even strike back."
"Yeah..."
Jack the Ripper showed no intention of retaliating.
The Thirteen Night Swords had died, as he willed it.
The end of these people who had ruled the shadows of the Midgar Kingdom had come just like that.
And they wielded so much power in the past. What a joke.
Christina could not help smiling, and she hurried to cover her face up.
In any case, the Thirteen Night Swords had been wiped out, and Jack the Ripper's aim had been met.
To him, fighting Millia was not part of his objective.
"Maybe he was satisfied with achieving his aim and wanted to end it all..."
That said, something felt off about the whole thing.
"It would be hard to survive among all those tentacles."
Alexia said with a grave expression on her face.
Each tentacle was strong and tough, containing potent mana, and their number was constantly increasing.
It was only natural that she would think that.
—And then.
Bluish-purple light leaked through the gaps between the tentacles.
The light was faint at first, but soon it streamed out from everywhere, dying the entire colosseum a violet color.
"What, what is this mana—?!"
It was unimaginably potent.
And then, this surge of mana blew all the tentacles away.
"Gwaaaaaaaaargh!!"
Millia howled in pain.
She ripped off the disintegrated tentacle bits and roared.
The bluish-purple light faded.
In its place was a man dressed in a black coat.
"But how... don't tell me..."
The man began to walk and his boots clicked crisply against the ground.
"I am Shadow... He who lurks in the shadows and hunts the shadows..."
His voice echoed, like it came from the blackest depths of the abyss.
"Shadow... What is he..."
Alexia was struck dumb.
Christina was also confused. However, she felt that there was a reason he had appeared before them.
There had to be some reason for doing this.
He had once said that there was something he had to do, even if it meant taking all the world's sins onto his shoulders.
Christina wanted to witness his blood-soaked path with her own eyes.
'Gyaaaahhhhh!!"
Christina and the others were not the only ones who had been thrown into confusion.
Millia had also stopped moving upon seeing Shadow appear all of a sudden.
"Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa."
And then her confusion turned to hatred.
"Shaaaaaaaaaaaaadooooooooooowww!"
This was the first human-like utterance she had made.
She seemed to be calling Shadow's name.
"Shaaaaaaaaaaaaadooooooooooooooooowww!"
There was a wet squelching sound as new tentacles grew through her skin.
Millia used her tentacles and her powerful right arm to attack Shadow.
A storm of blows rained down on him.
Countless tentacles lanced out, and that arm swept across with incredible force.
Amidst that endless stream of attacks, Shadow began to dance.
He sliced the tentacles off and evaded the arm by a hair's breadth, like a flower petal borne by a hurricane's winds.
There was the occasional thrust amidst this beautiful dance.
Purplish trails were carved into Millia's body.
Blood from Millia splattered everywhere, but it seemed as though that purplish mana was sticking to her wounds.
As time passed, more and more violet marks were etched into Millia's body.
"Why... Why doesn't he defeat her?"
Alexia asked.
"That monster is very strong, but Shadow is clearly taking it easy. He looks like he's torturing her."
Christina felt the same way too.
Why did he not kill her? Shadow had the power to do it. She knew that very well.
"There must be some reason he's doing this."
"A reason?"
"He has a mission. In that case, I will bear witness to his blood-soaked path..."
"Hah?"
Alexia tilted her head in bafflement. Just then—
"Shadoooooow!"
Millia's voice filled the air.
Her voice was clear now, and there was no mistake that she was yelling Shadow's name.
"She's gotten her voice back?"
Millia's voice was slowly reverting to that of a human girl.
But she continued her endless combination attack.
Meanwhile, the purple trails continued gleaming between the gaps in the offensive.
The purple mana clung to Millia's body, and soon it covered her completely.
"W-What IS this...!"
Millia's body shrank.
The big flabby lumps of monstrous flesh were sliced off, revealing the pale skin of a girl.
She had reverted to the form of a human.
"That purple mana was curing her..."
Christina noticed that the parts where the purple mana was denser had already recovered.
The soft, white skin, the frightening monstrous meat-lump and the thread-like tentacles...
All these combined together in a single pained cry.
"Shadoooooow...!!"
Several people realized that she was crying.
Half her face had returned to that of a girl, and she was shedding tears of blood.
"Shadooooooooooooooow...!
The girl sobbed.
As she wept, she kept flailing her right arm and tentacles with her body that was a mix of human and monster.
Her movements slowly changed from a monster's wild abandon to a human's nimble twisting.
And then, the girl's skin produced a massive amount of tentacles that looked like they would flood the colosseum.
"Sha...doooow...!!"
She moaned in pain.
The places where she sprouted tentacles bled and looked very painful.
With her countless tentacles, she managed to bind Shadow's limbs.
And then, she swung her right arm down.
However, Shadow sliced all the  tentacles to bits before hacking off Millia's right arm.
The severed monstrous right arm flew into the air.
It had not returned to its human form in the end.
But she still had a human left arm.
That arm held a dagger.
Where on earth had she put it before?
She had been swinging her right arm all this time, while her left arm had been cradling something.
She seemed to treasure the dagger very much.
"Shadooooooooooooooooooooow!!"
She thrust it, as though to pierce Shadow's heart.
"...Well done."
Shadow said.
At the same time, purplish mana enveloped Millia.
Her dagger stopped just short of Shadow's heart.
The light of reason returned to Millia's eyes.
The tentacles were gone.
There was a clattering noise as the dagger fell to the ground.
It was socketed with a red gem.
On its hilt was carved, "To my beloved daughter Millia."
"Pa... Papa..."
She collapsed while muttering those words.
Was it Shadow who stopped the dagger, or her?
Shadow scooped up the unconscious Millia and then waved.
Immediately afterwards, women in tight black clothing appeared around Shadow.
Where had they come from? She hadn't noticed them at all before.
They all fell to one knee, awaiting their master's orders.
"...Take care of the rest."
Saying so, Shadow handed Millia to what looked like the leader of the band, and then he vanished.
After confirming Shadow's departure, they spread out to begin their work.
Their leader recovered Millia, the right arm and the dagger, then glanced toward Christina and the other's hiding place.
Then she indicated the exit with a turn of her head.
Her expression seemed to be saying "I'll let you off for now, so hurry up and go."
"I, I think they found us..."
Alexia broke out in a cold sweat as she said this.
"Hawawawa..."
Kanade was scared out of her wits.
"What should we do?"
Christina asked.
"Let's pretend to leave for now. It'll be fine; they'll be gone soon."
Alexia sighed and snuck back into the hidden tunnel.
Kanade frantically followed behind her. Meanwhile, Kanade Christina looked back one last time.
"Is this your choice, then..."
He said he would walk a bloody path, yet he had chosen to save that monster.
It was just like how he had once saved Christina from danger. In all likelihood, he had rescued countless others during the course of his mission.
His bloody road shone in Christina's eyes.
Jack the Ripper, who had killed the Thirteen Night Swords and shocked the capital, vanished into anonymity.

There were countless guesses about his real identity. Some said he was a Vegaltan assassin. Others speculated that he was a legendary magic swordsman resurrected as a vengeful spirit. All sorts of baseless rumors spread.
Of course, there were those who said Jack the Ripper was actually Shadow, but the knights immediately denied that.
In the end, Jack the Ripper's identity remained a mystery.

The night when he had slaughtered seven of the Thirteen Night Swords who were under heavy guard from the knights and magic swordsmen had become a legend. His incredible strength meant most people wondered if he really was a ghost, a demon or something similar.
In a hundred years, it would probably become a movie, playing in theaters worldwide with a title like "The Shocking True Identity of Jack The Ripper?!" or something.
In any case, everything had gone perfectly.
I had achieved my objective.
The legend of Jack the Ripper would be carved into history.
"What's so funny?"
The man sitting opposite me said. I think his name was Chief Gray of the knight orders' investigative department or something.
As a witness, I was being questioned about the incident as part of their investigations.
"Oh, I was just thinking that the knights would be able to catch Jack the Ripper with capable people like you around."
I thoughtlessly said.
"But of course. You're pretty keen despite being so young."
Gray nodded in satisfaction.
"So, let me confirm with you one last time. You didn't go into the White House, did you?"
"Yup. Of course. Illegal entry and whatnot was too scary so I didn't go along..."
"Honestly, Alexia-hime is really frustrating. I can't believe she actually entered the White House on her own. People are going to doubt her testimony now."
"Then, er, what about that rumor going around that Jack the Ripper is actually Shadow?

"It's just a rumor, of course. After all, Shadow has also been causing all kinds of trouble in the capital. My guess is these people are trying to use the fact that the knights are having trouble to smear our reputation."
"But, but I heard Alexia-hime saw him..."
"She must have gotten it wrong because it was so dark in there. Plus, there were no other witnesses besides them and she's at the age where she wants to get attention."
"I see..."
"Just so. Now then, we're almost out of time. Sorry to keep asking you to help us with your investigations. I believe this should be the last interview I'll be conducting with you."
"Ah, thank you very much."
"That's it, then. Please take care."
After bowing to Gray, I left the windowless interrogation room.
While his detective skills were rubbish, he was pretty good as a magic swordsman. I was thinking if he'd be better off fighting rather than doing investigative work.
Now then, Kanade ought to be the next one to be questioned. She'd been called up with me.
I walked down the corridor heading to the room where she was being questioned.
Along the way, I rubbed shoulders with a slightly interesting man.
"Hm?"
I stopped and looked at the man who had passed me.
"Is something the matter?"
The man stopped too, and looked at me.
He was a tall man with narrow eyes. He seemed very kind and he had a smile on his face.
"No, it's nothing."
"Is that so? Are you... No, never mind."
He looked like he was about to say something, but then he gave up on it halfway.
After that, he left with a smile on his face.
I began walking too. At the same time, I sensed his presence from behind me.
Right after that, he walked into Gray's interrogation room.
"He seems pretty strong."
I quietly muttered.
After entering the room, he promptly sat down in front of Gray.
"W-Welcome, sir!"
Gray hurriedly bowed.
"You took too long."
He sighed.
"What do you mean, sir?"
"You took too long to notice me."
"I, I'm sorry, sir. There's no way I could notice you if you were hiding your presence."
"That boy just now did, though."
"That boy... Do you mean Cid Kagenou?"
"I don't know his name. I'm talking about the boy who walked past me just now."
"But he's just a below-average magic swordsman... Perhaps it was a coincidence?"
"Perhaps. Coincidences can happen anytime and anywhere."
With that, he smiled.
This was nothing more than idle conversation to him. He would probably have forgotten that boy by tomorrow, that was all.
"The loss of the Thirteen Night Swords is most regrettable."
"Yes, I'm terribly sorry, sir. We've been working on our end, but we can't move freely enough in the Kingdom of Midgar."
"Well, it can't be helped. That idiot Fenrir caused us to lose influence in Midgar. Shadow Garden did not fail to take advantage of that opening."
"...Will it affect the plan?"
"It'll be fine. "Shadow hunting Fang" will succeed."
"Shadow's strength was greater than expected. According to the reports.
Subject 227 Millia was completely overwhelmed."
"That's still within the realm of our expectations. Everything is."
He snorted in derision.
"As for the loss of the Thirteen Night Swords, it means we have that many less pieces that we can use in the Kingdom of Midgar. The time might come when you will need to act too, so be prepared."
"Understood, Loki-sama."
"...I'll leave the rest to you, then."
And with that, he vanished.
The only person left in this windowless interrogation room was Gray

c6.text: For Eliza, it had been a week of nightmares.

The Thirteen Night Swords had been murdered one after another, and in the end even her own father had not come home. The Darkaigan family assets had been seized "for investigation" by one person after another, and in the end she had even been ejected from her family home.
As time went by, all of Eliza Darkaigan's friends and money left her.
That much was painfully obvious to her.
"What is this bullshit!!"
Eliza yelled in the temporary home she was currently occupying.
She threw the glass which held the drink she had just finished into a wall and glared at it.
"And they were all sucking up to us right until recently...!"
Why did she have to go through this? At this rate, the courts would probably rule against her too. Many nobles had already abandoned the Darkaigan family.
"I'm not done yet, this isn't over yet..."
However, not all the nobles had chosen to leave her.
The families which made up the Night Swords were all in the same boat.
The bonds between them could never be broken.
Their families had all lost their masters and were under investigation.
They were all having difficulties. But that was what would unit them.
"I'll unite the next generation of Night Swords... I won't let things end like this, I swear!"
Everything would be fine. She had dirt on the knights and the judges.
If the next generation of Night Swords could join up to exert pressure on them, the situation would be easily reversed, Eliza believed.
"Gather the Thirteen Night Swords for a meeting! Go and find them!!"
Eliza yelled her orders to the subordinates waiting next door to carry out her will.
However, nobody came no matter how long she waited.
"Hello! Is anyone there?"
She opened the door to the adjoining room ,a look of shock on her face.
There was nobody there.
The window was wide open, letting the cold night air in.
"Did they go to the bathroom... I'll have to punish them properly later on."
There was a cruel smile on her face as she said this.
Just then, she heard a strange sound from behind her. It sounded like footsteps which went picha.
"So you were still around. Where did you..."
As Eliza turned around, her words died in her throat.
A blood-soaked clown stood there.
"Ah, ahhhh... Jack... Jack the Ripper..."
Eliza's face was frozen in shock as she stumbled back reflexively.
Picha. The blood-soaked clown drew closer.
"Aiiieee... Stay, stay back!"
She threw everything within arm's reach at him.
However, the blood-soaked clown did not stop because of them, and Eliza was pressed up against the wall.
"I, I'm very sorry... I'll apologize to you, is there anything you want me to do?"
Eliza put on the most ingratiating smile she could manage, which twitched a little.
"Say, what is it that you want, I'll obey you no matter what it is..."
She raised her chin, trying to sound as pleasant as possible.
She lifted her thin negligee, exposing her pale skin.
But Jack the Ripper continued staring right at her.
In response, Eliza further exposed herself by pulling aside her nightgown.
"Ufufu..."
His gaze fell on her pale chest.
And then, he drove a knife into it.
Fresh blood dripped onto her bare flesh.
"AAAAAAAAAAHHHHHH!!! HOW DARE YOU!!"
Eliza used all her strength to swat Jack the Ripper away, but then she fell to the ground, clutching her wound.
"How, how dare you ahhhhh..."
She coughed up mouthfuls of bright red blood as she glared hatefully at Jack the Ripper.
And then, Eliza held her breath.
"You, you... Why is it..."
His mask was on the ground. It had probably been knocked off when Eliza tried to fight her off.
"Why, how could it be...!"
Jack the Ripper's face belonged to a student that Eliza knew.
"Why is it you, Christina!!"
Standing there was Christina Hope.
She was looking down coldly on Eliza.
"Koff... I, I didn't think you were actually Jack the Ripper..."
Eliza squeezed those words out in a shocked tone.
The blood from her chest spread across the ground, soon touching the mask.
"No."
She picked up the mask as she replied.
"What do you mean, no?"
"I am simply his successor."
"Succ- successor?"
"Indeed. He showed himself before me, and I finally realized why."
"He showed me his mission, the bloody road upon which he walked."
"What, what are you saying..."
"This country is rotten to the core. The sword of justice is useless against it. To fight evil, one must become more evil than the evildoers. He was asking me if I was prepared to do so."
And then, Christina put on the clown mask, a twisted smile on her face."
"That is precisely what I was hoping for."
Saying so, she grabbed the dagger that was lodged in Eliza's chest.
"No, stop..."
Those were Eliza's final words.
Christina twisted the knife, then wrenched it free.
Frothy blood spewed forth.
"Cough... gurgle..."
As she looked down on Eliza's cooling body, Christina took out a poker card.
She inserted it into the wound on Eliza's chest
"My name is Jack the Ripper... who slays the sinful with a blade of sin..."
The card was a joker.

c7.text: Delta was very happy.
That was because she had hunted lots of bandits with Shadow.
Power was authority.
Strength was justice.
Hunting provided you with the food you needed to survive and let you show your strength.
"Boss! How was Delta's haul today?!"
"Ah, um, it was pretty good."
Dressed in a black longcoat, Shadow relieved the bandits' corpses of their wallets as he replied.
"Woohoo! Boss approved of Delta!"
For Delta, the best time to hunt was with Shadow.
Gaining the approval of superior entities was glorious to beast-people. It was essential to strengthening their position in the tribe.
Those were the beast-people's values.
"Ah, what should we do with this body?"
Shadow was pointing at a beast-man's corpse.
"Who's this?"
"He's your big brother, Delta. Did you forget?"
Delta tilted her head and tried to remember.
Come to think of it, there had been an annoying small fry who had said something which pissed her off.
"Anyway, want to bury him first? I don't know how beast-folk do things, though."
"No need for that!"
"Really? Okay then."
And with that, Shadow continued grabbing wallets.
"Muuu~"
For some reason seeing the corpse reminded Delta of something annoying.
It was from a long time ago, when she had still been called Sara.
"What's wrong?"
"Nothing!"
It wasn't often that she felt so good.
Delta jumped onto Shadow's back and began marking him.
"Hey! Let go!"
"Don't wanna!"
"Wait, I'll get doggy stink all over me!"
"I don't stink!"
Being surrounded by Shadow's scent makes the memories of the past fade away, Delta thought.
Inside a dark, cramped little hut.
"Sara... Are you up?"
Upon hearing her mom calling her, Sara immediately sprang up.
"Sara's here!"
In the depths of the hut, her mom lay sick in bed.
"Koff... Help me get some water, please."
Her mother coughed painfully as she spoke.
"Got it! The water's on its way!"
After leaving the little hut, Delta hurried over to the watering hole.
The morning sun was bright and the plains stretched all the way to the horizon. Delta's feet were drenched by the time she reached the watering hole.
The clear water there gleamed brilliantly.
She was just about to bend down and get some when she suddenly realized something.
"Crap! I forgot my bucket!"
She began running again to get it.
Just then, someone tripped her up.
"Kyan!?"
Sara fell down.
"Oi, stupid Sara, fell down again?!"
"Hahaha, you forgot your bucket again, huh?"
There were two boys who were slightly older than Sara standing there.
"It's Ral-nii and Ren-nii..."
Sara's ears drooped.
"Damn, you're useless. Do you even know how to do the chores?"
"You can't even hunt. Why the hell are you even alive?"
"W-Well, someone's got to take care of Mom... That's why Sara doesn't hunt!"
"Don't you dare talk back!"
Ral's fist hit Sara in the face.
He was young, but those were still a beast-man's fists. Sara rolled several times over the plains.
"Uuu... uuu..."
The taste of blood filled Sara's mouth.
After she got to her feet, her older brothers looked a little shocked.
"Huh? That was a serious punch."
"Did you hit her in a weird place?"
Saying so, the two of them walked up to Sara.
"Oi, Sara. Listen up. There's no point in you taking care of that woman.
She can't hunt and she only popped out three kids. You can't expect anything further of her."
"She's a burden of the pack, so Dad abandoned her."
"Why... why do you have to be so cruel? She's Ral-nii, Ren-nii and Sara's one and only mom!"
Sara forced those words out through clenched teeth as she trembled.
"...You really are an idiot, aren't you?"
The reply was utterly cold.
"The weak are worthless. Those are the rules of the pack, right?"
"Because she's weak...? The rules of the pack...?"
"I can't believe you even forgot that? How the hell did I end up with a sister like you?"
"But, she's our mom..."
"She's no longer our mom."
"Huh, didn't I tell you? We've been acknowledged for our strength. The No. 3 family in the pack has adopted us."
"Yup yup. We're now Ral Pit-sama and Ren Pit-sama."
"But why... Mama..."
"Who cares about that weak woman?"
"If you dare call me your brother again the next time we meet, I'll kill you. Remember that."
The two of them laughed and left.
Sara was dumbfounded for a moment.
"Oh right... the bucket..."
She wiped away her tears and ran back to the hut.
Sara smiled as she opened the door.
"I forgot my bucket, mom!"
"Oh, you..."
Her mother's gentle smile greeted her.
"Ehehe...!"
"Look, it's over there."
"Yup!"
Sara picked up the bucket that was deep inside the hut.
"Sara... What happened to your face?"
"Huh?"
Sara's face had swollen up after being punched.
"I... I fell! Ehehe!"
Her mother kept her eyes focused on Sara, who was trying to laugh it off.
"...Did Ral and Ren hit you?"
"Um... No!"
"I see. Honestly, those two..."
"No! It's not like that...!"
"You're such a kind girl. Come here, Sara."
Sara walked up to her mom's bed with her tail drooped. Meanwhile, her mother smiled and patted her head.
"Mmmh... Mom's so smart. You saw through Sara's lie."
"Your lies are easy to see through, Sara."
"Sara's dumb. People treat stupid Sara like a fool. How can I be like Mom?"
"Hm, that might be hard. You take more after your dad, Sara."
"Sara is just like Mom."
"You mustn't say that. Especially not outside. Never ever say that."
Her mom spoke in a stern tone.
"...Okie."
"You're such a good girl, Sara."
Her mother gently patted Sara's head again.
"Oh yes, it might help if you were more polite when you spoke."
"More polite?"
Yes. When you're polite, you sound more intelligent... I think."
"So Sara will become smarter?!"
"You'll appear smarter... I think."
"Got it! So how should I talk?!"
"Well, you need to be polite... Yes, perhaps by ending your sentences with "desu"  or something similar."
"Like this desu!"
"That, that doesn't seem quite right..."
"Then how about this nanodesu?!"
"Y-yes... That's good."
"So will I sound smarter when I talk like this nanodesu?!"
"Mm~ ...It's a little... How shall I put this."
"From now on Sara will talk politely like Mom nanodesu!"

(TL Note: Delta's verbal tic is ending her sentences in nanodesu so you know where it came from now. I'll be omitting it but imagine a hyper sexual genki furball ending all her sentences in nanodesu.)
"Come here, Sara."
After saying that, her mother embraced Sara's face.
"You are a lovely girl. You are my cute and precious daughter."
"I never want you to suffer because of me."
"Sara's not suffering!"
Her mother shook her head and touched Sara's slightly swollen cheek.
Her fingers were very slim.
"Sara... Calm down and listen to me. Do you want to be adopted by another family?
"A-adoption?"
"I've already spoken to the people in the Dober family. You're a girl, so although you can't go into the Pit family like Ral and Ren, the Dobers are big enough to take you."
"Eh... So Ral-nii and Ren-nii...?"
"This is a secret, okay? If they found out they only made it because I talked to others, it would hurt their feelings."
"But why..."
"The Pits and the Dobers owe me. Your mom used to be really awesome in the past, you know."
As she said so, her mother smiled with some pride.
"That's not what I mean, why... Even though we're all one family! Even though we were all together!!"
"Sara..."
"Ral-nii and Ren-nii were so mean! They said all kinds of mean things about Mom! They knew Mom was sick and suffering but they didn't even come back."
Sara wailed and wept.
"Sara, listen to me. It can't be helped."
"What do you mean it can't be helped!!"
"These are the rules of the pack. I can't go out and hunt anymore, while you, Ral and Ren are still kids. Even if you went out to hunt, you'd only be a burden."
"Then how about Dad...?"

"He's the leader of the pack. He has other families to care for despite this one. If I had more kids, he'd be able to help me. But now, I can't give birth any more... So this home no longer has anyone to bring in food. Right now, we can still count on charity from other families, but that can't keep going on."
"Sara... Sara is Mom's daughter."
"You will always be my daughter, Sara. But... Please think about it."
"I don't wanna..."
"Sara..."
Sara hugged her mother tightly.
"Sara is Mom's daughter. Ral-nii and Ren-nii were too mean."
"Thank you Sara. But please, don't be so harsh on Ral and Ren."
"But why..."
"Because they are also my cute kids."
"Are they cuter than Sara?"
"Nope. Sara's the cutest."
Her mother smiled.
"Yay!"
"Ral and Ren are still young, so they don't have any standing in the pack.
Having someone weak like me as the head of the family is a form of disgrace for them."
"So that's why they said bad things about Mom...?"
"Those kids worked pretty hard too. Plus, they're stronger than me..."
"So all I need to do is become strong?"
"Those are the rules of the pack."
"I see..."
"So please, Sara. Don't speak ill of Ral and Ren. Everyone getting along would be the happiest thing for me."
"Everyone getting along... I see."
"You're such a good girl, Sara."
Saying so, her mother raised her frail hand to wipe Sara's tears away,
"Mom... what should I do?"
"What should you do...?"
"What should I do to get back to the life we used to have?"
"What should I do to not be a big dummy? What should I do so Mom doesn't suffer?"
"Oh Sara... I'm so sorry."
"Why are you sorry?"
"Well... Mom doesn't know either. But if Ral, Ren and Sara were older and could hunt with their own hands..."
"So it would be okay as long as we could hunt prey?"
"Yes. If you could become strong."
"So if I become strong, Ral-nii and Ren-nii would come back?"
"Well... It would be nice if they did..."
Her voice was very faint.
"Would your sickness be cured too?"
"Yeah... It might get better."
After saying that, her mother smiled sadly.
"Got it! Sara will become strong and learn how to catch prey!"
"Don't be too hasty, Sara. Once you grow up... Koff... koff..."
"Mom?!"
"I, I'm okay...!"
Sara frantically tried to pat her Mom's back as she coughed nonstop.
The fact that she could feel her ribs through her back made Sara worry even more.
"If I don't hurry..."
"...Sara?"
"It, it's nothing! Are you okay?"
"Yeah, I'm fine. Thank you."
"That's great! Now then, Sara's got to go."
Sra turned and began to run.
"Wait, Sara!"
Her mother called out to Sara before she could leave the hut.
"W-What's wrong?"
"...Where are you going?"
Sara's ears drooped again.
"...I, I'm going to get water."
"You forgot your bucket."
"Mm... I was careless again."
Sara frantically picked up the bucket."
"I, ah, I'll go get water now, then."
"Be safe, Sara."
Her mother watched Sara leave, a worried look on her face.
At night.
Sara snuck out of the hut after her mother fell asleep.
The plains which should have stretched out to the horizon looked like they had been painted black by ink.
Even so, Sara's eyes could still see into the distance.
"There's something, over there."
She sniffed the air.
"Over there too."
Her ears twitched.
"There as well. Lots of them.
Her eyes, her nose and her ears.
Sara's senses were keener than those of anyone in the family.
"All I need to do is catch prey."
However, Sara was too young and she could not be brought on the hunt.
Females, in particular, would always join the hunt later than males.
But by that time, it would be too late.
Sara began walking out into the darkened plains.
Her legs were trembling.
This was scarier than when her big brothers beat her up.
Her brothers had been trained to hunt, but Sara had not.
Right now, she knew nothing about hunting.
"I need to get stronger..."
Sara continued into the plains on her trembling feet.
She would walk a little, then stop, using her eyes, nose and ears to search her surroundings.
Then she would continue a little more, before scanning her surroundings again.
After several cycles of this, Sara had gone far beyond the bounds of her village's territory.
Even though large monster herds went past, Sara held her breath and hid, waiting for them to pass.
"I'm great at cat-and-mouse."
None of the kids in the pack could find Sara. Even the adults had a hard time finding Sara.
This technique also worked on monsters.
Her legs no longer shook.
Nothing on these grasslands could find her. This confidence allowed her to be composed.
"I need to catch lots of stuff."
She used her eyes, ears and nose to select her prey.
If she stared hard, she could see far into the darkness. With a sniff, the wind would carry scents to her. When she inclined her ears to listen, she could hear footsteps and breathing from afar.
She understood everything.
She didn't know why, but she did.
"That one."
"That one" was a huge leopard hiding in the grass.
It was a powerhouse of the plains, and hunting it was risky, so normally people would not target it.
But Sara understood.
That leopard was weak. It was a weakling.
She slowly approached it from downwind.
The closer she got, the heavier the scent of death became. It was just as she thought.
This one— It smelled the same as her mom.
And in that moment, Sara's concentration broke.
She realized what she had been thinking about just now. The thought shocked her.
"No... It's not like that!"
It was nothing alike.
She had compared the death of her moth to the death of the giant leopard, and sneered at them both as weaklings.
"IT'S NOT LIKE THAT!!"
She screamed out loud, like she had forgotten where she was.
"Grrrrrrr—"
By the time she came to her senses, the large leopard was in front of her.
Its sharp teeth and gaping maw approached Sara.
"Ahhh..."
Sara thought of something.
—So weak!
When she came to her senses, Sara was standing on the plains at dawn.
The morning sun had dyed the distant sky red.
At her feet lay the dead leopard.
Sara wept.
She was drenched in blood and cried softly.
She was not hurt in the least.
All that blood belonged to her prey
"Uwaaahhhhh..."
She understood.
She understood it all now.
She understood what a sin it was to be weak on these plains...
Sara secretly dragged the dead giant leopard home.
She left it in front of the hut before sneaking into her mother's bed.
Her mom was still sleeping.
Sara liked her mom's warmth best.
Sara decided to keep hunting the big leopard a secret.
After all, the rules of the pack stated that Sara was not old enough to hunt, and she didn't want to worry her mom. However, the true reason lay elsewhere.
Sara understood.
She understood the sin known as "weakness" on the plains.
The weak would be robbed, the weak would be oppressed, the weak would be killed...
"Mom's not weak..."
She was simply afraid of being stronger than her mom.
She felt that if she was weak, she could be surrounded by her mother's warmth forever.
Soon, she fell asleep.
Upon hearing her mother's panicked voice, Sara woke up.
"My, oh my... I can't handle such a big one by myself..."
"What happened, Mom?"
Sara rubbed her eyes and walked over to her mom.
"I found this huge leopard here after I woke up."
"That, that's awesome, it's so big~"
Sara did her best to look surprised and not make it look fake.
She was sure she had done her best.
"Did someone send this here? ...Do you know anything about this, Sara?"
"N-nope, I don't!"
"Really now. What am I going to do... Koff."
Her mother, who was leaning against a pillar, began coughing violently.
"Are you okay?!
"Mm, yes, I'm fine."
"Mom, you should go back to bed. It's okay, Sara will prepare the leopard! I'm sure you'll be better after eating lots of meat!!"
Sara helped her mom lie down in bed.
"Thank you, Sara... But can you really prepare it?"
"Um... Sara will do her best, so it's okay! Get some rest, Mom!"
And with that, Sara dragged the leopard and brought her knife to the watering hole.
That said, she had never prepared game before.
While she had seen her mother do it before, Sara's memory was unfortunately poor and she forgot all the basics she had seen.
"Erm... Hm—"
In any case, she would start by chilling the carcass in the water.
She should have drained it while removing the organs, but Sara stopped, knife in hand.
"Should I start from the top... or no, maybe from the bottom?"
She didn't know where to start cutting.
She didn't know how deep she should go to avoid nicking the organs. The meat would go bad if she damaged the intestines or the bladder.
Just then, she sensed someone approaching her.
Her senses had grown keener ever since she had killed that big leopard last night.
Sara threw herself to the side.
Immediately after that, a fist-sized rock whizzed past Sara, through the place she had just been.
"Tsk, she dodged it?"
"What the hell are you doing, Ral-nii!"
"Shut up, I just missed. Yo, Sara, what are you doing, standing around with that dorky look on your face?"
Two beast-men came over.
"Ral-nii, Ren-nii..."
Sara's ears drooped audibly.
"Huh? Oi oi, that's a great leopard, isn't it?"
"Awesome, I've never seen one before. Whose prey was it?"
The two of them started feeling up the great leopard without any reserve.
"Ah... That's... That's Mom's and Sara's prey nanodesu...!"
"Hah? You and that waste of space hunted this?"
"What nonsense is that? Even in the Pit family, only the head of the house could take out one of these!"
"Ah... uh, I guess someone dropped it off at Sara's home..."
"Hahh? Must have gotten the wrong address."
"Who the hell would send a great leopard to your place?"
"But, but it's true!"
"Huh. Well, whatever."
The two of them ignored Sara and picked up the great leopard.
"Trash like you two don't deserve this! We're going to confiscate it!"
"Rather than have it go to waste in a house full of trash, we'll portion it out among the Pit family! These are the rules of the pack!"
"How could you, that's too much...!"
"Did you say something, Sara? Got a problem with that? We're from the Pit family, you know."
"Want to find out what happens when you defy a powerful family, huh?"
Ral and Ren glared at Sara, who seemed intent on taking back the great leopard.
"Uuu... So you mean you can do anything you want as long as you're strong..."
Sara flattened her ears against her head, tucked her tail between her legs, and made way for the two brothers who were planning to take the great leopard away.
"Speaking of which, what the hell's with the way you're speaking?"
"Yeah, what's up with that nanodesu crap? Are you retarded or something?"
"This... Doing this is supposed to make you sound smarter. Mom said so nanodesu."
Sara clenched her fists.
"Ahahaha, you think you can sound smart just by saying nanodesu? As if there could be anything like that!"
"Sounds just like what that trash would say! Mom and daughter are both idiots!"
"Don't call Mom an idiot nanodesu..."
The words came from deep inside her throat, like a groan.
She was so quiet that they didn't hear it. But that was actually a good thing for the two brothers.
If they had heard it, she would not have been able to turn back.
"The fuck did you say, Sara?"
"Oi, what's with the way you're looking at us, you bitch?"
The two of them sent her flying as they spoke.
Sara rolled along the plains without putting any resistance.
"Tch, that little brat really pisses me off.
"We're part of the Pit family. I can't stand to be around that moron any longer."
The two of them left while complaining.
Sara looked up at the blue sky from the grass on the plains.
Being hit by those two hadn't hurt in the least. Sara felt like she could have taken a hundred punches from them with no problems.
However, her heart hurt.
"Mom said so... So Sara thought Sara would sound smarter..."
Her teeth creaked as she gritted them.
"Mom said that we're all from the same family... therefore we ought to get along."
She clenched her fists, like she was warning herself as she spoke.
The great leopard had been taken.
But that was fine. All she had to do was hunt another one.
"It'll be fine. After all, Sara is good at hunting."
She smiled her usual smile and returned home to where her mom was waiting.
From that day forth, Sara would sneak out onto the plains from time to time to hunt.
She took small game, both to avoid attention and so her mother could process the meat.
Although her big brothers stole her prey from time to time, that was alright. As for why, it was because Sara could take prey at any time.
Sara soon learned to clean carcasses under her mother's tuition.
She was clumsy, but she did her best to remember her lessons.
Soon, her mother didn't even have the strength to process small game.
And then, the smell of death surrounding her mother grew stronger. Sara could instinctively sense that her life was coming to an end.
Sara held her mother's stick-like hand as she lay on her bed.
"Sara... You're such a kind girl..."
Her mother spoke in a hoarse voice.
"Mom... Don't, Sara wants to be with Mom forever and ever, together for always."
"Sara... You are the kindest girl of all. I'm so proud that I was your mother..."
"Uuu.. uuu..."
Sara buried her tear-filled face in her mother's chest.
"Such a kind, loving girl."
"You ate so much meat but your sickness didn't get better at all.
"It's alright. This is the end of your mother's lifespan. Thank you so much for everything, Sara..."
After saying so, her mom ruffled Sara's hair.
Sara stayed still to feel her mother's warmth. The two of them stayed like this for a while.
Her mother's breathing grew weaker and weaker.
And then, before the final moment, she drew one last painful breath and said:
"Sara, your meat was delicious... Thank you."
And then she breathed no more.
Sara spent all night crying in her mother's arms, and then on the next day, she buried her on the plains.
She made a grave that only she and her mother knew about.
In order not to let anyone else know.
"Yo, Sara, why are you covered in mud?"
"Ahahaha, she's crying!"
Ral and Ren got in Sara's way after she finished burying her mom.
"...Mom died."
Sara said, her head lowered.
"...Really? At last!"
"Being weak means you die! That's the rule of the plains!"
The two of them laughed happily."
"Don't you dare look down on Mom."
And then, it happened in an instant.
Sara had stabbed her hand straight through Ren's chest.
"Guhoo... But how..."
Sara looked at Ren like a piece of walking garbage as the latter collapsed while vomiting up blood.
"Mom won't smile any more... and she won't be hurt any more... Which means, there's no need for me to hold back any more."
She stomped on Ren's body as she uttered those merciless words.
The sounds of bones crunching and organs bursting could be heard from inside his body.
"You, you, you bitch, what have you done! What did you do to Ren!!"
"...He was just too damn weak."
"What, what did you say...! D-Dad won't let you off for doing this!"
Ral backed away, his terrified face twitching as he did.
"The weak will be robbed, the weak will be oppressed, the weak will be killed... Those are the rules."
Having hunted many prey, Sara keenly understood the rules of the plains.
"But if you're strong, you're allowed to do anything you want. That's also part of the rules."
As she said so, Sara casually tore Ral's neck open.
"Ah, you... gohok..."
"Sara will become stronger than anyone on this plain. If I do that, I'm sure..."
As her brothers' blood sprayed her, she smiled.
A small black mole appeared on her neck.

c8.text: Akane regained consciousness in a white room, and she looked around.
"What IS this place..."
Fortunately, she was not bound.
She turned to get off the bed, and her feet made contact with the icy floor.
Akane changed into a thin, white outfit that resembled a hospital's nightgown.
"I feel like I've seen this place somewhere before, but also not..."
The floor felt like marble, but not quite.
The design of the hospital gown was also highly familiar, but the material seemed more like silk than synthetic fibers.
"Am I overseas... Still, I haven't seen words like these before either."
She studied the letters which covered the room, but they did not match up to any language Akane remembered.
In any case, she had to verify her current conditions ASAP.

"It's very likely that this is some kind of research installation. In that case, it probably follows that I've probably been kidnapped by an organization that wants to use me... But if that were the case, why didn't they tie me down?"
Anyone who understood Akane's powers would have tied her up.
More to the point, she had recovered her memories and her original strength as the First Knight.
If this was a kidnapping, it was a pretty crude one.
"...Looks like they're underestimating me."
Akane stood in front of the room's door.
She could sense two people outside. They seemed to be on watch.
That said, while Akane as she was now ought to be able to easily subdue them, she could not tell if they were good or bad people.
While the chances were very low, they might be an organization which helped her out of kindness.
"Hmm–"
After her brief period of contemplation, she sensed that the beings beyond the door had left.
"--This is my chance."
Akane swiftly reached a decision.
As though declaring she would think about the consequences after acting, she punched the door at full force.
There was an unexpected 'thunk'.
"Ow, that hurt!"
Akane rubbed her knuckles and crouched down.
The part of the door she had hit was completely unmarked.
"B-But why?! I seriously poured my mana into it!"
Anyone who looked closely would have found that part of her long black hair had turned gold.
"What the heck is this door made of...?"
After looking up, Akane realized something.
The letters which covered the door and walls were glowing faintly.
"Is this light... magic...?"
There was no doubt about it. She could feel mana flowing through them.
"Could it be that they managed to extract the mana from my body and make use of it? Big brother said that it wasn't impossible..."
Many researchers around the world had been studying the applications of magic,
Among them were naturally those who wanted to extract mana from human bodies for use as a brand new energy source, but all those attempts ought to have failed.
"But how, there's no way, right?"
If they had actually managed to put it into practice, then it made perfect sense why they hadn't bound Akane.
In other words, this organization possessed such technology.
"I, I don't think we can jump to conclusions just yet."
It might have been sheer coincidence that the door managed to take a punch from her.
This time, Akane used her full force, channeling her mana into her fist.
The very next moment, the door suddenly opened.
"Oh crap."
She had put too much force into her blow and could not pull it back in time.
Akane's fist flew right toward the face of the silver-haired girl.
There was a quiet smack and Akane's fist stopped in mid-air.
"Huh?"
Akane was briefly stunned.
The silver-haired girl had casually caught Akane's full-force blow with one hand.
She found it hard to believe what she was seeing.
"The door wasn't locked ~desu. All you had to do was say something and you could have come out at any time ~masu."
Akane had a vague memory of this silver-haired girl who spoke in not-very-proper Japanese.
"If, if I'm not wrong, you should be Natsume-san... Why are you here?"
She was Minoru's little sister and ought to have been in her big brother's lab.
"It okay ~desu."
That said, Akane had no idea what exactly was okay.
"Have seat ~desu."
At her insistence, Akane sat down on a chair inside the room.
Since there was someone she knew here, she might as well hear her out.
"Natsume-san, I didn't know you could speak. What kind of person are you? Where is this place?"
The silver-haired girl tilted her head after this intense questioning. She seemed to be thinking about something.
"That right ~desu. I not Natsume ~masu. Beta, I. Beta."
For some reason, she didn't seem to be getting through, Akane thought.
"Er, so you mean you're not Natsume-san, but your real name is Beta?"
"I will, care take of you ~desu. No need of worry ~desu."
"Hahhh..."
I can't help but worry, Akane thought.
"I, Shadow Garden of Beta. Brought you back."
"So Beta-san of the organization called Shadow Garden kidnapped me, is that it?"
"Yes ~desu!"
The offender proudly admitted to her sins with a smile on her face.
"So you're a spy who used the alias of Natsume to infiltrate Messiah, then?"
"Not spah. Investigation ~desu. Investigation of Isekai lifeform."
"Isekai lifeform?"
What on earth is she talking about? Akane couldn't help but tilt her head.
"Isekai lifeforms ~desu."
Saying so, Beta pointed to Akane.
"Er, are you saying that I'M an Isekai lifeform?"
"Yes ~desu."
She didn't quite understand what Beta was saying.
"Show you ~desu."
And then Akane was led out of the room by Beta.
"W-What's with this place..."
Akane could not help but stare as Beta led her through the base.
What shocked her was the magical technology here which far surpassed that of Japan, as well as the disparity between that and the science on display, which lagged far behind Japan.
All the women in the base were speaking in a language Akane had never heard before, and most of them had very distinctive ears.
Those did not seem to be awakening aftereffects, but more like racial characteristics, such as the kind elves and beast-kin might have.
But what shocked her most was how strong they were as fighters.
After Beta showed her around their training facility, Akane couldn't help but shudder at their strength.
"Want to try ~desu?"
Beta flexed like she was showing off.
Incredibly enough. Beta seemed to hold a very high rank in this facility.
Everyone addressed her as politely and responsibly as possible.
"By try, do you mean you want me to fight?"
Akane phrased those words as a question, but Beta seemed to have accepted them as an agreement.
There were communication difficulties after all.
"Weakest one here, come out now!"
Beta had a shit-eating grin on her face as she said that.
Apparently, this phrase was one she had mastered during her time in Japan.
However, it would seem nobody understood her. But that was only to be expected. It WAS Japanese, after all.

<<It would seem she's spoiling for a fight. I would like the weakest of you to be her opponent. Please take care not to harm her.>> Beta seemed embarrassed as she said this, but Akane had no idea what she was saying since it was in the other world's language.
After a while, a one-eyed dark elf brought a young girl out.
She seemed to be only around 13.
The girl had hair as white as snow. Her eyes were cute, but there was a sternness in them that made others want to smile.

<<711, you will be her opponent. If you end up disgracing Shadow Garden with your performance, you know what will happen, right? >> After the dark elf said something to her, the girl's already nervous face became even more tense and she glared at Akane.
"Er, pleased to meet you."
It would seem there was no way to avoid fighting. Akane decided to offer a handshake to ask that her opponent go lightly on her.
<<There's no way I will lose you. I will not stumble at a place like this.>>
She smacked Akane's hand away and glared even harder at her.
"Er, sorry about that."
Apparently, shaking hands wasn't a good idea in this world, Akane mused.
After that, Akane and 711 picked up training swords and headed to the center of the training yard.
Beta and Lambda watched the two of them square off against each other.
"Who do you think will win?"
The dark-skinned elf Lambda asked. She was in charge of training newcomers in Shadow Garden.
"Well, I don't know much about 711."
Beta narrowed her blue eyes and smiled vaguely.
"711's been here for half a month. She's still the weakest for now, but talent-wise she's top-notch."
"It isn't often that I hear you say that, Lambda."
"She has outstanding abilities. However, she's a little rebellious..."
"Well, she's just a kid. She'll be fine as long as you train her properly."
"Yes, of course."
"Lambda, who do you think will win?"
"I don't understand that black-haired girl... But there seems to be something strange about her mana. Is she that girl whom everyone said you brought back, Beta-sama?"
"Yes. Her name is Nishino Akane... Although Shadow-sama apparently said she was called Nishimura Akane."
"In that case, she must be Nishimura Akane. After all, the Master has spoken."
"Indeed. Nishimura Akane it is, then."
"This Nishimura Akane has very interesting mana... But I think 711 will be the winner."
"I think so too."
After hearing Lambda's answer, Beta quickly expressed her agreement.
Akane and 711 were facing off in the training yard. Once Lambda gave the signal, they would begin.
Just then, the doors to the yard opened.
A petite elven girl appeared there. She looked tired and wore a white labcoat, rubbing her eyes sleepily as she walked over to Beta.
"Eta, what are you doing?"
Beta warily asked her.
The small elf was Eta, the "Seventh of the Seven". Her primary job was researching the "Wisdom of the Shadows".
"I came to see what the experimental subject looked like."
She replied in a very exhausted voice. Her dark-colored hair was curled up in a cowlick from where she'd slept on it.
"By experimental subject do you mean Nishimura Akane? Did you get permission from Alpha-sama?"
"...Of course."
Eta looked away as she said that.
"I'll confirm with Alpha-sama afterwards. You're not to touch her before that, okay?"
"There's no need to confirm with her. It's just twice the hassle."
"Do NOT touch her until I get confirmation."
Beta repeated those words, as if for emphasis.
"Hm... Her mana's weird, we should be studying it ASAP."
Eta pouted like she was throwing a tantrum.
"May we begin?"
After Lambda asked Beta and Eta, the two of them nodded.
"Now then, begin!"
The moment Lambda gave the signal, Akane and 711 both swung at each other.
"What... This girl is really strong."
Akane felt a thrill of terror as she blocked 711's first hit.
She couldn't imagine that such an opponent could land such a heavy and telling blow. It made her arm go a little numb.
<<I can't lose... I won't lose.>>
711 poured more mana into her strike and mercilessly blew Akane away.
"Aiiieee?!"
This was a novel experience for Akane, who had always been extremely strong in Japan. She had never expected herself to lose in a simple contest of magical power.
Akane barely managed to keep her guard up as she raised her sword and took a stance.
She had completely underestimated her opponent.
She had not expected someone this young to be this strong.
At this rate, she would lose.
"What a pain..."
Akane's black hair slowly turned gold.
She didn't need to win this spar.
And frankly speaking, she didn't even need to fight in the first place.
But right now, Akane sensed the importance of showing her strength.
It was a way to prove her worth.

This young girl must be quite a powerful member of the organization, Akane surmised. But she was probably not the strongest. The three people watching this fight were clearly higher-ranked than her and there were probably others who were even stronger than them.
In other words, it would be very difficult for Akane to leave this organization with her own strength. She would need to find a way to return to Japan while within the organization.
That being the case, it would be best for her to show her worth and improve her standing here.
A chance to escape would present itself someday.
After making up her mind, Akane unleashed her mana.
Following which, her black hair turned a lovely gold color.
"Sorry, but I'll be going all-out now."
After taking her stance, Akane gradually closed in on her opponent.
711 watched her warily, an unhappy look on her face.
The distance between the two of them was gradually shrinking.
And then, Akane made her move.
Golden mana swept across with incredible speed.
711 reflexively blocked the attack with her sword, but her eyes went wide at the sheer power of her opponent's offensive.
The shrill sound of scraping metal came from her opponent's blade and her arms went a little numb.
—She's overpowering me.
Having realized this, 711 leaped back to disperse the force of the blow.
Even so, she could not fully dissipate it.
Her face twisted  as she felt the sharp pain coming from her right arm.
It would seem she had been hurt.
However, 711 soon wiped the look off her face and took her stance again.
She calmly studied Akane.
It was at this point that 711 finally regained her calm.
She forgot about the pressure which Lambda and Beta were exerting on her and faced Akane, in the truest sense of the word.
She gently exhaled, and adjusted her mana levels.
The air around her became as clear as flowing water.
She had learned swordsmanship before, but it had been less than two weeks since she had started learning how to manage her mana.
This was 711's true strength, the reason why Lambda had called her talent outstanding.
<<...I won't lose.>>
711 muttered those words seemingly to herself.
"What's with this girl..."
Akane began to feel a little nervous as the girl opposite her began to radiate something of the feeling of an expert.
This should have been a good chance to press the attack.
Akane had sensed that 711 was hurt during their exchange of blows just now.
If she had followed up appropriately, she could have ended the match right there and then.
However, she could not do it.
711's eyes seemed to have seen through everything.
Such an opponent was very dangerous.
"I'm not going to lose either."
Although neither party understood each other, their clash allowed Akane to sense that 711 was also bearing her own burden.
Even so, Akane was also determined not to lose.
She had made up her mind to meet him again.
"Yeeeeeeeeeeart!"
<<Hmmmm?!>>
The two of them clashed, their blades colliding.
Once, twice, three times...
Initially, it had been Akane's sword which had overwhelmed her opponent. That had been due to the difference between their mana potency.
Six times, seven times, eight times...
However, 711's swordsmanship became more precise over the course of the battle. No, she was honing it with Akane's magical power.
The number of times 711's sword barely missed Akane's body was starting to increase.
"Kagenou-kun, lend me your strength...!"
After about 20 or so bouts, Akane was in a very precarious position.
She was keenly aware that she would lose at this rate.
However, 711 had been waiting for this moment.
She had been baiting Akane.
Waiting for her to make this very move.
After all, it was 711 who would lose if the battle kept up.
711 struck at the best possible moment.
And at that moment, 711's right arm made cracking noises.
Her bones had broken.
"Argh..."
711's sword wavered for an instant.
At that very instant, Akane struck with her own blow.
"Kagenou-kun..."
And thus, the match was settled.
"Did they actually knock each other out..."
"I certainly wasn't expecting that."
Beta and Lambda said  so from where they were watching the fallen pair from outside the ring.
"711 is as outstandingly talented as you said. However, I'll have to mark her down for her lack of calm at the beginning."
"That was my fault for not properly teaching her. I will retrain her immediately."
"711's individual strength was slightly superior. However, the quality of Nishimura Akane's mana was quite abnormal. It wasn't just its quantity, but it had apparently mutated in some way..."
"Is it because her mana comes from a different world than ours? Or are you saying she's a special case...?"
"I don't know. In any case, I'll be asking her a lot of questions to find out more once she calms down— hold on!"
Beta grabbed Eta by the collar halfway through her reply.
"I'm really interested in that weird mana of hers..."
Eta scrabbled like a cockroach as she tried to approach Akane.
"Eta! You are not to go near her until we get Alpha-sama's permission!"
"But she might be dead by the time I get permission."
"She won't die just like that!"
"Time is money. My mission is to prevent losses from making such stupid choices."
"Yes yes yes, in any case, I am NOT going to allow it."
"Muuu... Then I'll use you as a test subject next time, Beta."
"Ugh... If you dare, I'll report you to Alpha-sama!"
"Muuu... My budget's going to get cut... But if I give in to intimidation here, it'll affect our development of Shadow Wisdom..."
Eta's voice trailed off as she fell into thought.
"Quick, get them both to the sickbay now. I'll explain our future plans after they wake up."
"What do you plan to do after this?"
"In any case, we'll need you to help train Nishimura Akane until she gets settled down. We'll be having her help us in various ways after that."
"Understood."
Lambda signaled her people to have Akane and 711 sent to the sickbay.
"Ugh... Where is this place...?"
After waking up, Akane found herself on a soft white bed.
This appeared to be an infirmary of some sort.
"Did I... lose? No, I should have hit..."
Akane's attempt to take her opponent by surprise at the end of the battle had been completely seen through by her opponent.
Normally, she should have lost. However, her opponent had paused her attack for some reason and in the end they had both hit each other at practically the same time.
Akane did not remember anything after that.
Akane sat up and surveyed her surroundings. It was then that she spotted the white-haired girl on the bed beside hers.
"Looks like a double KO."
Akane couldn't help but sigh in relief as she realized that the other girl wasn't hurt."
Her sleeping face was very youthful and very cute.
However, this young girl had completely surpassed Akane in strength.
Her experience in real battles allowed her to realize that she would definitely lose in their next encounter.
The white-haired girl frowned as she muttered something.
"Is she dreaming? Is she okay?"
Akane approached her and patted her head.
"It's okay, it's okay..."
The fact that even a little girl like this had to fight suggested that this world might be in as bad a state as Japan.
After Akane gently patted her head, the girl's expression gradually softened.
And then, she slowly opened her eyes and looked at Akane.
"Ah, you're awake. Are you alright?"
The white-haired girl smiled warmly as she looked at through sleep-blurred eyes.
<<Mom... Where's Dad...?"
But just as she reached out to Akane, an angelic smile on her face, she suddenly came to her senses.
<<You, you're...!>>
The girl leaped back in panic and drew back from Akane.
"Look, calm down, please."
<<Kuh... Stay back! How could I...!>>
"Moving so vigorously all of a sudden is dangerous, you know."
<<How could I... lose...? Did, did I lose...?>> The girl looked around and gradually, she seemed to realize her circumstances.
"Calm down. It's okay."
<<I lost... Even though I shouldn't have lost in a place like this..."
Tears began welling up in the girl's eyes.
"What's wrong? Did something sad happen?"
Akane reached out to her, but the girl swatted her hand away.
Reaching out to someone in this new world was taboo. Akane had learned that now.
<<D-Don't touch me... Uuu.. I, I'll never cry again, I promised...>> The girl jumped off the bed while wiping her tears away.
And then, she ran off while holding back her sobs.
"Is she going to be alright..."
Akane looked worriedly at the girl as she left.
However, she could not speak the language, and thus there was nothing she could do.
"You awoke ~desu."
Just then, the silver-haired Beta entered the room.
"Ah, that girl ran off while crying just now..."
"It's okay ~desu."
While she didn't know what was okay, Beta had said so, so it was?
Akane realized there would be no point in telling her about it.
"Ah, what's going to happen to me from now on? What do you have in mind? Can I still go back to Japan?
"I understand. I very understand."
Beta held Akane's hand. There was a suspicious smile on her face as she said that.
"Ah, okay."
"I, your friend. One day, will return you to Japan."
"Can, can I go back to Japan?"
"Return yes probably, but if you don't cooperate then no."
"Ehh, are you threatening me?"
"No desu. Extremely difficult skill issue ~desu."
"Ah, okay."
"So please work with us."
"Sure, as long as it's within my abilities."
Although she didn't quite trust them, Akane realized that it would be a waste of effort to argue with her here.
No matter how she looked at it, she would need to investigate this organization in depth to return to Japan.
Rather than be considered an unwilling subject, it would be better if they treated her as a cooperative partner.
"Thank you very much. Akane good person ~desu. I, am your ally
~desu."
"Ah, okay."
"You, become member of this organization for now ~masu. This organization name is Shadow Garden."
"So you want me to become part of Shadow Garden? What kind of organization is it?"
"We hide in the shadows and hunt shadows, ~desu."
"That's pretty cool."
While she had no idea what sort of things they did, it had a very Isekai flavor to it, Akane thought.
Now that she thought about it, she'd always liked cool things like this.
She couldn't help but smile nostalgically as the thought came to mind.
"From now on, you are a number ~masu. You are 712 ~desu. You are no more Nishimura Akane ~desu."
"So I'm going to be addressed by a number, then... Huh? Nishimura Akane?"
Akane's thought processes suddenly ground to a halt after she was addressed by that name.
"You are Nishimura Akane. No?"
"Nishimura Akane... Why did you call me by that name?"
Only one person had ever called Akane by that name in the past.
"Is it not Nishimura Akane?"
"Yes, it is. It's okay. I was just curious as to how you learned my name."
"I see. I heard it from someone."
"So you heard it from someone, then..."
It would be one thing if she was just imagining things.
But if it wasn't her imagination... Akane's heart raced.
Calm down. I can't let myself be exposed just yet.
"Yes ~desu. Are you interested ~masu?"
"I'm just surprised that there's someone here who knows me. Is he Japanese?"
In order not to appear suspicious, Akane continued speaking in the same disinterested tone as before.
"Fufufu, that is secret ~desu. But everyone in that base knew Akane's name. Nothing suspicious ~desu."
It was just as Beta had said.
Everyone knew the name Nishino Akane in the base. But only one person ever called her Nishimura Akane.
If he was here, then Akane's goals would be completely different.
"Ah, that does seem to be the case. I must have forgotten."
Akane scratched her face in what looked like embarrassment. Beta smiled and kept her eyes firmly trained on her.
"From now on you are 712 and you will live in Shadow Garden ~desu."
"So I'm 712, then? I understand."
"I will show you to your living area, 712 ~desu. Please come with me
~desu."
Beta took Akane's hand and led her out of the sickbay.
The corridor outside the sickbay was made of stone.
The beautiful masonry and arched ceiling were illuminated by soft, indirect lighting.
Interesting. By itself, this place had a very Isekai fantasy feel to it. But in that case, what was with the room where Akane woke up?
For some reason, it reminded her of modern Japan. It was as though someone had tried to recreate Japanese technology in another world.
"712, is there something that bothers you ~desu?"
Beta said from ahead of her.
"No, I was just thinking that this was a completely different world, so it all felt new to me."
"That's wonderful ~desu. That was the sickbay ~desu. People go there when they're hurt. Also, this is the toilet ~desu."
"So that's the restroom."
"It's a toilet ~desu."
"So it's a toilet, hm."
She seemed to be a big fan of it.
Looking inside, she saw that the tiled floor was divided into several cubicles. There was a large wall-to-wall mirror inside and surprisingly enough, there were actually flush toilets here.
"Flush toilets, I see."
"Newest technology ~desu."
Beta said smugly.
Akane's doubts grew deeper. This restroom looked like it had been copied over from Japan.
"Who made this?"
"Eta was creator."
"Eta?"
"Small elf in white coat watching match with us."
"Oh, her."
Akane remembered that there had been an elf in a white coat before the match started.
"But original knowledge not from Eta. From That Man ~desu."
"Which man?"
"Secret ~desu."
Beta smiled meaningfully to her.
"That man" again.
There was no doubt that "That Man" had joined Japan's technology to that of this world.
However, she could not yet be sure that "That Man" was the "Him" that Akane knew.
"Next is cafeteria ~desu."
After that, Beta brought her to a spacious, airy place.
Although it was quiet now because mealtime was over, it should have been able to comfortably accommodate several hundred people.
"This is amazing..."
Both the sprawling area and the decorations on the walls and ceiling stunned Akane.
"Are you hungry ~desu?"
"Ah, a little..."
"Let's get you something ~masu."
After Beta showed Akane a seat, she went to get some food.
The chairs and table where Akane was seated were all high-quality items.
The table was over ten meters long and made of a single polished slab of material, while the chairs were inscribed with intricate patterns and felt very comfortable to sit in.
Wait, was this the work of a certain famous interior designer...
"...Looks like it."
Although the famous chair that Akane knew was not carved like this, the overall design was practically identical to the work of that famed designer.
That being the case, she had no choice but to regard all the interior decorations here in a suspicious light.
Could that light have been... Was that cutlery... She began to see his shadow in everything around her.
"This is no good..."

All she was doing was seeing what she wanted to see. All these were items used by humanoids, so it followed that there was a high chance that they would look similar. That thought finally let Akane quiet her heart down.
"Why were you gawking at just now ~desu?"
"Ah, everything here was so exotic that I couldn't help looking."
By the time she came to her senses, Beta was seated opposite her.
Her elf and beast-girl subordinates had already set the table for them.
"This, this is..."
"What's the matter ~desu?"
There was no mistaking the dishes in front of Akane for anything but Japanese cuisine.
"Why is there Japanese food here..."
"I ate the same thing in Japan ~desu."
"A-Ah, so that's how it is."
Indeed, Beta had assumed the name "Natsume" for her activities in Japan.
It wouldn't be strange for her to reproduce the food, drink and culture she had encountered in Japan, but...
"The miso... you even managed to copy the soya sauce."
Could she really imitate these flavorings in such a short time? Of course, there was a chance that Beta had brought some back from Japan.
"It's good..."
The bonito stock in the miso soup gave it a sublime flavor.
"Glad that you like it ~desu."
Beta skilfully began eating with the chopsticks.
She finished it all, as though she didn't want Akane to be suspicious of her.
"Delicious ~desu."
Just as they finished their meal, a familiar-looking girl appeared behind Beta.
<<Alpha-sama's given her permission.>> Her name was Eta, apparently. This sleepy-eyed girl in a lab coat began talking to Beta in this world's language.
<<Eh, really?>>
Beta glanced dubiously at the document Eta passed her.
<<Yup. Alpha-sama signed a permission form. It says Nishimura Akane is to be handled by Eta.>>
Her ears twitched upon hearing "Nishimura Akane".
<<So be it, then.>>
Eta quickly ducked under the table to grab Akane.
<<Hold on! Despite what the document says, there are two suspicious things about it.>>
<<W-What?>>
Eta's eyes shifted around after Beta grabbed her by the collar.
<<If Alpha-sama DID give you permission, she would never hand the task to you alone. She'd arrange for someone to supervise you.>>
<<Um... this is because of my daily performance and accumulated trust in me...>>
<<Also, the handwriting on this document is weak and sluggish. It's almost as though someone was trying to imitate Alpha-sama's handwriting and slowly copied it.>>
<<W-What are you talking about...>>
Eta broke out in a cold sweat.
<<Eta. You forged this document, didn't you?>> After Beta glared at her, Eta put on a twitching smile.
<<Just give up on this. I'll go to Alpha-sama right now—>>
<<Fine, I've had it.>>
Eta interrupted Beta with a cold voice.
<<In that case, I'll take her by force.>> In the next moment, Akane's world turned upside down.
"Wa-aaaaaaaaiiiiiieeee?!"
Akane was bound up by black slime and then suspended upside down.
Although she tried her hardest to struggle, the slime was incredibly strong and didn't budge.
When she tried infusing mana into it, it felt like it had been sucked away.
<<Eta, what are you doing?!>>
Beta and her subordinates had been tied up as well.
<<Taking her by force. Talking to muggles is just a waste of time.>> Saying so, Eta prepared to leave with the trussed-up Akane.
<<Hold it right there, I said hold it!!>> Beta sliced up the black slime and then generated a black sword, which she used to slice at Eta.
Eta narrowed her eyes, then transformed the slime.
She created a huge shield from it.
Beta's sword crashed into the shield.
Thunk. There was a dull sound.
<<What the hell's with this shield?!"
Beta's sword did not so much as scratch Eta's shield.
In fact her sword was being absorbed by the shield.
Somewhat panicked, Beta quickly pulled her sword free and backed away.
<<This is a new technology, it reacts to and absorbs mana.>>
<<I've never heard of it before! Weren't you supposed to tell us immediately if you came up with anything useful?!>> When strengthened by mana, a sword was naturally stronger than a shield.
This was a simple matter of surface area.

A sword only needed to be hardened at its edge. In contrast, a shield needed to be enhanced across its entire surface. Trying to strengthen a shield to the same hardness as a sword would require several times for mana.
This was why very few magic swordsmen opted to use shields.
<<Um... The safety tests weren't finished yet. I was planning to report it in a few days' time.>>
<<You were never planning to do this test, were you?>> As they spoke, Beta slashed at Beta with incredibly smooth, flowing movements.
Akane could not help but applaud those movements which she could barely follow with her eyes.
"She, she's amazing..."
Akane understood why Beta, this somewhat suspicious girl, was so respected in the organization. Compared to her, 711's movements were like an infant's.
<<Quit getting in my way.>>
Meanwhile, Beta's opponent Eta was also skilled beyond her imagination.

She controlled the slime like it was an extension of her body, generating shields, swords, spears and the like to meet each incoming attack. While it was hardly the same as pure martial technique, one could say that it was something which only someone who had honed their skills to the utmost could do.
Her mana control and creativity were extraordinary.
Both of them were evenly-matched... No. It would seem neither of them had gotten serious yet.
They were fighting at a level where they were not quite about to hurt each other.
Also, Akane's instincts told her that neither of them had revealed their hole cards yet.
<<Dammit, behave already!>>
<<Muuuu?>>
Beta's hit had knocked Eta away.
Eta conjured up a shield to defend herself while dissipating the force of the blow in mid-air through careful slime control.
However, there was a grim look on Eta's face.
Beta's subordinates raised their swords and surrounded Eta.
<<This is...>>
<<That's enough, just give up already.>> Beta said smugly.
<<Eta-sama, pardon us, but we will be detaining you now.>> Nu, Lambda, Chi, Omega, and the other Numbers soon gathered.
Even Eta could not help but turn gloomy when she saw this.
<<If you abandon your weapons and sincerely apologize, I'll consider lightening your punishment.??
Beta slowly closed in as she slowly turned up the pressure.
<<I say, what's going on here?>>
Just then, a girl with hair as lustrous as a clear lake appeared.
She was Epsilon the Precise, the "Fifth of the Seven".
<<Two Shades and a whole bunch of others... This is somewhat tricky."
Eta muttered quietly.
Several of the people classified under "others" frowned.
Still, that was only to be expected.
Everyone here was a highly-skilled expert.
Both the way they condensed their mana and held their weapons were a sign of how strong they were.
What was truly startling was that each and every one of them was far stronger than Akane.
Whether it was because of pride in their abilities or the confidence they felt due to their long experience...
That was the reason why they could not help but feel displeased when lumped into "a whole bunch of others".
Yet despite this displeasure, not a single one of them dared object. After all, they understood that they WERE in fact a whole bunch of others.
<<You're just in time, Epsilon. Help me get this dork under control.>>
<<Yes yes, I'll lend you a hand, Beta.>> The two of them quickly finished sharing their opinions.
Epsilon understood that it was definitely Eta's fault this time round.
Beta and Epsilon moved to flank Eta, while the others crowded around closely.
<<Fine, I get it. That's enough.>>
Eta raised her hands, as though she had given up.
<<Are you surrendering, then?>>

Despite what Beta said, nobody was dumb enough to actually lower their guard because of that. Eta had not dropped her weapon and nobody here believed that she would actually surrender, given her personality.
<<...To all you ladies who are bullying me. Surrender now or you will regret it.>>
Despite being surrounded by everyone and with her hands up, Eta said something unexpected instead.
<<Do you think I'll actually surrender?>> Epsilon replied, her caution at maximum.
<<Hm, is there anyone here who's going to surrender?>> Eta looked around herself.
Everyone was wary of her, but nobody seemed willing to give up.
<<I see. Negotiations have broken down, then.>>
<<Indeed, they have.>>
Eta and Beta spoke in unison.
<<Everyone, subdue Eta!>>
And then, everyone moved.
And then, right after that, everyone melted.
<<What?!>>
Their mana grew turbulent and their clothes and weapons melted.
<<What the heck is this!!!!!?!>>
Although Beta barely managed to keep her outfit intact, most of the others were half-naked and it was plain to see that further fighting would be very difficult.
<<I just used electronic waves as described in the Wisdom of the Shadows, "Mana Disruptor Field (Me Excepted)."
<<If you developed something like that, then at least report it first!!>>
<<Well, the activation conditions are tricky and it can only be used in certain circumstances...>>
<<That's enough!! In that case, we'll just have to think of something together, Epsilon!>>
Beta addressed her comrade.
However, Epsilon was nowhere to be seen. In her place was a note on the table.
<<I suddenly remembered I had an urgent mission so I'm off now bye. -
Epsilon>>
<<Aaaaaaaaahhhh, that damn woman!>> Beta roared.
<<Ah, an opening.>>
As Beta gave vent to her wrath, Eta hit her and she immediately passed out before keeling over.
And then, Eta took Akane away.
"Urgh... Where is this?"
Akane opened her eyes and discovered that she was in a dark basement.
She was bound to a bed by the black slime.
Around her were various scientific devices and junk of unknown provenance, all tightly packed together.
How many times have I been kidnapped recently, anyway? As she thought about that, she couldn't help but sigh quietly.
Though she tried to struggle, her bindings would not budge. The capabilities of this black slime alone were awe-inspiring.
"Is someone there?"
Akane yelled.
At first, she could not see anything due to the heaps of junk and the dark environment. However, she sensed that someone was moving around nearby.
That someone moved toward Akane.
A face protruded from behind the pile of junk. It belonged to the girl in white called Eta.
"You're Eta, right? What are you going to do to me?"
<<So you're awake. Surprisingly resilient... I should probably have used a stronger sedative.>>
Eta muttered to herself in the other world's language.
Although Akane had no idea what she was saying, just looking at her eyes made Akane shudder.
Eta's eyes did not seem like they were looking at a human being.
Rather, they were cold and emotionless, like she was an experimental animal... no, just a piece of experimental data.
She did not regard Akane as a human being.
Eta approached the bed and looked down on Akane. The aloof expression in her eyes remained the same.
<<Breathing normal, pulse slightly elevated, subject is in a state of mild anxiety.>>
She touched Akane's body without any hesitation.
<<Condition normal. No changes needed to the plan.>> She spoke in a monotone as though confirming to herself.
"What did you say? What are you going to do to me?"
Even when Akane addressed her, Eta merely responded with a cold look.
<<Presence or absence of consciousness will not affect the plan.
However, the vocal cords are annoying. They might prove to be a distraction.

Should I sever them or simply anesthetize her... Since I'll be dissecting the specimen anyway, I might as well remove the vocal cords for study. No, before that, I should confirm my ability to converse in the other world's language.>> She seemed to be organizing her thoughts by talking to herself.
Although she sounded like she was speaking to Akane, she had not paid any attention to the latter at all.
"What have you been talking about since just now, anyway?"
After saying this, Eta looked at Akane for the first time."
"Ah– Ahhh– a e i o u. Is that how you vocalize your vowels?"
Eta calmly said.
"Y-You can talk?"
"All intelligent lifeforms follow similar speech patterns. He said so, and it turned out to be correct."
Akane was shocked when she heard Eta speaking in fluent Japanese.
Both her pronunciation and understanding were several levels above Beta's.
"What do you have in mind? What are you going to do to me?"
"Experimentation. I plan to satisfy my intellectual curiosity."
"And, and what does that entail?"
