"First we will begin with conversation and understanding communication patterns and thought processes. After that we will proceed to a physical examination, mana examination and cerebral knowledge recovery."
"Wait, when you say "cerebral knowledge recovery"..."

"Knowledge from another world is very precious, but information obtained through conversation will include lies and irrelevant data. All that wastes time. As a result, we will be using this to solve the problem."
As she said this, Eta pointed at a large piece of junk beside her.
The coffin-like object was covered in tubes and cables, and it occasionally belched steam.
It looked very suspicious.
"W-What is this...?"
"This is Brainsucker-kun Mk XXIII, the last word in extracting human knowledge and leaving nothing behind. After many failed previous incarnations, it is finally complete... I think."
"So you're saying you only THINK it's complete...?"

"I referenced a thesis from Academy City Laugus, "The Brain And Mana; Possibilities Of Using Mana to Interfere With, Damage Or Heal The Brain As Well As Plans For Practical Applications, by Sherry Barnett". If anything goes wrong, it's all her fault, so it'll be fine. I thought Laugus was full of intransigent blockheads, but it turned out there really were some capable researchers there too. She was one of them. Come to think of it, Sherry Barnett's holding a conference in Laugus, maybe I should go take a look..."
Eta muttered a whole bunch of unreliable and irresponsible nonsense to herself.
"Listen you, what the heck have you been doing since just now? What do you even treat me as, anyway?"
"A somewhat valuable lifeform. I think you'd be around... five levels below him in orders of importance?"
"What? I'm a valuable lifeform? Also, who is this he...?"
"He is he... He's a lifeform who's far more valuable than you. It was thanks to him that we learned the foundation of the language you speak."
"Japanese... and it was thanks to him, don't tell me you..."
She had a bad feeling about this.
If he had been the one to teach Eta Japanese, and if he had been captured by the woman who didn't even treat people as people...
"Are you worried about him? He helped out with Brainsucker-Kun Mk XIX and ended up fine in the end, so Mk XXIII should be fine too."
"What... You used that crazy machine on him?! Did he even consent to it?!"
"Consent... is an optional concept. I simply tricked him a little and forced him to participate. He was really sturdy though, so it was fine."
"Forced... You just forced him to take part in your experiments, didn't you...!"
Calm down, Akane told herself. There's still no confirmation that he's the person I have in mind.
Akane took a deep breath and suppressed her anger.

"Well... If by experiments you mean stuff on the level of testing venom that could kill a dragon, attempting to extract and dissect his brain tissue or attempting to extract his mana circuits... I suppose, yes."
Eta blasely replied.
Akane gritted her teeth so hard they started to make grinding noises.
"Tell me. Who is this person you're talking about...?"
Akane spoke in a furious yet trembling voice.
"He is him... Hm— It's hard to describe him. Ah, he's the person who wrote this."
Saying so, Eta handed a note written in Japanese to Akane.
The content of the note was trivial, but Akane knew the handwriting very well.
"How did you... How could this, this handwriting, could it be...
Kagenou-kun."
Tears welled up in Kane's eyes.
She was certain of it. This note was definitely written by Kagenou Minoru.
At that moment, all the questions in Akane's heart joined up.
Kagenou Minoru was in this world.
That truck accident had sent him to another world, where he had become an experimental subject for this girl called Eta and had his knowledge of Japan stolen.
In that case, the body left behind by that accident must have been faked.
No, it was possible that even the accident itself had been staged through technology from another world.

When she thought of how he had suddenly had his home taken from him, how he had been split apart from his family and friends, dragged to another world and forced to live a cruel and tragic life, Akane began to tremble in anger.
"You... What have you done to him? How, how is he now?!"
"Oh, he's fine... for the moment."
"What do you mean, "for the moment"? What are you planning to do to him?"
"Oh, experimentation and dissection."
"Say what?! Where is he now?!"
"Ah... Well, I think the conversation's gone on long enough. I think I've got a pretty good understanding of the situation.
Eta did not seem to want to answer further questions.
She turned away from Akane. It would seem she was preparing some kind of device.
"Answer me! Where... where is he now?!"
Akane thrashed around, trying to escape her bonds, but the slime did not budge.
On the contrary, it was Akane's bones which creaked.
"Ah, it's ready."
Eta held something that looked like a collar. There seemed to be something sticky on it and it exuded a strange smell.
"What, what, what is that...!"
"This is Vocal Cord Extractor-Kun Mk I. While it's been gathering dust in the storeroom due to limited applicability, I'm sure it'll work just fine."
"No, stop..."
Eta put the mysterious collar on Akane.
"Don't worry, it won't hurt. Now then, 3, 2, 1..."
And then, right before she was about to hit the switch on the collar...
<<Stop that.>>
There was a bonk, and Eta's head shook.
<<Ah, my head~>>
Eta crouched down while grabbing her head.
<<That's enough out of you. You won't be getting off easily for what you did today.>>
There was a beautiful blonde elf standing behind Eta. She was holding a hammer made of slime.
Clearly, she had bonked Eta on the head with it.
<<W-What do you mean, brain cells won't regrow once they're damaged... Ah, my brain...>>
Eta glared at the other elf.
<<And what is that look of yours supposed to convey?"
<<I won't forgive you, even if you ARE Alpha-sama...>>
<<Take this. "Mana Disruptor Field (Me Excepted).">> However, nothing happened.
<<Eh? But why?>>
<<It seems that mana disruptor field uses radio waves."
<<Wait, don't tell me..>>
<<Sorry, but I blocked out those disruption waves.>> Saying so, Alpha removed her clothes. Below it was a silvery slime suit.
"Is, is that aluminium foil..."
<<You should know about it too, right? The Wisdom of the Shadows speaks of using aluminium foil to block radio waves.>>
<<Wait, is that legend actually true...>>
<<Now you have your answer.>>
And with that, Alpha brought the hammer down on Eta's head again.
The shocking truth left Eta briefly unable to move.
"Ugh!"
With a quiet groan, she fainted.

<<Take her away. She will be strictly punished until she has changed her ways and her research budget will be heavily reduced. After this, she will only be allowed to conduct research as I direct for the time being.>>
<<Y-yes.>>
The girls that appeared from behind her dragged the unconscious Eta away.
<<Sorry about all this trouble.>>
She freed Akane from her bonds as she spoke to her.
"Who, who are you...?"
Akane was so stricken by the sight of this beautiful elf that she could not say anything else.
<<I do not understand your language. Beta will handle the rest.>> And with that, she left.
She was so powerful it beggared belief.
Also, she was incredibly beautiful.
Akane's instincts told her that she was the strongest fighter in this organization.
"Are you alright ~desu?"
The silver-haired girl showed up soon enough and got Akane out of there.
"From now on, this will be your room, 712 ~desu."
Beta led Akane to an austere room.
"So this is my room..."
"Yes ~desu. Do you understand after I explained all that?"
"Uh, pretty much, I guess."
"Then this is a language textbook. Make sure you learn it quickly, okay?"
From what she could see of it, the title of the book was "Understanding This World's Language For Otherworldly Lifeforms."
"Ah, who's going to teach me?"
"You'll just have to figure it out practically ~desu. I might not look it but I'm very busy ~desu. That's it then. Bai bai~desu."
Beta looked away and quickly departed.
"...Eh, forget it."
It had been a crappy day, but all the things which had happened today had taken their toll.
Akane took a deep breath and then opened the door.
"It's prettier than I expected..."
There were three beds in the room.
The one in the middle was currently occupied by a girl sleeping in it.
Perhaps she had noticed Akane's presence, but the girl sat up. She was the white-haired girl who had fought Akane.
<<You, what are you...?!>>
"You, you're...?!"
Akane and the girl spoke simultaneously.
<<Why, how could this– how come our new member turned out to be you...>>
<You, so you were in this room too. Nice to meet you."
Akane quickly recovered and replied with a smile.
<<Kuh... Like hell I want to meet you..! I'm sleeping outside!>> The girl leaped off her bed and glared at Akane before running out.
Although she wasn't sure what the girl had said to her, her hostility was very much in obvious.
Akane sighed as she watched the girl leave.
Things just kept coming one after another.

From coming to another world, to not understanding the language, to being snapped up by an organization full of supermen, being stuck in a room with an unfriendly roommate; nobody here was a real friend.
However, she held onto one hope in her heart.
"I'll save you this time, Kagenou-kun...!"
Akane clenched her fist as that thought ran through her head.

c9.text: This was the scent of a tree.
As the sunlight shone through the leaves and into the window, Alpha suddenly paused in the middle of organizing her documents and looked up.
She rose and walked over to the window. There was a huge roadside tree there, standing opposite its partner and spreading its canopy over the capital.
This was the end of autumn. The roadside trees were resplendent with bright red leaves and their fragrance wafted along on the wind.
Back then, she had always been surrounded by the warm scent of trees.
Alpha closed her eyes, and recalled the past.
They had all lived together back then. Amidst that nostalgic fragrance of trees—
When Shadow Garden had been just Shadow and Alpha, Alpha had lived in the forest.
During the day, she was alone in a little house that he built.

The house was always filled with the scent of trees. He had built it himself, starting from scratch by cutting things down. Alpha had learned the secrets of the construction method called "Two By Four" from those days.
At first, all she could do was stand aside and watch. Later on, she helped out a little, and by the end, she had pretty much handled all the clean-up by herself.
It was a small house they had built together, him and her, filled with memories.
It might have been plain and even a little clumsy, but Alpha loved that little house that smelled of trees.
He would only come over in the middle of the night. And so Alpha looked forward eagerly to the coming of the night.
She practiced her mana control and swordsmanship during the day, as well as plucking mountain herbs and greens and trapping small animals.
At night, he would bring bread and meat, and Alpha would make them into dishes. Whenever they ate together, he would talk about all sorts of things.
"Steam has the power to move big chunks of steel and make them do work."
One day, he mentioned something like that while eating Alpha's stewed vegetables. Alpha carefully studied the vapour coming from the stew for a while.
No matter how she racked her brains, she still could not imagine how such feeble hot air could possess such great power.

However, everything he had said, however nonsensical it sounded, had turned out to be true. For instance, like how this world was not flat, but spherical, and how the sun did not spin around the earth, but instead it was the earth spinning around the sun. At first, Alpha felt it was impossible and denied them, but later events would prove him right.
Therefore, steam must possess some kind of great power.
"What should we do to get that kind of power out of steam?"
He briefly fell silent as he enjoyed Alpha's cooking.
He was always thinking about what should and should not be said.
"Heating water produces steam. That produces great power. If you want a hint... Piston action and turbines."
And with that, he smiled enigmatically.
He would never reveal everything all at once. Instead he would give hints and expect Alpha to think about it herself.
"But that's not enough for me to understand it..."
This was much more difficult than the usual times. While she was planning to get up early in the morning to research steam, trying to find the answer with these hints alone would take too long.
"When you harness the power of steam, you can drive vast metal carriages and sail steel ships."
However, what he gave were not hints, but examples of steam engines'
practical applications.
Being able to move such carriages and ships would be an incredible feat.
Since he said it was possible, then it must be so.
"So you're saying steam engines are worth investing all that time and money into them..."
He simply smiled enigmatically. He would always let Alpha think about things herself.
Imparting his knowledge to her in this way would train her thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Naturally, this led to her skills improving by leaps and bounds. In this way, she gained several times more knowledge than she would have when undergoing an elite education in her previous country.
Fighting strength was powerful. But wisdom was even more important than that.
Alpha had always thought she had been a smart child. Nobody could keep up with her in her home.
But even so, he — someone the same age as her — had far surpassed Alpha.
There was always someone better.
His profile seemed to glow as Alpha stared at him.
"Hm? Is something the matter?"
"Not at all."
The two ate their stew, and then he taught her swordsmanship and magic.
Before the sun went up, she watched him leave.
She would wave frantically to him every day, until she could no longer see him.
She was very happy.
As the seasons passed, their time alone came to an end.
The silver-haired girl with a beauty mark, Beta, joined them.

Beta was very shy. She was a little afraid of him, and she always hid behind Alpha. Alpha knew Beta from back when they had been in their country, and Beta knew about Alpha too. But they were not friends; the extent of their relationship had been greeting each other at social occasions. However, they had been through the same thing together and they soon bonded.
After that, Gamma and Delta had joined them, and the little house that she had lived in by herself and which had been a little lonely became quite lively.
Alpha helped expand the house with the skills she had learned from him.
They built a wonderful house, a warm home, full of the scent of trees.
One day, he finished up tutoring Delta and Gamma ahead of time, and then gathered everyone.
Delta proudly looked down on Gamma, while Gamma glared at Delta like she was going to cry. Par for the course.
"Delta is stronger than you."
"I, I'm older than you... I'm the sempai... Uuu..."
"You're pretty damn cocky, Gamma."
"W-wait, s-stop..."
Delta pushed Gamma down and mounted her from behind. That too was an everyday sight.
Supposedly dogs would mount their social inferiors so they would understand their place.
"Alright, alright, that's enough."
Alpha separated the pair. Delta was always very obedient to Alpha. She always respected the superior-inferior relationship, for better or for worse.
That was why seeing Gamma, who was weaker than herself, as a superior annoyed her immensely.
Gamma was also very annoyed by Delta's muscle-headed tendencies.
The two of them got along like chalk and cheese.
"Power is not merely strength. It has always been wisdom that rules people and the world."
He said to everyone.
"Boss...?"
"Shadow-sama..."
Delta and Gamma looked up at him. Delta had a clueless expression on her face while Gamma seemed to be trying to seek salvation.
The wind brought the scent of trees.
"I'll tell you then. This is the power to multiply the worth of a single gold coin many times over. The ways to control money, to rule the world's economy..."
After that, he told them about banks and credit creation.
"That's amazing..."
Alpha oohed and aahed like a child.
The frightening extent of his schemes and the sheer grandeur of their scale made Alpha tremble.
Beta hid behind Alpha, trembling out of fear of Shadow.
Delta twitched in her sleep from the cool night wind blowing on her.
And Gamma— Gamma trembled in awe.
Her empty, timid eyes once again shone with might.
"Shadow-sama, I... I've finally found my path."
He simply nodded.
From that day forth, Gamma changed. She began coveting his knowledge and would continue reading and studying until she had to reluctantly go to bed.
Alpha and Gamma began speaking a lot more, and then Beta joined them in planning the future of their organization.
Soon, Epsilon, Zeta and then Eta had joined them.
Epsilon was a confident and competitive girl. She also had the skills to warrant those qualities.
"I'll soon become number one!"
While she had been extremely competitive at first, she soon settled down and got along with everyone.
Although she knew that she and Beta often butted heads, that was probably a sign of their relationship.
Zeta was a beast-girl with a tragic past.
She spoke little and kept her distance from everyone.
Alpha knew about her, and so she often led her by the hand to form friendships with the other girls. Though it was only a little, she finally opened up her heart.
Her relationship with Delta was still bad, though. Granted, things were often this way between beast-men.
They could tell at a glance that "I won't get along with him/her". That sort of thing.
Eta was a mystery through and through.
While she often did a lot of strange things which caused lots of problems for everyone, her inventions often ended up helping everyone too.

Eta was bad at caring for herself, and so Epsilon took care of that. Beta and Gamma always ended up as her test subjects for some reason, while Delta and Zeta always fought. By the time she realized it, everyone had become irreplaceable members of her family.
They had all been very happy, in their house surrounded by the scent of trees.
From that day forth, Alpha had never stopped running.
She devoted all her strength to living, to the point that she didn't even pay attention to the scent of the trees.
The madder-colored sunlight dyed the room a lovely color.
"Alpha-sama, it's time."
The knock on the door came, and Gamma entered.
"Do you remember? You and I would talk, surrounded by the fragrance of the trees..."
"The fragrance of the trees...?"
Gamma stood by Alpha, looking up at the towering roadside tree.
And then she slowly breathed in the scent carried by the wind and closed her eyes.
"Ah, it takes me back..."
"The dreams we had back then are slowly taking shape... But we're still chasing our dreams, aren't we?"
"...You're right."
"We shall carry on along the path we believe in and show no mercy to those who would stand in our way. Alright, let's go."
"Yes!"
They spent less time alone together now.
But the scent of the trees from that day would always remain in her heart.

c10.text: It's been a while since I wrote in a dairy.
I've been busy and completely forgot to write.
According to him, continuing to write a diary leads to mental stability. If he says so, it must be true. Let's start writing a diary again form today. This time let's continue...

The cause of my busyness is primarily due to the matter with the Oriana Kingdom. As a result of eliminating Doem Ketsuhatoo and Mordred, the Diabolos Cult associates have been expelled from the country.
The cleanup of the remaining factions should be finished within this year. However, the roots of corruption in the Oriana Kingdom run deep.

The twisted politics and organizational structure that have been influenced by the Diabolos Cult over many years will take time to reform. Collaborating with Queen Rose Oriana, number 666... no, we are making progress, but the end is not in sight.

Above all, changing the national character, which is revealed through the culture of despising swordsmages, is perhaps our most significant challenge. Ibushiron has started a new play called "Magical Swordsmage Girl Sailor... San," drawing inspiration from his ideas.
It has received more support than expected from the citizens of this country of arts. The newcomers of Shadow Garden are dressed in sailor-style combat suits, made from slime suits.
Transformed into a sailor outfit, they perform impressive action scenes in this magical girl saga. However, I personally prefer the Shadow Lord Mask over the Sailor Warriors.
If this could become the catalyst for changing the national character,  that would be great... The national character is indeed the biggest wall blocking reform.

Gamma and Eta have been leading the plan to establish a Shadow Garden base of human scale within the Oriana Kingdom, and it's going well. Thanks to Gamma's arrangements and the results of Eta's research, it seems like we will finish sooner than expected.
The difficulty of creating a massive underground base wth high-powered mining equipment will be a significant reference for future base constructions.
We also plan to move some production bases underground, which will reduce the risk of information leakage and cut down on security costs.
Thanks to that, it seems we will be able to provide more substantial support to the Oriana Kingdom.
By the way, I sent Delta to find Zeta, and after a long time, we finally got a report from Zeta. She must have been tired of being chased around bty Delta.
It's always better not to report to me directly to avoid being tracked. According to Zeta's report, the movements of the Begarta Empire seem suspicious.
The war might start in full scale once the snow melts. I hope Oriana Kingdom will be ready by then... Oh who could that be?
It's rare to have someone at this time. It seems like an urgent report has just come in.

This is terrible. A civil war seems to have broken out in the Elf country. We had numbers investigate it beforehand, but I enver thought it would come to this... There are high-ranking Rounds in that country, and this might be too much for just the Numbers to handle.

We need to send the Seven Shadows quickly... And we should also report to him. He probably already has more accurate information than us, but still. Well, if he decides to move, perhaps it's been a while, but I might join the fight myself...
